Alberto Aguilar, Edra Soto and Christa Donner at the first Antiquarian Luncheon.SHoP (Southside Hub of Production) was founded in 2010 by Laura 
Shaeffer, Mike Phillips and John Preus.  SHoP’s main aim is to stimulate
 local cultural activity and to foster 
artistic and cultural enrichment in the neighborhood, with the aim of 
reclaiming the commons and the networks of interdependency that create a
 fulfilling economy. SHoP serves as a platform for artists young and old, writers, film-makers, 
craftspeople and educators and local civic organizations to gather and 
exchange resources and expertise, curate exhibits, host events and 
workshops, and provide space for local groups to meet. 
SHoP Now:
In
 the spring of 2015, Top Studios, our former benefactor, invited 
SHoP to run the  project space in a 
beautiful storefront in Hyde Park, formerly occupied by the inspiring 
and beloved O'Gara and Wilson Antiquarian Bookstore. Our vision for the current space is to set up a shared studio and production hall in the back, with makers units and tables for bookbinding, sewing and design, and self -publishing as well as other creative workshops and after-school arts activities. The studio would be well organized and flexible enough to accommodate events, film screenings and weekly salon nights as well to provide space for writer's groups, and other communities of practice. The front display area would be used to showcase the objects made in the back production hall as well as provide space for self-published works from all over Chicago and beyond, feature editions and objects of interest and usefulness from local designers and, as well as objects of curiosity in keeping with the curatorial tradition of the former bookstore.We plan to curate a series of large-scale exhibits that are participatory in nature, lasting 3 months each that would provide an atmosphere of reflection and community interest. 
Since May of 2015, we have offered art 
classes to all ages; held film
 screenings, ran two intensive summer camps and hosted literary events 
and 
public forums on a variety of topics. Our first exhibit, curated by Jorge Lucero was The Barack Obama Presidential Library it opened June 5  and was featured in DNAInfo, the Sun-Times,  WTTW's Chicago Tonight 
local ABC news, and WBEZ, among other media. BOPL Press

Opening night of The Barack Obama Presidential Library, June 5, 2015.Top Studios had committed to a three-year lease beginning this past May, but abruptly withdrew its funding in July.We
 would like to continue to curate exhibits and offer shared studio 
space for workshops, performances and events that foster a sense of art and human possibility outside of existing commercial and 
institutional venues. But in order to achieve this we 
need your help. We have been generously given a window of 
reduced 
rent allowing us to establish a proof of concept.  Due to Top Studios’ 
sudden financial withdrawal, we need 
to raise a minimum of $6,000 to cover 
operational costs and rent through the end of the calendar year, and 
$15,000 is our ultimate goal to stay beyond that time and invest in 
shared resources such as a large film screen, sound system, mic, tables, 
and rolling cabinets for our workshops and classes. We will continue to 
research grants 
and other forms of funding to help us become sustainable. Your donations
 are tax-deductible through our fiscal sponsor, the Resource Center, http://www.resourcecenterchicago.org/

Thank you for your time and continued support. All contributions are appreciated and we look forward to seeing you soon!Thank you to all who have participated in SHoP projects, past, present, and future.
Artists Union diagram: main room with Incidental Chair Collection by John Preus. Photos by Lizzy Szwaya.
For two years, 
with support from the First Unitarian Church of Hyde Park and supporter 
and philanthropist Dr. Ken Schug, we were housed in a 16-room mansion 
in Hyde Park called the Fenn House. 


Photograph on the wall by Rachel Herman.

Red Flags family salon by John Preus and Kevin Reiswig. photo by Lizzy Szwaya.
After
 leaving the mansion at the end of our scheduled tenure there, we 
continued to program events and classes, and curate exhibits in other 
venues, one example is Ben Hecht's House Party, curated by Laura Shaeffer and Paul Durica: Ben Hecht's House Party.
Edra Soto hosts Happy Hours at the Antiquarian (housed inside the storefront).
Antiquarian Happy Hour: Tender: Edra Soto.

Antiquarian Luncheon. Jorge Lucero and Alberto Aguilar.


Alberto Aguilar, Edra Soto and Christa Donner at the first Antiquarian Luncheon.A brief history of The Op Shop and SHoPThe Op Shop, the precursor project to SHoP, was initiated by Laura Shaeffer in 2009. Inspired by a long tradition of magical curiosity shops that have appeared for centuries in fiction and in real life, she imagined using some of the many vacant storefronts in Hyde Park on a temporary basis to create sites of independent cultural exchange. The Op Shop occupied four different storefront locations on 55th street between Lake Park and Cornell, at 53rd and Lake Park in Harper Court and finally at 53rd and Ellis,  before morphing into its next, more ambitious project: SHoP: the Southside Hub of Production. The Op Shop asked these questions: What do we have, what do we lack, and how do we use what we have to create the world we need?. Op Shop 1, 2009. Window painting by Anders Nilsen: Swamp Trees. Photo by David Schalliol.Op Shop 2, Adhocity, 2010: Cardboard signs leading the visitor around to the various projects of alternative and small-economy building, by Chris Lin and Kayce Bayer. Photo by Rachel Tredon.Outside Op Shop 2 (in the old Hollywood Video store). Paul Durica's, " The Mystery of Al Capone's Vault" .Op Shop 3, 30 Days/30 People: calendar of people and events. Photo by Rachel Tredon.
Mabel's Wayback Machine, by Kayce Bayer and Chris Lin.Tango Milonga. Photo By Rachel Tredon





Op Shop 4, AgriCULTURE: Lia Rousset and Amber Ginsberg. Community potluck.
Community Potluck. Photo by Lizzy Szwaya




Thank you to all our past and current collaborators, volunteers and supportive fellow forward -thinkers and idealists. SHoP is nothing without the people who make it happen.There are too many names to ever mention here, we are grateful to all!A special thanks to our current core team:Jeremy CohenMarrissa CoccaroThomas K FlynnCandice RalphKirsten Srinivasan: The Little SHoP of WritersThanks to our curators, participating artists and teachers:Alberto AguilarJim Duignan Stockyard InstituteRegin Igloria  North Branch ProjectsRebecca Keller: Adjunct Professor, Art History, Theory and CriticismArt Education SculptureBen KodichekWilfried Kuehn http://kuehnmalvezzi.com/Nitsana LazerusJorge Lucero http://www.jorgelucero.com/Pages/default.aspxMike Phillips South Side ProjectionsLavie Raven: University of Hip HopBart Schulz: Executive Director, Civic Knowledge ProjectAmy SinclairHoyun SonNorman Teague
Special thanks to Kione Konchi for her sweet drawings for our t-shirts and posters.Thanks to Kevin Reiswig for building us beautiful  shelves to house our growing collection of self -published works.Thanks to Marc Fischer, Brett Bloom and Ed Mar for allowing us to carry the wonderful booklets from Half Letter Press  and Temporary Services, and to Lumpen Times, Mash Tun and Proximity Magazine on commission and the generous help they have provided!

story:
SELINUNTE

OPEN  MUSEUM ON THE NECROPOLIS

CAM Campus Archeologico Museale (Archaeological Museum Campus)

The Kepha Foundation is an organization that promotes human and social advancement in Italy and the internationally. It pursues humanitarian goals of moral and social solidarity, without making distinctions on the basis of religion, race, age and nationality. Kepha (rock/stone in Aramaic) best sums up the Foundations mandate to focus on the enhancement of every person and people.

Formed in 1989, the Kepha Foundation has been recognized and registered in the Register of Legal Persons of the Prefecture of Rome in 2001 as a Non-Profit Organization of Social Utility.

Though headquartered in Rome, the Kepha Foundation also has an office in Triscina di Selinunte, Sicily, located in the archaeological area of ​​the ancient Greek city of Selinunte, which lies in the municipality of Castelvetrano (TP). This office was established as CAM Campus Archeologico Museale (Archaeological Museum Campus).

The Kepha Foundation pays special attention to culture and art, basic elements for each person. For the Foundation, the promotion and preservation of cultural heritage, the conservation of works of art, the rediscovery of handicraft, the recovery of the artistic heritage, and the organization and planning of cultural initiatives are essential for laying the path to education to beauty and culture, a goal the Foundation has pursued since its inception.

These are the principles that inspired the Foundation to create the CAM Campus Archeologico Museale (Archaeological Museum Campus). For years, through the CAM, the Foundation has held cultural activities, conducted research, and contributed to the preservation and enhancement of the historic and archaeological heritage of the necropolis of the ancient Greek city of Selinunte, which partly extends onto land owned by the Kepha Foundation. Since the Foundation settled itself in Sicily, it has acquired ten hectares of land only a few hundred meters from the Archaeological Park of Selinunte. In this area, the Kepha Foundation has worked to conserve nature, restoring the historic cultivation of the territory, such as the olive trees, and reclaiming the land from every kind of outrage suffered during decades of neglect. These actions have allowed nature to take its course again, protecting native tree species of the territory and the Macchia Mediterranea (Mediterranean shrubland ecosystem), which animals have begun to re-inhabit.

Looking around the Perks

story:
What is this?

The Amser Studios first ever Book signing/Convention is to take place in the Duluth MN Armory on Saturday, May 6, 2017. This fundraiser will allow the studio to give perks to those interested in attending, as well as raise awareness for the Armory that's trying to get rebuilt! To receive an invite/reminder after the fundraiser ends, please subscribe at the bottom of THIS page! If you're hoping to receive a physical invite, please purchase the "Perk" of a VIP ticket to the convention/book signing!

​

What is Amser Studios?

​

What do I get?

Please take a look at our full list of perks!!

​

What happens if you reach your $500 goal?

If we raise $500, it will greatly benefit the Duluth, MN Armory where we will be hosting the first ever Amser Studios convention! With your support, we can raise awareness for not only the work of incredible artists, musicians, and the like, but the Armory in desperate need of remodeling, as well! 

Here is a list of our growing list of mini-goal prizes!

$5- Unlock the first watercolor bookmark! ALREADY UNLOCKED.

$10- Unlock a new watercolor bookmark! (For every $10 raised, a new bookmark will be added until we reach our original $500 goal)

$100- A free PDF of the novelette, HOPE: A Study In Scarlet will be sent to all who subscribe to Amser Studios! Subscribe at the bottom of THIS page!

$500- The work of artists all over will be showcased at the Duluth armory, where L. W. Brook will sign your copy of any AMSER STUDIOS work and/or bookmark! 

​

VIP Ticket Upgrades:

For every $100 raised, VIP ticket holders will earn additional perks! Get your VIP ticket in the Perks section!

$100-Every VIP ticket holder will receive a physical copy of the "Hope: A Novelette" inspired murder invite Hope receives in the first novelette found HERE! (In other words, you'll receive a replica of the original letter in the novelette)

$200-Every VIP ticket holder will receive ONE to-be-signed novel+signature voucher

$300-Every VIP ticket holder will receive THREE to-be-signed novels+signature vouchers (Includes $200 voucher)

$400-Every VIP ticker holder will receive FIVE to-be-signed novels+signature vouchers (This includes vouchers from perks $200 and $300)

$500-Every VIP ticker holder will receive a pack of TEN Amser Studios bookmarks!

​

Have Perk/Upgrade suggestions? Email L. W. Brook: AmserStudios@gmail.com

​

What happens if you don't reach your $500 goal?

All the money goes toward paying for the perks purchased by our generous donors and the Armory<3 http://www.amserstudios.com!

​

When and where is this convention going to take place?

May 6, 2017 at the Duluth, MN Armory on London Rd<3

http://www.Amserstudios.com

If you purchase a ticket, it will also hold all of the information on it! 

​

How can I help besides buying perks and donating?

Please email L. W. Brook: AmserStudios@gmail.com

Please include subject message with whichever of the following best fits:

ARTIST- Please write that in the subject line if you are an artist/photographer/musician/cosplayer/ect looking to help out! If you're interested in being an artist at the convention, please be sure to message me ASAP! 

PROMOTE- Please write that in the subject line if you have a website/newspaper/ect you would like to allow Amser Studios to use as a base of promotion for the fundraiser!

OTHER- Just looking to help out? Send L. W. Brook a message! We greatly appreciate your time/energy/the fact that you read all of this and want to help out! 

​

Thanks so much for reading all of this! Have a wonderful rest of your day, and please promote this fundraiser on your social media to help gain awareness for our project!!

Yours Truly,

Legend W. Brook

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Alexis Mendoza Cuban-born, Bronxite and interdisciplinary artist, curator, and author. I've exhibited my artworks in museums and galleries around the world in countries such as: Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Costa Rica, Cuba, England, France, Germany, Mexico, Netherlands, Peru, Romania, Spain, Switzerland, and United States. Co-founder and co-creator of the Bronx Latin American Art Biennial, Founding member of BxArts Factory. I've curated exhibitions and art projects at the Bronx Museum of Art, NY; Museum of Piraguasu Paulista, São Paulo, Brazil; Museum of Satu Mare, Romania; The Point, Bronx, NY; Bronx Art Space, Bronx, NY; Boricua College Art Gallery, New York, NY; Union College, Schenectady, NY; Clemente Soto Velez Cultural Center, NY; and at The Mexican Cultural Institute, NY. I am also the author of books such as: “Latin America, The Culture and the New Men”; “Objective Reference of Painting: The work of Ismael Checo, 1986-2006”; Reflections: The Sensationalism of the Art from Cuba. All three published by Wasteland Press; and Rigo Peralta: Revelaciones de un Universo Mistico, published by Argos Publications, Dominican Republic.
  • Our goal with this campaign is to raise fundings to continue bringing to our community high quality exhibitions and art projects. We started this great art project in 2008 and every two years we present 5 to 8 art exhibitions as well as urban installations and art performances by artists from Argentina, Bolivia, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, Cuba, Ecuador, El Salvador, Spain, Guatemala, Honduras, Mexico, Nicaragua, Panama, Paraguay, Peru, Puerto Rico, Dominican Republic, Uruguay and Venezuela.
  • Your contribution is very important to us, your support will help us to provide education and cultural information for everyone. All the events and art exhibitions are family oriented. It’s an event that celebrates not only the richness of the Latin American Art but also the diversity of our community. This event offers the community the opportunity to access people from diverse cultural backgrounds, languages and ethnicity.

What We Need & What You Get

We are going to use the funds as follows:

Description

Amount (US $)

Graphic Designer

$1000

Invitation Printing Cost (1000 postcards)

$286.80

Poster Printing Cost (250 posters)

$490

Catalog Printing Cost (500 units) (8.5”X11”) (28 Pgs)

$2,2514

Framing Artworks

$750

Exhibition Instalation Stipend

$142 X 7 = $1000

Art Handlers (2)

$300 X 2

Rentals (2 Projectors)

$200

Transportation

$160

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Total Exhibition Budget

$7000

                                                                          

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, or email your friends! Also a way to help us is by using the Indiegogo share tools!                

And that's all there is to it.

story:
"Dying on their feet, exhausted by their long, arduous journey from the coast to the inner lands, the Bedouin tribes El Pulpo and BassStation bring their mighty beasts to drink deep at the Mischief Desert Oasis, sucking down the clear petroleum waters until they can face the next blazing stage of their journey into the harsh desert.  Recharged, re-energized, their quest may continue long into the night...."


We love fire art, and as fire artists ourselves, we know how much work goes in the creation - and its operation on-playa.  Every fire artist at Burning Man works incredibly hard year round to create their art, but only get to run for just a few short nights at BRC.  Every artist wants the community to enjoy, experience and interact with their art in it's fullest expression and magnificence.

While ground based fire art installations have the luxury of setting up large fuel depots with sufficient propane to run their artworks at maximum capacity, mobile fire artists are limited, for understandable and appropriate safety reasons, in the amount of fuel they can carry. In many ways, these mobile fire artists serve and respond to the community better by bringing the fire to the participants, rather than requiring the participants to come to them.  Despite putting in as much work as the static installations, they are forced to carefully manage and ration their onboard propane supply to maximize their running time at night.  We are creating a space where these mobile fire artists can come and burn lots of high press fuel from OUR reservoir and enjoy the wonders of vaporized fuel.  No frozen tanks to worry about.

We envision a gathering place for mobile fire art, where every night different members of our community will arrive and interact with each other before heading out full into the night - their shared mission to bring more, longer, brighter fire to the participants.

We will be providing the propane for these shows so the artcars can save their onboard propane and you can experience their maximum flame effects.


What We Need to Make This Happen

We need your help to bring this awesome experience to your home - BRC.
We are looking to raise $6,000 that will go directly to purchase propane for the flame effect art cars to plug in and burn fire. 

See the results of your generosity!!!

Come to Dustfish Village (7:00 and Esplanade) to see your contribution at work.  We will have scheduled events planned and want all of you to join us.
AND, we thank all our donors.  Thank you for keeping the flame burning!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you own a mobile art car and would like to participate in our mobile fuel depot while at Burning Man, please send us a message to learn more at markwswitzer@gmail.com

story:
To donate:  select a perk or select the "Back It' button to make a contribution of any amount.

IN FLIEDEN

When she visited the former Synagogue in Flieden in 2013, Marie Ariel of Cambridge, MA met the pastor of the Church, Holger Biehn. She told Pastor Biehn that her father had his bar mitzvah in the Synagogue in 1899. Pastor Biehn told Marie  that he and members of the Church are committed to keeping in memory Nazism’s horrific ending of Jewish life in Flieden. But they are equally determined to honor the 500 years of Flieden's Jewish community and the years of Jewish worship in the Synagogue.  They want that history to be illuminated in the building.

Pastor Biehn told Marie he wanted help finding a Jewish artist to create stained glass windows for the Church. Marie told Pastor Biehn about Barney Zeitz of Martha’s Vineyard, an artist who had for many decades created exceptional stained glass for churches and synagogues and had also created striking sculptures like The Holocaust Memorial at R.I. Holocaust Memorial.

Barney describes what happened next: “I was asked to send the committee at the church that was overseeing choices for the stained glass windows a portfolio showing my work.

The committee brought me to Flieden in July 2015 to work with them on what the windows needed to convey. I spent most of a week with the church committee and made presentations of my work. I was very moved by the sincerity of the committee, members of the congregation, and the townspeople including the mayor and town historian, all of whom came to my presentations. 

A SHARED MESSAGE FOR PEACE

I returned to Martha's Vineyard and began drawings and glass studies for the windows to share with the Pastor and the Committee. We exchanged many emails and phone calls to refine the windows' message. Three windows will show a glowing landscape on which will be written in Hebrew the Priestly Blessing (Numbers 6.24-26), "May the Lord bless you and keep You / May the Lord make his face shine upon you, and be gracious unto you / May the Lord lift up his countenance upon you, and give you peace.” Three windows on the opposite side of the sanctuary will have a similar landscape and the Priestly Blessing will be written in German. The final two windows which are on either side of the alter will be the most luminous and have only the word "peace" -- on one side in Hebrew and on the other in German."

FOLLOWING THE WORK IN PROGRESS

Follow progress with the windows on Facebook. The page is Barney Zeitz: Flieden, Germany Stained Glass.

FUNDRAISING & BUDGET

The Evangelische Kirche is one of 4 or 5 churches now housed in former synagogues in Germany. It will be the first church to do more than mount a plaque to commemorate the Jewish history of the building and of the Jewish congregants.

The Church did a fundraising campaign for their building restoration which included a portion for the stained glass windows. Flieden is a small town. The residents are not wealthy by any means but the State Church agreed to double the money they raised, so they are able to pay for the first three windows.

We hope this project provides Jewish Americans whose parents and grandparents lived in Germany and throughout Europe a way to commemorate the lives and worship of your ancestors. We hope many others will want to support work which celebrates the best of the shared religious heritage of Judaism and Christianity.

Budget for this campaign: 

$30,000 for the fourth window plus $10,000 to cover additional costs: insurance, crating, shipping of first four windows and fundraising expenses

Budget for the entire project:

The first two windows: $25,000 each.
The second two windows: $30,000 each
Additional costs: Insurance, crating, shipping of first four windows and fundraising expenses: $10,000
The last set of two windows, in more costly stainless steel frames, with the word “Peace” in German and in Hebrew use a mosaic laminated technique that is complex and very labor intensive: $40,000 each.
story_txt:
To donate:  select a perk or select the "Back It' button to make a contribution of any amount.
IN FLIEDEN 
When she visited the former Synagogue in Flieden in 2013, Marie Ariel of Cambridge, MA met the pastor of the Church, Holger Biehn. She told Pastor Biehn that her father had his bar mitzvah in the Synagogue in 1899. Pastor Biehn told Marie  that he and members of the Church are committed to keeping in memory Nazism’s horrific ending of Jewish life in Flieden. But they are equally determined to honor the 500 years of Flieden's Jewish community and the years of Jewish worship in the Synagogue.  They want that history to be illuminated in the building.

Pastor Biehn told Marie he wanted help finding a Jewish artist to create stained glass windows for the Church. Marie told Pastor Biehn about Barney Zeitz of Martha’s Vineyard, an artist who had for many decades created exceptional stained glass for churches and synagogues and had also created striking sculptures like The Holocaust Memorial at R.I. Holocaust Memorial.
Barney describes what happened next: “I was asked to send the committee at the church that was overseeing choices for the stained glass windows a portfolio showing my work.The committee brought me to Flieden in July 2015 to work with them on what the windows needed to convey. I spent most of a week with the church committee and made presentations of my work. I was very moved by the sincerity of the committee, members of the congregation, and the townspeople including the mayor and town historian, all of whom came to my presentations. 
A SHARED MESSAGE FOR PEACE
I returned to Martha's Vineyard and began drawings and glass studies for the windows to share with the Pastor and the Committee. We exchanged many emails and phone calls to refine the windows' message. Three windows will show a glowing landscape on which will be written in Hebrew the Priestly Blessing (Numbers 6.24-26), "May the Lord bless you and keep You / May the Lord make his face shine upon you, and be gracious unto you / May the Lord lift up his countenance upon you, and give you peace.” Three windows on the opposite side of the sanctuary will have a similar landscape and the Priestly Blessing will be written in German. The final two windows which are on either side of the alter will be the most luminous and have only the word "peace" -- on one side in Hebrew and on the other in German."

Follow progress with the windows on Facebook. The page is Barney Zeitz: Flieden, Germany Stained Glass.

The Evangelische Kirche is one of 4 or 5 churches now housed in former synagogues in Germany. It will be the first church to do more than mount a plaque to commemorate the Jewish history of the building and of the Jewish congregants.
The Church did a fundraising campaign for their building restoration which included a portion for the stained glass windows. Flieden is a small town. The residents are not wealthy by any means but the State Church agreed to double the money they raised, so they are able to pay for the first three windows.
We hope this project provides Jewish Americans whose parents and grandparents lived in Germany and throughout Europe a way to commemorate the lives and worship of your ancestors. We hope many others will want to support work which celebrates the best of the shared religious heritage of Judaism and Christianity.

$30,000 for the fourth window plus $10,000 to cover additional costs: insurance, crating, shipping of first four windows and fundraising expenses
Budget for the entire project:
The first two windows: $25,000 each.The second two windows: $30,000 eachAdditional costs: Insurance, crating, shipping of first four windows and fundraising expenses: $10,000The last set of two windows, in more costly stainless steel frames, with the word “Peace” in German and in Hebrew use a mosaic laminated technique that is complex and very labor intensive: $40,000 each.

story:
DISCO TURF  

DISCO TURF IS A COLLABORATIVE, EXPERIEMENTAL ART EXPERIENCE COMBINING THE PRACTICES OF THREE KANSAS CITY ARTISTS. TOGETHER, DISCO TURF WILL SERVE AS A CELEBRATORY EVENT, SHOWCASING ANNA VANGHEEM'S SS17 AVANT-GARDE READY-TO-WEAR COLLECTION: "THE MORE CROOKED OUR TEETH GET", LIKEWISE MAGAZINE'S ISSUE 01 RELEASE: "JOINT FORCES" , AND CAMILE MESSERLEY'S SCREENING OF HER SHORT FILM "BLOOMIN" STARRING REN SEITZ. THIS IS A ONE NIGHT EVENT AT VULPES BASTILLE, APRIL 28TH FROM 8-11PM. COME READY TO DISCO DOWN WITH MUSIC BY FK MENACE AND HYDRATE WITH COMPLEMENTARY REFRESHMENTS. SAVE THE DATE! 

ANNA VAN GHEEM

READY-TO-WEAR SS17 COLLECTION: THE MORE CROOKED OUR TEETH GET

PRODUCED BY DESIGNER AND KCAI BFA CANDIDATE ANNA VAN GHEEM, SS 17 COLLECTION "THE MORE CROOKED OUR TEETH GETS" EXPLORES IDEALISM, EXAGGERATION, AND IRONY THROUGH HER APPROPRIATION OF NATURAL IMAGERY AND EXPERIMENTAL, AVANT-GARDE SURFACE DESIGN. 

INSPIRED BY ADOLESCENT ROMANCE, "THE MORE CROOKED OUR TEETH GETS" DESIGNS SERVE AS A METHOD OF ESCAPISM AND FANTASY. BRIGHT COLORS AND OVERSIZED RUFFLES INSPIRED BY ADOLESCENCE CONTRAST THE MUNDANE WHITE SOCKS AND SHOES, AND SUGGEST THE PITFALLS OF THE SELF-DELUDED NOTION OF LOVE AND THE INEVITABILITY OF AGING. 

LIKEWISE MAGAZINE

AS AN INTERDISCIPLINARY, COLLABORATIVE PROJECT, LIKEWISE MAGAZINE OPERATES UNDER THE BELIEF THAT ALL FORMS OF ART HOLD EQUAL VALUE. THE FLUIDITY OF DISCIPLINARY BOUNDARIES IN CONTEMPORARY ART PRACTICE OFTEN GENERATES AREAS OF CREATIVE OVERLAP. LIKEWISE STRIVES NOT ONLY TO CONSIDER THAT CONNECTION BUT ALSO ALLOWS AN OPPORTUNITY FOR ARTISTS TO COME TOGETHER TO CREATE SOMETHING THAT COULD NOT HAPPEN OTHERWISE. ULTIMATELY, LIKEWISE ACTS AS A PLATFORM FOR INDIVIDUALS TO EXHIBIT THEIR WORK. IN THAT, WE'RE HOPING TO CONTRIBUTE TOWARDS A MORE INCLUSIVE ARTS COMMUNITY.

IN THIS ISSUE, LIKEWISE MAGAZINE WILL CENTER AROUND THE THEME OF “JOINING FORCES.” THIS IS A RALLYING CRY FOR CREATIVE COLLABORATION, COLLECTIVE ACTION, AND CONVIVIALITY IN ALL ITS MYRIAD FORMS. BRING PEOPLE TOGETHER AND MAKE BEAUTIFUL ART—THAT’S IT. WE CAN’T DO IT ALL ALONE, AND WE DEFINITELY WOULDN’T WANT TO. BUT THROUGH LIKEWISE MAGAZINE, WE CAN JOIN FORCES TO MAKE SOMETHING TRULY BADASS. SO LET’S DO IT!

Likewise Magazine is produced by Sara Garrison, a graphic design alumni from the Kansas City Art Institute 2016.

CAMILE MESSERLEY

CAMILE MESSERLEY IS A KANSAS CITY-BASED ARTIST, ORGANIZER, WRITER AND BFA CANDIDATE AT THE KANSAS CITY ART INSTITUTE. HER PRACTICE FOCUSES ON THE PLAY THAT OCCURS WHEN CHALLENGING AESTHETIC INTUITION THROUGH THE SOCIAL ENGAGEMENT OF PERFORMANCE, NEW MEDIA, AND EXPLORATION OF DOCUMENTATION. 

IN COLLABORATION WITH ANNA VAN GHEEM, EARLIER THIS FALL MESSERLEY CREATED THE FILM "BLOOMIN", A SHORT THAT EXPLORES THE TRANSITIONS IN VAN GHEEM'S AESTHETIC, SENSIBILITIES AND CRAFT. THE FILM FOLLOWS A YOUNG GIRL RUNNING THROUGH THE WOODS TO REACH HER OWN REBIRTH, LIKE BOTTICELL'S VENUS OUT OF LAKE MUCK RATHER THAN SEA FOAM AND IN PINK VINYL RATHER AND BLUE JELLY PUMPS RATHER THAN HER BIRTHDAY SUIT. CATCH THE PREMIERE OF BLOOMIN' AT DISCO TURF, APRIL 28TH, 2017. 

HOW CAN YOU MAKE THIS POSSIBLE?

WITH YOUR HELP, WE AIM TO RAISE $5,500 FOR THE FULL PRODUCTION OF THE SHOW, INCLUDING COMPENSATION OF THE PRODUCTION OF GARMENTS, VENUE FEE, LIGHTING DESIGN, GRAPHIC DESIGN, PHOTOGRAPHY, MAKE UP, HAIR, MUSIC, FOOD, AND REFRESHMENTS. IT IS OUR GOAL TO FACILITATE AND HOST A ONE OF A KIND, COLLABORATIVE, AND INCLUSIVE EXPERIENCE FOR THE PEOPLE OF KCMO.

WHAT WILL RESULT IN YOUR SUPPORT:

ANY FORM OF CONTRIBUTION WILL HELP TO GET THIS SHOW OFF THE GROUND. IF YOU ARE UNABLE TO CONTRIBUTE FINANCIALLY, ANY OTHER FORM OF SUPPORT WILL BE GRATEFULLY ACCEPTED BY OUR TEAM. ANOTHER WAY YOU CAN HELP IS TO GET THE WORD OUT!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ronnie Kroell, actor | producer | model | activist. You might remember me from BRAVO's, "Make Me a Supermodel" in 2008, where I was the runner-up and had my television "Bromance" with Ben DiChiara. Some of you may have picked up my 2010 issue of PLAYGIRL Magazine, watched me in films like EATING OUT DRAMA CAMP, INTO THE LION'S DEN, SCROOGE & MARLEY, or perhaps you have generously supported my efforts to prevent and heal the effects of bullying by celebrating friendship with FRIEND MOVEMENT. 

This campaign is important to me because I have SO much to share with you about what has transpired in my life to date. Seriously, I feel like I've lived 100 years in only 33. The highs have been high, the lows have been low, and the in-betweens have been so over the top that I couldn't make them up if I tried! 

Photo credits and thanks to:

Chris Thurman, Luke Elijah, Devin Mitchell, and BJ Bingham. 

Fundraising Benchmarks

  • $2,500 - Produce & Release Official Indiegogo Campaign Video 
  • $5,000 - LIVE Q & A on Facebook 
  • $10,000 - Chapters Revealed
  • $20,000 - Cover Art Photo Shoot / Photographer Named
  • $30,000 - Plan a "Behind The Smile" Cocktail Mixer in Hollywood
  • $40,000 - Help Select Cover Art From Options
  • $50,000 - Forward Author Named
  • $60,000 - Let's Celebrate - Full Speed Ahead! 

Here are just a few topics I plan on covering: 

  • Overcoming my own experiences with bullying.
  • The challenges of growing up in a loving family that struggled with substance abuse. 
  • Divorce
  • Coming out as a member of the LGBT Community.
  • Following a dream in modeling / acting.
  • The truth about reality TV and my bromance on Make Me A Supermodel. 
  • Playgirl Photo-Shoot
  • Navigating Hollywood, behind the smoke and mirrors.
  • Starting Friend Movement, being an entrepreneur.
  • My friendship with "Laughing Eddie" Lobo
  • Relationship drama. 
  • Frenemies.
  • Battling serious illness. 
  • Rubbing elbows with celebrities.
  • Using my powers for good.
  • Building Confidence.
  • How to smile, even when there doesn't seem like there's anything to smile about.

By purchasing an advance copy of my book and/or contributing at any level of this campaign, you will be helping me to:

  • Put down on paper some of the very experiences that have brought me happiness and pain.
  • Share with the world the lessons that I've learned along the way.
  • Pay it forward 

This book with be equal parts:

  • Autobiography
  • Self-help
  • Comedy
  • Romance

Leaving no stone unturned ... No topic is off the table! I've chosen to go the crowd-funding route (as opposed to any other) because I truly want to write this book with YOU every step of the way. I'll be looking to you to help with suggestions and insight, to assist in holding me accountable for creating and meeting deadlines, and to celebrate milestones . . .  

My hope is that the reader will laugh, cry, and find unique inspiration as they turn each page. By the end of the book they will: 

  • Understand the many trials and tribulations that have gone on "Behind The Smile".
  • Have a deeper connection with who I am (beneath the surface).
  • Feel compelled to follow their own dream without apology. 

What I Need & What You Get

I would like to raise $60,000 with this campaign through:

  • Advance book sales.
  • Contributions.
  • Angel sponsors.

The funding will be used to allow me to: 

  • Write.
  • Secure a publisher/printer for self-publishing.
  • Hire a writing consultant.
  • Attain a publicist.
  • Print and ship your books! 

I'm excited to offer several fun perks that allow you to contribute at various levels and become an integral part of sharing these stories and inspiring the lives of others. 

The Impact

This project is valuable in numerous ways: 

  • It gives us an opportunity to get to know one another better.
  • It gives me the opportunity to share my stories with you in book form.
  • Provides me with opportunities to pay it forward in schools/businesses/book stores/libraries by talking about the things that matter most to me: Bullying, Friendship, Diversity, Fashion, Acting, Following Dreams, and Activism. 

Although I've never personally leveraged crowd-funding directly for my own personal projects, I have successfully led the charge on numerous projects for FRIEND MOVEMENT:

  • The New F Word photo campaign
  • Walk from Chicago to NYC for Bullying Awareness Month
  • The Ronnie & Eddie Show (in production)

I take on projects that:

  • Inspire me.
  • Awaken my passion.
  • Allow me to help others while helping myself.

If it weren't for your unconditional love, support, and kindness along my journey, then none of my success would be possible. There is no such thing as a self-made person and not a day goes by that I am not aware of the blessings that I have been given. 

The greatest blessing being YOU. I'm grateful to each of you for believing in me and helping me to reach for my dreams -- It has made all the difference. 

Risks & Challenges

Where there is great risk, there is great reward! However, many of us are paralyzed by fear and tend to shy away from taking a leap of faith. Sometimes we:

  • Don't feel worthy.
  • We're scared to be vulnerable.
  • We don't want the responsibility that comes with success.
  • We get too cozy in our comfort zones.

I'm no stranger to taking risks, challenging the status quo, and speaking my mind. Please understand this about me, I don't want to write simply to write, but rather I want to write because I have something important to say. I'm confident in my writing, my anecdotes, and in my growing network of friends and family, so, failure is not an option!

When challenges present themselves along the way, I have learned to focus on the lesson that needs to be learned or the opportunity that may be hidden beneath the challenge. I'm a solutions based thinker that can put my pride and ego down, in order to create the best product possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

You might not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you cannot help:

  • Simply spread the word and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you from the bottom of my heart! 

Love and light,

Ronnie Kroell

www.ronniekroell.com

story:
Diana Naranjo 

Dias Así.

Algunos de ustedes han escuchado mi música en vivo, han visto mis videos o han sido testigos de mi trayectoria y presentaciones, otros quizás es la primera vez que saben algo de Diana Naranjo y hoy tengo la oportunidad de contarles que trabajo con el alma buscando la excelencia y el sonido para que mi música llegue de la mejor manera a ustedes a quienes respeto y debo tanto.

 "Dias Así" es el titulo de mi nuevo album, una producción llena de sabores y colores latinos que contará con la participación del mejor equipo de productores y músicos con mira a los Latin Grammy del 2016 y te invito a que seas parte de este proyecto ayudándome a difundir nuestras raices hispanas a través de la música de una artista independiente como yo. Ustedes son mi disquera, mis productores y mis companeros de viaje. 

Qué necesito?

Requiero de tu apoyo económico para la grabación, músicos, arreglos, mezcla, masterización, diseno gráfico, fabricación y distribución de mi nuevo album "Dias Así" que contará con seis canciones y un video profesional promocional. 
Cada persona o institución que me apoye estará haciedo un pedido de mi disco por anticipado, el cual esta previsto a salir a la venta en Abril del 2016 y será invitado al lanzamiento de "Dias Así" en un concierto privado, entre otros incentivos y agradecimientos.

Por que?

Con el giro que dió la industria musical, los artistas en general nos quedamos sin el apoyo de las grandes disqueras y hemos tenido que financiar con nuestros recursos y trabajo cada paso de nuestra carrera profesional. 
Mi mas reciente album "Las Puertas del Corazón" fué realizado en diferentes años, con diferentes productores y diferentes musicos. El album contiene 7 canciones, a razón de una canción por año, por lo cual tiene diferentes sonidos y tiempos; es necesario contar con los recursos suficientes para tener el mismo equipo y realizar el proyecto en un solo momento logrando un sonido único que me identifique. 
Para la realización de "Las Puertas del Corazon" hice diferentes shows, campañas y vendí un demo de 4 canciones que tenía en el momento, también conté con el apoyo de personas como ustedes que se identificaron con el proyecto. Les presento algunas de las canciones de mi album anterior y sus respectivos videos. 
MIO. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PlQYfYy4jKU  
LAS PUERTAS DEL CORAZON https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZerB6LXefqo
Con la producción de Gabriel Cifuentes y participación de músicos como el maestro Ramón Benitez en el bombardino, quien ha trabjado para Toto La Momposina, Carlos Vives, Juan Gabriel y otros grandes artistas. 

En el 2014 "Las Puertas del Corazón" estuvo considerado en el listado de los Latin Grammy como Mejor Album Vocal Pop Contemporaneo y el tema de promoción que lleva el mismo nombre fué escogido por la cantante Colombiana Aglaé Caraballo para incluirlo en su nuevo album "Pasaporte al Caribe" y del cual tengo muchas espectativas. 
Riesgos y Retos

El mayor riesgo cuando se solicitan recursos para un proyecto es la apatía de la gente. Muchas veces a pesar de la identificación de los amigos y seguidores es difícil concretar el apoyo en dinero. Se piensa por parte de ellos que lo que pueden aportar no hará diferencia y realmente cada centavo suma y cuenta, por eso si cada quien dona de acuerdo a lo que puede y quiere estoy segura que entre todos alcanzaremos la meta propuesta.

Que sucederá si los recursos no cubren lo solicitado? Seguir trabajando como siempre para producir cada canción de acuerdo a mis posibilidades.

Otra manera de apoyarme.

Cuéntale a tus amigos acerca de éste proyecto y compártelo, también puedes compartirlo a través de Indiegogo.
Además de apoyarme con una cuota económica también lo puedes hacer brindándome intercambios relacionados con mi imágen, logística, desplazamientos y estadías relacionadas para mi y mi equipo en el tiempo de realización del proyecto. 

GRACIAS!
story_txt:
Diana Naranjo 
Dias Así.
Algunos de ustedes han escuchado mi música en vivo, han visto mis videos o han sido testigos de mi trayectoria y presentaciones, otros quizás es la primera vez que saben algo de Diana Naranjo y hoy tengo la oportunidad de contarles que trabajo con el alma buscando la excelencia y el sonido para que mi música llegue de la mejor manera a ustedes a quienes respeto y debo tanto.
 "Dias Así" es el titulo de mi nuevo album, una producción llena de sabores y colores latinos que contará con la participación del mejor equipo de productores y músicos con mira a los Latin Grammy del 2016 y te invito a que seas parte de este proyecto ayudándome a difundir nuestras raices hispanas a través de la música de una artista independiente como yo. Ustedes son mi disquera, mis productores y mis companeros de viaje.    Qué necesito? Requiero de tu apoyo económico para la grabación, músicos, arreglos, mezcla, masterización, diseno gráfico, fabricación y distribución de mi nuevo album "Dias Así" que contará con seis canciones y un video profesional promocional. 
Cada persona o institución que me apoye estará haciedo un pedido de mi disco por anticipado, el cual esta previsto a salir a la venta en Abril del 2016 y será invitado al lanzamiento de "Dias Así" en un concierto privado, entre otros incentivos y agradecimientos.   Por que?
Con el giro que dió la industria musical, los artistas en general nos quedamos sin el apoyo de las grandes disqueras y hemos tenido que financiar con nuestros recursos y trabajo cada paso de nuestra carrera profesional.

story:
In June of this year, we acquired a long-term lease on a two-story commercial space in Ridgewood, Queens, and the possibilities are endless! With little work done on the space in decades, we were left in charge of a complete renovation of the space to make it a functional creative zone. For over a month we have been working tirelessly to renovate the space:  

  • power-washing every possible inch of the space
  • tearing out much of the downstairs ceiling and almost all of the drywall upstairs 
  • having a licensed electrician work for weeks to remove poor wiring and replace it with up-to-code electrical lines 
  • installing a top-of-the-line three-zone ductless mini-split air conditioning system
  • installing high-speed internet 
  • constructing new walls,
  • a floating vocal room,
  • a wooden platform to level out part of the floor,
  • and much more.

 

We have invested our time and money into this project so that we can offer a safe and comfortable space for our community. We want to do even more to the space, and continue to shoulder costs we believe will provide the best quality of service we can, such as hiring someone to construct an entirely new and more comfortable staircase, furnishing Blahkwork, outfitting new computers with Adobe software, the kitchen with ammenities and more.

We now turn to you!

All our friends, all their friends, all the people we’ve ever worked with to any capacity, and anybody who might want to work with us in the near future...invest in the quality space you would want to use. We are offering a chance to get involved in the final stretch of this process in any way you can, whether it takes the form of furniture or equipment donation, or even simply sharing our campaign through your own networks.

 

Blahkwork is also offering a pre-sale on all our services (a flat rate on the whole studio space)! 

Upon completion, Blahkwork will offer professional recording services, equipped with a live room, vocal room, 36+ channels of analog recording, two reel-to-reel tape machines, an arsenal of professional microphones, a production suite, in-house production team, two comfortable lounge areas, and a kitchenette; as well as a gallery/small event space, design and photography services, cassette tape duplication, and equipment rental.

**Reserving time up-front means that you will get first priority when we begin to schedule for the second-half of August, and an investment in the very facilities you will have access to **

 

For $40 an hour, or $200 for a 6-hour day, we will record or mix your music, set up our space for your music video or photo shoot, work with our in-house photographer or graphic designer, or find the perfect combination of ways our space can serve YOU!

story:
Short Summary

Please help us bring the inspiring Shantell Martin to the Independent Lodging Congress stage on October 18 to do a live 4 ft x 5 ft drawing + talk on creativity! 

  • With a donation of $175+, you will be entered into a raffle to win the piece Shantell creates at the Independent Lodging Congress.
  • These works generally go for much more!
  • We're only selling 100 raffle tickets, so your chances of winning are at 1/100 for each ticket. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • With an entry of $175+, you will be entered to win the piece created by Shantell!
  • If you'd like to purchase the piece in its entirety, you may purchase our Perks pass for $17,000. Contact us!
  • 10% of all proceeds will go to Big Brothers Big Sisters Independence Region
  • Shipping + transport of the piece is at the cost of the recipient. 

The Impact

The Independent Lodging Congress is a community dedicated to inspire creativity in the indie hospitality space. We do this for the love of it. With that said, the budget is tight. That's why we need your help!

Also, you'll support a great cause. 10% of our proceeds will go to Big Brothers Big Sisters Independence Region.

Other Ways You Can Help

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this mission + Shantell's work

story:
Cover Image: Untitled, from Beyond the Ninth Wave, by Yvette Monahan, 2018.

 

The Critical Journal 
of Photography & Visual Culture
for the 21st century.

OVER journal is a new periodical publication and online platform that proposes its readers a more wholesome, honest, and critical observation and enjoyment of Photography. Publishing commissioned texts and artworks alongside interviews and opinion pieces, it aims to create the ideal channel for an open and global discussion about the context in which the discipline sits, and not just about the output of artists, exhibiting venues, and publishing houses.

OVER journal critically focuses on aspects often overlooked that affect the discipline, zooming out to observe the whole scene, to analyse what exactly is happening, what power relationships are at play. It is about preventing the repetition of obsolete and flawed structures, as much as highlighting the work of those who constructively are expanding what we still call Photography into new horizons. More than a portfolio magazine, it is a space for reflection on new practices, new ways of thinking, shining a light wherever needed.

 

With Visual Culture and Critical Thinking at the core.

Our interest in energising a critical engagement with Photography and Visual Culture, Cultural Studies, and Critical Thinking —to collectively question the world we persistently represent to ourselves— motivated PhotoIreland since 2009 to develop a variety of short and long-term projects. Our work has manifested in a yearly Photography festival, a public resource photobook library, an Art bookshop, various publishing ventures, a print fair, Art residencies such as How to Flatten a Mountain, and a space for critical research called the Critical Academy. Adding to these, since 2015 we have gained valuable experience participating in various European Union co-funded projects. It is then not by chance that OVER journal comes into being this year.

 

Why Bother?

It all started with a long and deep reflection on our experience over the last decade as a cultural organisation working in Ireland and abroad, founded initially by a Photography graduate to support the discipline. Running a wealth of projects since then, and discussing our experience with peers internationally, we found along the way many cases of questionable practices; these oftentimes reinforced existing power relations, nepotism, favouritism, poor governance, as much as a lack of curatorial renewal, transparency, and a proper evolution of the practice. It became apparent that there is an urgency to speak openly about these issues, and that a platform where these discussions could be held publicly is certainly important and necessary.

Our aim is to acknowledge contemporary challenges critically, constructively, and to seek a healthier ecosystem that can support with an honest mindset what current practitioners are bringing into play.

OVER journal is a project by PhotoIreland developed as part of its Critical Academy.

Images: Mock-ups for illustration purposes only.

 

Specifications

The campaign will provide copies of OVER Journal as a 160 pages publication, designed in-house by PhotoIreland, with a handy size of 184x254mm, presented on gorgeous paper, and with a lay flat binding.

OVER Journal Issue 1
Softcover
160 pages approx.
184x254mm
Thread sewn, Otabind or similar
English
ISBN 9781916140417
 

Contributors

The publication presents works by artists and writers that contribute to a better understanding of the present challenges, and the future opportunities of both the medium and the world we live in.

Amongst others, contributors, writers, and artists will include Alison Nordström, Jörg Colberg, Anna Ehrenstein, Ángel Luis González, Erik Vroons, Lewis Bush, Duncan Wooldridge, Olga Kocsi, David Farrell, and Aidan Kelly-Murphy, with more to be announced as the crowdfunding campaign progresses.

 

Financial Breakdown

The funds raised will be used to cover the printing costs of OVER Journal issue 1 as follows:

  • Printing costs
  • Part of the contributors' fees
  • Part of the rewards production and shipping 
  • Indiegogo fees (10%)

In addition, PhotoIreland will cover:

  • Editorial and Design costs
  • Part of the contributors' fees
  • Part of the rewards production and shipping 
  • Marketing and distribution 

 

Timeline

The planned timeline is based around the following milestones:

  • 14 January: Crowdfunding Campaign Launches.
  • Editorial work resumes.
  • Promotion, promotion, promotion!
  • 14 February: Crowdfunding Campaign Ends.
  • Mid February: First draft for content and design.
  • Early March: Final draft for content and design. 
  • Mid March: Design approved and sent to press.
  • Mid April: OVER Journal arrives
  • Mid April: Crowdfunding perks posted
  • 22 April: OVER Journal launch at The Library Project, Dublin.
  • May onwards: OVER Journal continues its project online at overjournal.org

As a backer, you will be kept informed regularly once the campaign ends with production insights and updates.

 

Your Perks!

Note: To make it even sweeter, part of your shipping costs are covered by us! :)

Spread the word!

You can contribute to the success by spreading the word:
share the campaign with your friends and loved ones, online and offline!

Facebook    Instagram 

 

If you want to find out more about PhotoIreland and the various projects we run throughout the year, check photoireland.org and learn more about, amongst others:

  • PhotoIreland Festival
  • The Library Project
  • New Irish Works
  • How to Flatten a Mountain
  • Halftone Print Fair
  • TLP Editions
  • Critical Academy
  • The Museum of Contemporary Photography of Ireland

.

story:
Hi, my name is Mary Mendla, I am an artist and art instructor with over twenty-five years’ experience creating art and teaching others the joy of accessing and expressing their creativity.  Sharing my expertise and art journey is my passion.  The fullness of my art journey in art instruction, mixed media painting, fiber art, and business has created a rewarding life for me in the arts.  I wish to expand my reach by sharing this with others throughout the world through the power of the internet.  I earned a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree from the University of Wisconsin, Milwaukee in Painting and Fiber Art.  Many opportunities for sharing my gifts through teaching at Universities, Art Centers, and Museums have allowed me to live my passion and share this joy with others. 

It is time to reach further.

Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla will allow me to connect with students and art enthusiasts around the world through the internet, and not be limited to only those that I can work with in person.  Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla will involve the creation of online, interactive workshops in mixed media painting and fiber art, from beginner level to advanced, with private Facebook pages for each class to share work and receive feedback.  Two interactive online workshops have been created so far and are ready to be promoted soon.  

Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla will also offer a membership platform to create an online, participatory community for its members which will evolve and grow with each members’ contributions.  My goal is to see it become an active, supportive, engaging platform for members to progress on their creative journeys in community with others.  My tiered  membership plan, Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla , will offer many benefits and create a community for artists, art professionals, and art lovers.

You can help to make this a success, and help it to happen NOW, rather than later.  It is an important time in our history to add positivity to our world.  Helping a person access and trust the beauty of their inner self through creativity not only illuminates that person’s life, but it shares light with everyone they touch. 

It is time NOW!

Online classes and interactive workshops with Mary Mendla in mixed media painting and fiber art will:

  • Provide options for beginner to advanced students
  • Open the doors to new techniques, new media, and new forms of expression to expand the horizons of students’ creative journeys 
  • Provide access to private Facebook pages for each class to allow sharing of artwork for feedback in a supportive atmosphere, and create community among all participants
  • Include discounts on a paid membership in Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla  as well as future classes by Mary Mendla

 

A Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla membership will offer:

  • A private members’ only social network page
  • Monthly Video Demonstrations of art techniques in mixed media painting and fiber art with members’ only detailed instructions
  • Monthly artist talks with artists in various media and art professionals in "Conversations with Artists" presentations
  • "Ask Me About It” sessions posted monthly to answer members’ questions about mixed media and fiber art techniques, supplies, studio set up, safety, etc.
  • Art Challenges created and led by members to keep participants working regularly in their medium while pushing their limits in new directions
  • Topic Groups created and led by members for discussion on topics of interest
  • Private one on one Critiques of member's artworks
  • Opportunities for Members to Promote their own events and artwork
  • Discounts on classes, artwork, and art merchandise

 

WHAT I NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

This is an important time for these things to happen.  Our world needs this, now.  I am asking for your financial help to get this started, NOW.  Your contribution will help towards my goal of $3000 to cover startup expenses for:

  • Professional video production, $1,000 est.
  • WIFI access, $685 annually
  • Web hosting through podia.com, $720 annually
  • Equipment for quality video demos and Zoom productions – webcam, microphones, lighting, $350
  • Marketing, $250 est.

Any contribution will help toward these goals.  I plan to push ahead with these plans regardless of the amount received through this campaign.  Your contribution will help me to move forward more quickly to create a success for Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla and its members.

 

I WISH TO INCLUDE YOU IN THE BENEFITS OF THIS PLAN WITH THESE PERKS

$25 contribution

Perks:

  • Five  Mary Mendla Fine Art Greeting Cards ($30 value)
  • Inclusion in an "Explorer" membership in Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla  (membership is free but includes discounts of over $100)

 

$50 contribution

Perks:

  • Five Mary Mendla Fine Art Greeting Cards ($30 value)
  • 25% discount in a "Voyager" membership in Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla for one year ($115 value plus membership benefits of over $400 on additional discounts) 

 

$100 contribution

Perks:

  • A membership in the "Voyager" level of Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla for one year. ($153 value plus membership benefits of over $400 for discounts on workshops, services and artwork) 

 

$150 contribution

Perks:

  • A membership in the "Voyager" level of Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla for one year. (valued at $153 plus membership benefits of over $400 for discounts on workshops, services, and artwork)
  • A set of six Fine Art Greeting Cards by Mary Mendla ($36 value)

 

Patron Level    

$250 contribution

Perks:

  • An original mixed media painting or fiber art piece  (5x7" or 6x6") ($155 value) 
  • A membership in the  "Voyager" level of Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla  for one year. (Valued at $153 plus membership benefits of over $400 for additional discounts on workshops, services and artwork)

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

  • Share this campaign with your network, spread the word
  • Join the Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla membership group and get involved (the first level, Base Camp, is free, but offers good perks)
story_txt:
Hi, my name is Mary Mendla, I am an artist and art instructor with over twenty-five years’ experience creating art and teaching others the joy of accessing and expressing their creativity.  Sharing my expertise and art journey is my passion.  The fullness of my art journey in art instruction, mixed media painting, fiber art, and business has created a rewarding life for me in the arts.  I wish to expand my reach by sharing this with others throughout the world through the power of the internet.  I earned a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree from the University of Wisconsin, Milwaukee in Painting and Fiber Art.  Many opportunities for sharing my gifts through teaching at Universities, Art Centers, and Museums have allowed me to live my passion and share this joy with others. It is time to reach further.Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla will allow me to connect with students and art enthusiasts around the world through the internet, and not be limited to only those that I can work with in person.  Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla will involve the creation of online, interactive workshops in mixed media painting and fiber art, from beginner level to advanced, with private Facebook pages for each class to share work and receive feedback.  Two interactive online workshops have been created so far and are ready to be promoted soon.  Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla will also offer a membership platform to create an online, participatory community for its members which will evolve and grow with each members’ contributions.  My goal is to see it become an active, supportive, engaging platform for members to progress on their creative journeys in community with others.  My tiered  membership plan, Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla , will offer many benefits and create a community for artists, art professionals, and art lovers.You can help to make this a success, and help it to happen NOW, rather than later.  It is an important time in our history to add positivity to our world.  Helping a person access and trust the beauty of their inner self through creativity not only illuminates that person’s life, but it shares light with everyone they touch. It is time NOW!Online classes and interactive workshops with Mary Mendla in mixed media painting and fiber art will:
Provide options for beginner to advanced students
Open the doors to new techniques, new media, and new forms of expression to expand the horizons of students’ creative journeys 
Provide access to private Facebook pages for each class to allow sharing of artwork for feedback in a supportive atmosphere, and create community among all participants
Include discounts on a paid membership in Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla  as well as future classes by Mary Mendla

 A Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla membership will offer:
A private members’ only social network page
Monthly Video Demonstrations of art techniques in mixed media painting and fiber art with members’ only detailed instructions
Monthly artist talks with artists in various media and art professionals in "Conversations with Artists" presentations

"Ask Me About It” sessions posted monthly to answer members’ questions about mixed media and fiber art techniques, supplies, studio set up, safety, etc.

Art Challenges created and led by members to keep participants working regularly in their medium while pushing their limits in new directions

Topic Groups created and led by members for discussion on topics of interest
Private one on one Critiques of member's artworks

Opportunities for Members to Promote their own events and artwork

Discounts on classes, artwork, and art merchandise
 WHAT I NEED AND WHAT YOU GETThis is an important time for these things to happen.  Our world needs this, now.  I am asking for your financial help to get this started, NOW.  Your contribution will help towards my goal of $3000 to cover startup expenses for:
Professional video production, $1,000 est.
WIFI access, $685 annually
Web hosting through podia.com, $720 annually
Equipment for quality video demos and Zoom productions – webcam, microphones, lighting, $350
Marketing, $250 est.
Any contribution will help toward these goals.  I plan to push ahead with these plans regardless of the amount received through this campaign.  Your contribution will help me to move forward more quickly to create a success for Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla and its members. I WISH TO INCLUDE YOU IN THE BENEFITS OF THIS PLAN WITH THESE PERKS$25 contributionPerks:
Five  Mary Mendla Fine Art Greeting Cards ($30 value)
Inclusion in an "Explorer" membership in Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla  (membership is free but includes discounts of over $100)
 $50 contributionPerks:
Five Mary Mendla Fine Art Greeting Cards ($30 value)
25% discount in a "Voyager" membership in Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla for one year ($115 value plus membership benefits of over $400 on additional discounts) 
 $100 contributionPerks:A membership in the "Voyager" level of Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla for one year. ($153 value plus membership benefits of over $400 for discounts on workshops, services and artwork)  $150 contributionPerks:
A membership in the "Voyager" level of Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla for one year. (valued at $153 plus membership benefits of over $400 for discounts on workshops, services, and artwork)
A set of six Fine Art Greeting Cards by Mary Mendla ($36 value)
 Patron Level    $250 contributionPerks:
An original mixed media painting or fiber art piece  (5x7" or 6x6") ($155 value) 
A membership in the  "Voyager" level of Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla  for one year. (Valued at $153 plus membership benefits of over $400 for additional discounts on workshops, services and artwork)
 OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Share this campaign with your network, spread the word
Join the Creative Journeys with Mary Mendla membership group and get involved (the first level, Base Camp, is free, but offers good perks)

story:
Introduction

  • Designed by a 22-year-old passionate animal-enthusiast & freelance artist.
  • You will be helping a small artist & an endangered species, while receiving goodies in return!

What We Need & What You Get

  • Pins will be white with rainbow metallic plating, 2 clasps on the back and be $12 + shipping to help cover packaging/shipping/manufacturing/fees & charity cost. 
  • If we reach 50 (was 100!) pre-orders, we can fund & include a colored sticker of the design in each package. Spread the word! 
  • Pins are estimated to be 1.5"
  • (if unlocked) Bonus sticker is estimated to be 3" 
  • As long as we can reach Indiegogo's minimum of $500, I still plan to manufacture what has been pledged for and donate 25% to WWF. 
  • This will be running for 45 days, and then take 40+ days to manufacture & ship afterwards. Please only pledge if you are patient. These will not be done in time for Christmas 2019.  

Your Impact

If you are interested in owning some cute merchandise while contributing to African wild life, this is the campaign for you.

  • African Wild Dogs are an endangered species and 25% of overall funds will be put towards https://www.worldwildlife.org/species/african-w... 
  • "Their population is currently estimated at approximately 6,600 adults in 39 subpopulations, of which only 1,400 are mature individuals."

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Can't afford right now? Use Indiegogo share tools & social media to spread the word on this campaign. 
  • Not interested in this pin/sticker but want to help out the species? You can "adopt" an African Wild Dog from their site here: https://gifts.worldwildlife.org/gift-center/gif...

story:
Hey all, welcome to my Indiegogo campaign!

I'm so excited to announce my latest project Everything Out of Place. In February 2020, I will be presenting a solo exhibition of new artwork and a window installation at Shop Visitors, in Saint John, New Brunswick.  This campaign will serve as the official place to pre-order fresh new merch, which in turn will offset the costs of getting this project off the ground.

I'm really looking forward showing work in my hometown for the first time, and for you all to have a part in making it happen! Huge thanks to Emily and KC at Shop Visitors for making this all possible.

Before we get into all the details, let me share a bit about myself...

Originally from the Maritimes, I grew up in Rothesay, New Brunswick and spent time in Sackville, NB, earning my Bachelor's degree in Fine Arts from Mount Allison University ('17). After graduating, I moved to Montreal where I now maintain a small studio practice alongside my position as a commercial painter at an art manufacturing studio here in Montreal.

My practice explores interactions of natural and manufactured landscapes through painting, installation, and new media. With a specific interest in the dichotomies of rural and urban spaces, I use material and perceptual processes to engage with passive and active traditions of observing landscape.

This upcoming solo exhibition at Shop Visitors will be my first time presenting new artwork and a window installation in my hometown! To make it all happen, I am offering pre-orders on merch and some of my available landscape studies!

More on the exhibition:

Beach Feast, multimedia installation, 2019. (Installed at Sparkbox Studio, Picton, ON.)

This exhibition will present small-scale paintings and mixed media assemblages, alongside a re-adapted window installation of my project Beach Feast, a multimedia work that simulates personal memories and observations of Atlantic Canadian beaches. You can see more about that specific project here. "Beach Feast" aims to explore the dissonance between a truthful "retelling” of my own memories and the fictionalized experience that is the installation itself. New paintings and assemblages will follow a similar theme, exploring accumulations of memories, observations, materials, and spaces as related to my recollection of Maritime landscape. 

To see more about me and my work, check out my website here.

So back to the campaign:

Let me break things down as simply as possible...

By ordering a perk, your money will fund:

  • merch costs including apparel, printing and packaging;
  • materials to produce new artwork for my exhibition (including paint, canvas, hardware materials, etc);
  • and travel-related costs (shipping or air-travel) to Saint John for the installation and opening of the exhibition.

Perks

I'm offering many perks from clothing and stickers, to original artworks! Choose from individual items and add-ons:

  • Die-cut Sticker Sheets (4 x 6 inches)
  • Loud Places Landscape Stickers (3 x 4 inches)
  • Kwikway T-Shirt
  • Lupine Long-sleeve Shirt
  • Tantramar Tote Bag
  • Framed landscape studies

A Note on Orders & Shipping

Orders will be placed with the printer based on quantities ordered through this campaign. There will be limited merch available AFTER the campaign deadline, so be sure to place your order asap!

There are two PICK-UP options:  MONTREAL or SAINT JOHN

For those of you in Saint John, your orders will be available at Shop Visitors for the opening of the exhibition, so you will be able to pick them up then! Montreal pals, I will be in touch to arrange pick-up times after the campaign has ended.

If you reside in other areas of Canada, shipping to your location can be arranged by following the shipping prompts at check-out. I will be in touch after the campaign ends to confirm shipping information and additional shipping fees if necessary. 

My Personal Contribution

I know it's a lot to ask for your help in making this happen, but I hope providing you with exciting new merch will make it all worth it! In addition to your contribution, all sales on artwork outside of this campaign in the next two months will go directly to this project. If we don't reach the entire goal, your money will still count! Orders for merch will still be placed, but it is unlikely that I will be able to travel to Saint John to install my work. The money would instead be directed to shipping the work to Shop Visitors and studio costs in Montreal.

The Impact

My first indiegogo campaign back in 2018 was a huge success. As a young artist, I believe in the importance of accessibility, so my decision to make printed apparel is a tangible next step. It is equally as important to connect with my peers, as it is to connect with experienced collectors. This process has been an amazing way to get to know you all, and has given me the confidence to move forward in new directions that I never thought possible!

With your help, this project will afford me the opportunity to grow my practice in new ways, which I hope to share with you every step of the way!

Risks & Challenges

Producing this merch is equally as important to me as my upcoming exhibition. Time management and organization are tasks that I am constantly working to improve. Every time I take on a new project I learn things about myself, my expectations, your expectations, and my ability to deliver the ideas I propose. Each new project brings its own set of challenges and obstacles, but ultimately I am committed to learning, listening, and doing my best to make it all happen. Over the next few months, I will work diligently to make sure everything gets done. If there is a hiccup in the plan, I'll be sure to keep you updated. All I ask is for your patience since it's a one woman show! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometime you just can't contribute, and I completely understand. Instead, please consider sharing my campaign with your friends and family - or anyone you think might be interested in my project!

Spread the word through social media or word of mouth, I am grateful for it all!

Thanks for taking the time to read all about my campaign. And please feel free to reach out with any questions or concerns.

xoxo,

Hailey

story:
Meet Bananoctopus!

He's our new hero who will save humanity from the stupid falls on banana skins.

In April, he goes to AfrikaBurn 2020 and invites you with him!

AfrikaBurn is the official regional Burning Man event held annually at the Tankwa Karoo National Park in South Africa since 2007.

 

 

We are The Why Not Bananas Crew, we have repeatedly participated in the construction of art objects at festivals such as Burning Man in Nevada, Insomnia and Ogonёk in Russia. Most of our team are members of the Russian Burners community, the official representative of Burning Man in Russia.

The construction of Bananoktopus is our first foreign experience as a separate team, therefore this project is so important for us.
 

 

How was Bananoctopus born?

In one of the Moscow laboratories, the first experimental sample of a non-slip banana skin was developed.

Using the latest genome editing technology, the banana DNA was changed to which the octopus gene was added.

As a result of the experiment, suction cups appeared on the skin, which made it completely non-slip on any surface; moreover, the skin with suction cups became convenient to use during ice!

 

Installation

An art object 6.5 meters high is a peeled banana, standing on 4 of 5 banana skins.



In the shadow of an object, under it, up to 20 people can comfortably be in sunbeds.

On the inside of the banana skins are speakers in the form of octopus suckers, from which music sounds.



Bananoctopus also acts as a telephone booth. On the walls of banana skins are located handsets in the form of bananas. If you pick up one of the handsets, a neon light comes on at the auxiliary object, the interlocutors can hear each other. You can call in both directions - both from the central object and from the auxiliary.

From the inside, the banana design glows with warm white light. When darkness falls, the backlight will turn on, and lasers will pierce the lasers from the eyes of the banana.

 

How can you help us

The AfrikaBurn organizers noted our project with a grant, but it does not cover all our expenses. We need money for the illumination and transportation of Bananoktopus, rental of power tools, a workshop for the manufacture of parts and a manipulator for assembling the entire structure on site. Therefore, we ask you for help.


For all who support our project, we have prepared memorable gifts!

 

We are in social networks:

https://www.facebook.com/pg/bananoctopus

https://instagram.com/bananoctopus

story:
African Skies (Forthcoming album from the Jemal Ramirez Group)

African Skies, is a music project of a lifetime. I am humbled to be a part of this creative group of people who has made time to collaborate together under my name.

I have been playing drums since I was a toddler, under the influences of my father (also a musician) and his stellar jazz record collection. I have devoted much my life to the understanding and practice of music. Countless music teachers and experiences have brought me to where I am today.

This campaign "African Skies" is important to me because, for the first time in my life I feel I have reached a level I believe people want to listen to and could recognize as my sound. With so many examples of great jazz music before us, it is easy to get lost copying other peoples sound. 

Your contribution will enable us, the Jemal Ramirez Group to continue reaching people with our recorded music and also in live concerts and shows. The unfortunate truth is, Jazz music is not profitable under the old music making model. We need Patrons (like you) who can afford to contribute funds to back our attempts to bring artful, joyful and soulful music to you the listener on the web and at the jazz club or venues you frequent.

Risks & challenges are always part of the music lifestyle, however, there is little risk here in your contribution as the music has already been written and recorded with an amazing cast of today's best jazz musicians, top notch sound was captured by Dan Feiszli at Fantasy Recording Studios. Our product is second to none . Our first album "Pomponio" was well received and was on JazzWeek's Top 50 countdown for several weeks earlier this year (2016).

The costs we are looking to cover look like this for follow up album "African Skies:

$600 Mastering

$600 Music Licensing for Covers of Jazz Standards/Classics

$2400 Manufacturing CD's

$2200 Radio Promotion

$1500 Mailing CD's to Radio

$5000 Subsidized Travel for Mini-Tour


If you are unable to contribute money, you can still help us by forwarding our cause to someone who might support our endeavor. Please share with anyone you believe would do so.


Sincerely,

Jemal Ramirez
