story:
SAM (Street Art for Mankind) is a 5-year Art movement featuring 30 of the most famous street artists on a mission to help stop child slavery.

 

The first edition of SAM will take place in Miami, February 11-20th 2017. It will feature:

 

  • A unique artistic masterpiece made out of 16 containers.
  • 12,000 sq. feet of murals as a gigantic tribute to the children of the world. 
  • A very fun exhibition where you will see, but also touch, hear and even smell things. 
  • Creating your own street art piece using the same techniques as the artists.
  • Learning from Art gurus about the graffiti world (technique, artists…)

The next editions of SAM will occur in Paris, Sao Paulo, Dubai and Seoul. 5 years, 5 continents, 5 exhibitions.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

More than 30 talented and well-known graffiti artists will be gathered in a single location to work collaboratively. They will create an unprecedented spontaneous masterpiece. They will build a 12,000 square foot “exquisite corpse” made out of 16 containers, reviving the surrealist technique of the 1930’s. Artists work side by side not knowing and seeing what the other artists are creating… A great challenge in perspective!

This united artistic performance will educate, inspire, and ultimately be auctioned to raise money for the fight against child slavery. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Discover SAM artists from all over the world:

 

 

  • Abstrk / USA
  • Ador / France
  • Victor Ash / France / Denmark
  • Shallak Attack (Clandestinos)/ Canada / Chili
  • Bruno Smoky  (Clandestinos) / Brazil /Canada
  • Btoy / Spain
  • Crash / USA
  • Nate Dee / USA
  • Eltono/ France / Spain
  • Ethos / Brazil
  • Gaia / USA
  • Hoxxoh / USA
  • Hyuro  / Argentina / Spain
  • Agostino Iacurci / Italy
  • Icy & Sot / Iran / USA
  • Kashink / France
  • Kazilla / USA
  • KinMx / Mexico / Irland
  • Eduardo Kobra / Brazil
  • David McCauley / USA
  • Claudio Picasso / USA
  • Remote / USA
  • Surge / USA
  • Trek6 USA / Puerto Rico
  • Michelle Vazquez (Yuhmi) / USA
  • Victor Vazquez (Yuhmi) / USA / Mexico

We will be revealing new artists attending SAM almost every day. Stay tuned to our social media!

 

 

 

 

 

The heart of the exhibition is the Art masterpiece. We need your help to raise $50,000 to build from ground-up this spectacular and creative piece that will shape the future of millions of children. 

 

Your contributions are all tax deductible in the US (501c3). They will help finance main expenses of this masterpiece, amongst which:

 

  • Travels, rooms, and boards for artists.
  • General contractor and permits.
  • Purchase of materials like containers, spray paint, brushes, markers and tarps for artists.
  • Equipment rental like trucks, cranes, trailers and forklifts to put together the exhibition.
  • Plywood boards, displays, paperboards, speakers, lighting for the exhibition scenography.

 

Every dollar counts! We have worked hard to organize the event and gather the artists. We need your support to make this epic event happen!

If you want to support SAM through material donation, please contact us at: hello@streetartmankind.org

 

 

 

 

 

We recognize that giving money is not in the cards for many people, but this cause is for everyone, regardless of whether or not you can make a monetary contribution. For everyone, we gently ask that you to share this page with your friends and family. Tell them why you think it's a great project, and ask for their support.

The SAM team thanks you all so much for your support.

 

 

 

We're offering many rewards, including these perks:

 

  • SAM Miami Event tickets:  Early bird single tickets, guided tour VIP ticket, opening and auction tickets. Limited quantity so it may not last long.
  • SAM T-shirts, hoodies and Sunglasses exclusively designed for everyone who attends the event or back the Indiegogo campaign (limited editions). See samples below.
  • Fine Art Prints (limited editions) and screensavers from SAM graffiti artists. See example below
  • Tickets to Miami’s Best Venues: Adrienne Arsht Center and New World Symphony.

 

 

 

 

During the event, SAM will raise awareness and funds for the foundation of the Nobel Peace Prize winner Kailash Satyarthi.

100% of the donations gathered during the SAM exhibition, including all the proceeds of the Art auction sales, will be given directly to the Kailash Satyarthi’s Children Foundation (KSCF) to help rescue and rehabilitate enslaved children across the world.

Kailash Satyarthi, Nobel Peace Prize winner, has been advocating for children’s rights for more than 30 years. He has organized worldwide marches, changed national and international laws, and personally freed children from exploitation.

 

 

 

There are too many children that are deprived of their childhood, potential and dignity everywhere in the world. We are building today the generation of tomorrow. "Every minute counts, every child counts, every childhood counts." - Kailash Satyarthi.

 

 

KSCF is working globally to end child slavery and child labor through a holistic approach:

 

  • Freeing children from slavery and labor, and sending them back to school,
  • Building child-friendly villages free from child labor, child marriage and where every child goes to school child labor,
  • Building knowledge through research and training to address gaps and ensure child-friendly policies and laws,
  • Engaging children and youth in a campaign focused on ending child slavery by instilling compassion and creating global citizens.​

 

“Thanks in large measure to Mr Satyarthi’s heroic work, the world has moved from denial about abusive child labor to acknowledgement, awareness and action.” UN Secretary General Ban Ki Moon.

 

 

 

Thibault, Audrey and Eric are 3 art lovers who truly believe in the power of art to heal the world. They have joined forces through this non-profit organization to lead a large street art movement and organize events in support of children.
story_txt:
SAM (Street Art for Mankind) is a 5-year Art movement featuring 30 of the most famous street artists on a mission to help stop child slavery. The first edition of SAM will take place in Miami, February 11-20th 2017. It will feature: 
A unique artistic masterpiece made out of 16 containers.
12,000 sq. feet of murals as a gigantic tribute to the children of the world. 
A very fun exhibition where you will see, but also touch, hear and even smell things. 
Creating your own street art piece using the same techniques as the artists.
Learning from Art gurus about the graffiti world (technique, artists…)
The next editions of SAM will occur in Paris, Sao Paulo, Dubai and Seoul. 5 years, 5 continents, 5 exhibitions.        More than 30 talented and well-known graffiti artists will be gathered in a single location to work collaboratively. They will create an unprecedented spontaneous masterpiece. They will build a 12,000 square foot “exquisite corpse” made out of 16 containers, reviving the surrealist technique of the 1930’s. Artists work side by side not knowing and seeing what the other artists are creating… A great challenge in perspective!This united artistic performance will educate, inspire, and ultimately be auctioned to raise money for the fight against child slavery.        Discover SAM artists from all over the world:

story:
WHO WAS FRANK PICK?

Frank Pick was Chief Executive of London Transport during the 1930s, the Golden Age of London Underground design. His progressive vision and flair for design led him to commission some of the most recognisable design icons in London Transport history, including the Johnston typeface, the Charles Holden designed stations, the roundel and revolutionary graphic posters.

For Pick, good design was not an optional extra to make things look good, but a central part of London Underground’s ‘fitness for purpose’.  His leadership and vision to create a streamlined and cohesive Underground service has revolutionised the way we travel around London. From advertising and branding to architecture and integrated design, Pick transformed a struggling and dysfunctional structure into ‘the most famous and respected transport system in the world’ (Nikolaus Pevsner, 1942).

‘The test of the goodness of a thing is its fitness for use. If it fails on this first test, no amount of ornamentation or finish will make it any better; it will only make it more expensive, more foolish’ (Frank Pick, 1916)

 

HELP US PUT FRANK PICK BACK ON LONDON'S MAP

Frank Pick’s contribution to London’s transport is unparalleled, but his legacy is largely unknown and unacknowledged. Your support will enable us to complete a permanent memorial in Piccadilly Circus station to remember and celebrate Frank Pick on the 75th anniversary of his death.

Sam Mullins, Director at London Transport Museum, said: “Most people recognise the world-famous Tube logo and the early London Transport publicity posters yet know very little about the man who commissioned this modern design for London's transport system”.

Our memorial will showcase Pick’s extraordinary achievements to over 42 million people who travel through Piccadilly Circus each year, raising awareness of the man behind the iconic designs Londoners, and people the world over, know and love today.

Without Frank Pick, London would lack the transport system fitting of a world city. Our commemoration will return Pick to a central position in the identity of London within Piccadilly Circus station, a building whose beautiful early modern design he commissioned from architect Charles Holden. The memorial will form the finale to Transport for London and London Transport Museum’s 18-month programme Transported by Design, establishing Pick’s reputation as a pioneering visionary and highlighting the transformative effect excellent design has had on our Capital.

 

WHAT WE WILL ACHIEVE

BAFTA-winning and Turner Prize nominated artists Langlands & Bell have been commissioned to produce the Frank Pick memorial, a public sculptural installation.

Located in Piccadilly Circus station, iconic for its circular design and its location at the centre of London, it will bring together the most enduring and immediately recognisable components of the London Transport design identity commissioned by Pick – Edward Johnston’s typeface, Charles Holden designed stations and crucially the roundel – the circular logo of the London Underground that is recognised the world over.

The installation will incorporate Frank Pick’s name in neon light, on the familiar and much loved roundel, and Pick’s own words will be presented adjacent in polished cast bronze letters using the Johnston font. Our memorial will be unveiled on the 7 November 2016 to mark the 75th anniversary of Pick’s death and the centenary of the Johnston typeface.

 

ABOUT LONDON TRANSPORT MUSEUM

London Transport Museum is the world’s leading museum of urban transport. We use the story of transport to encourage, enrich and inspire all Londoners and those who love this city to get the most out of London.

In summer 2015 Transport for London and London Transport Museum launched an 18-month programme of events and exhibitions highlighting how transport has shaped London and, through good design, made life in the Capital better. The Frank Pick memorial located in Piccadilly Circus Underground station will conclude the programme, illustrating the innovative ways good design has transformed the transport network and helped London to grow into a world class city.

story:
Pop-Up Art US Tour is a film capturing the artist’s view of America to make art exhibitions more spontaneous and accessible. Pop-Up Art is designed to inspire. Popping up, either online or in person, creates a window of immediacy that accentuates the art experience.
 

Long-time film collaborators Artist Zox and Videographer Cru exhibited Zox paintings in galleries and cultural venues across the states and back, including Santa Monica, Silicon Valley, Tulsa, Memphis, Nashville, Columbus, Brooklyn, Manhattan, D.C., New Orleans, Austin, Taos and Los Angeles.

We’d like you and those on the verge of creative careers to see this inspirational film. Our next step is a nationwide pop-up film tour at university art and film departments and museums. Screenings will be followed by discussions on how best to disseminate art to those from every walk of life. 

While in college, Zox had a chance to interact directly with Andy Warhol and Alan Ginsberg, the most influential events of his artistic life. Inspired by those encounters, our Pop-Up Art mission is to create events in that same vein.

In an era in which art programs are being pared to the bone, you can help bring light to the coming generation of creative minds. We would appreciate your funding help. Please see perks offered.  

Thanks so much for your art-felt consideration!

Zox & Cru

popup@zoxart.com

story:
We need your support

Fascinated by towers and old buildings? Love intrigue and exploration?

We are working on opening up our tower to the public as a mysterious and exciting 'Escape Room.' We would like to present to you an opportunity to experience this historic building while supporting our non-profit's renovation efforts.  It's a unique fundraiser that supports the ongoing maintenance of our building.

An infusion of funds from our campaign supporters will go toward fixing up and outfitting areas of the building that will be part of the Tower Escape Room experience.

We are a team of artists and builders that have a wide range of skills and some hardcore dedication to putting this experience together for you.

 

What is an Escape Room?

An escape room is a physical adventure game in which players solve a series of puzzles using clues, hints and strategy to complete objectives revealed in the course of action. Players are given a set time limit to unveil the secret plot which is hidden within the rooms.  There are secret codes, hidden messages, riddles, mazes, gears, levers, and pulleys. The rooms are often set in imaginary locales like a prison, a hotel, a dungeon etc.

OUR tower, however, is real...

 

Tell me about the Tower

This is Woodside. Built for Victorian industrialist and inventor Henry Burden in memory of his wife, Helen, after her early demise.

(It is a monument to enduring love)

For over a hundred years the tower has been closed to the public, open only to a select group of appointed officials. For decades and decades the church served the descendants of Burden’s factories, and as the centuries turned the walls began to crumble, and grass began to grow high in the meadow.

The church congregation dwindled and the lights no longer shone through the stained glass windows. It sat empty and vacant for years.

(Until it caught our eye)

A few years ago we became stewards of this building and set about making her right again. Buttoning up roofs, and putting stones back together again. We began to explore every nook and cranny, creaked opened latches, long sealed. Mysteries emerged, and we began to find strange and unusual things...

 

So what is it going to take?

We already have the perfect setting, and we are a veritable factory of creative talent and seasoned builders. We are no strangers to hard work and are excited to get this underway.

We just need a bit of influx of funds.

A goal amount of $2,900 starts us off running. Any funds raised over the initial amount will open up more space and corridors for you to explore. Each $3,000 will complete an entire additional room. The more funds raised, the more of the tower you can climb up into or descend down within.

Ticket pre-sells are the main generator of this campaign. All donations of $25 and over are rewarded with reduced-price entrance to Tower Escapes. We also have a limited number of beta-test tickets available for those of you who want to get a sneak peak as the process is getting developed.
 

And what does your non-profit do?

The Post Contemporary is the new name of the Contemporary Artists Center. We own and operate an art center in Troy, NY. We have been serving artists since 1990.

Our mission is to support artists thinking and/or working beyond the confines of the established art world, enabling them to influence the development of future concepts, systems, and communities.

Through our artists' residencies, art studios, workshops, lectures, innovative exhibitions and performances the Post Contemporary fosters the  creation and appreciation of insightful and engaging contemporary art.

The Post Contemporary is committed to vigorous creative dialog, active community engagement and neighborhood revitalization through preservation, sustainability and the arts.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Here's the thing.

You maybe have seen our buildings, or you maybe are into exploration, or maybe the mysterious is a siren call to you, but you're short on funds at the moment.

We could still use your help!

We need help spreading the word and extra hands putting together the escape room build.

We have an experienced team of artists, a stack of plans, and a room full of tools, but could always use more brains and hands. If you are a maker or a builder, have ideas, puzzles, set dressing, carpentry or mechanical skills, or just want to pitch in with labor or painting walls we would welcome you with open arms.

story:
My name is Sarah Ritt.  I am an artist who loves to work with my hands--with yarn, with thread, with fabric, found objects, tarot cards and vibrant shades of acrylic paint.  I love the act of transforming materials into something that transcends them.  For as physical and sensual as this joyous process is, what I am learning through research is that it is online art sales that are skyrocketing and blowing the art market wide open today.   For further information, this article on Barron's website illustrates this perfectly: http://www.barrons.com/articles/online-art-sale... . 

Art Storefronts is an exciting new way for me to create my own virtual gallery online with up to date features, informing buyers more clearly than ever before of what they are getting--even how a piece will look on their wall and what its precise dimensions will be.   It is this key information which boosts sales, helping me to realize a new level of financial success and sustainability as a working artist.  For more information about this wonderful company you can click on this link: http://blog.artstorefronts.com/?gclid=CM6Oht7co... .

The money that you are contributing to my campaign will fund the guidance, support and technical tools that Art Storefronts will provide me as I get my online gallery up and running.

story:
Generalidades

 

The dream of every emerging artist, is that their work could circulate and be recognized by the world, for that reason a came to this platform in order to show what i do and find people that want to collaborate, have faith and contribute to this process of formation and projection.

I am a Colombian artist that is fighting to achieve my professional goals. Recently i receive an invitation letter from an art gallery in Zagreb, Croatia and i would like to take this amazing opportunity.     

What is Picha Esotérica (Esoteric Cock)?

 

Picha Esotérica (Esoteric Cock), is an artwork that  reflects Jose Sierra inside, the self-portrait becomes a mechanism that revitalizes the afflicted.

This project born after a state of crisis, since that moment until now, the project has evolved as part of the nutrition and experience that the world that surround me, has given me.

 

Why i need it?

 

For several months i've been managing in different spaces, an exhibition of my work, I have contacted the places that may conceive my work as a relevant model within its artistic guidelines and processes.

Recently i receive an invitation letter by the Greta Art Gallery in Zagreb, Croatia (Ilica 92, 10000 Zagreb, Croacia) in order to do an exhibition of my most recent work, this exhibition will take place in September 2017; for this reason, i start a search for resources to carry out this project, because the invitation does not cover the amount for the transfer and stay in croatia.

At this moment I am in a phase of effervescence, my work takes shape and generates a visual voice from the local to the universal, the work generates readings and feelings that depends on the viewer, so then their degree of relevance varies, however I am a witness Of this situation therefore I affirm without hesitation that the creative contents that as an artist produce must be circulated in spaces and contexts to generate and be contributing in the dynamics of knowledge and aesthetics for the world.

This is an important step in my career, an amazing opportunity to show my work and my vision of the world.  

I hope that with the support of the people and institutions a can make things happen.

 

Who i am?

Jose Sierra, is a Colombian Artist of 27 years old, whose work is a reflection of himself, Jose Sierra has been invited to several art exhibitions in his country and in Europe.

In 2016 was nominated to the Luxemburgo Art Prize by the gallery Herver Lancelin and had the opportunity to exhibit his work

Born in June 8th of 1990 in Cartagena de Indias, Colombia; the eldest of four siblings. Studied and obtained the degree of Plastic Artist in 2012 in the University of science and fine arts of Bolivar (UNIBAC) www.unibac.edu.co

Jose Sierra start his path in the world of art at very young age, his passion and love for the visual, the color and shapes took him to explore this world; and later as an artist, his curiosity and sensibility took him to explore himself, his loves and deceptions, his fears and happiness, all this is imprinted in his work, making his pieces be a look inside him.

 

Why do i do it?

My work is a contribution from the aesthetic experience for societies, the content that my work narrates does not distance itself from the forms that expand human knowledge, because clearly my work is a reading of how I assume the experience of the world, history through Of the referents and the contemporaneity and its bombardment of information, since then I consider myself a cultural producer, since it manifested a vision in collective, but from the aesthetic reflection, and gender new contents in the universal multicultural dialogue.

My work project is a model that generates knowledge as it is an exclusive product that generates a new reality for culture and the world.

 

Cuánto requieres?

5.394,5796 USD,

Thank you so much for your help!

If you are unable to give, 

please take a moment to share my Facebook page:

https://www.facebook.com/jose.e.vega.50
story_txt:
Generalidades The dream of every emerging artist, is that their work could circulate and be recognized by the world, for that reason a came to this platform in order to show what i do and find people that want to collaborate, have faith and contribute to this process of formation and projection.
I am a Colombian artist that is fighting to achieve my professional goals. Recently i receive an invitation letter from an art gallery in Zagreb, Croatia and i would like to take this amazing opportunity.     
What is Picha Esotérica (Esoteric Cock)? Picha Esotérica (Esoteric Cock), is an artwork that  reflects Jose Sierra inside, the self-portrait becomes a mechanism that revitalizes the afflicted.
This project born after a state of crisis, since that moment until now, the project has evolved as part of the nutrition and experience that the world that surround me, has given me. Why i need it? For several months i've been managing in different spaces, an exhibition of my work, I have contacted the places that may conceive my work as a relevant model within its artistic guidelines and processes.
Recently i receive an invitation letter by the Greta Art Gallery in Zagreb, Croatia (Ilica 92, 10000 Zagreb, Croacia) in order to do an exhibition of my most recent work, this exhibition will take place in September 2017; for this reason, i start a search for resources to carry out this project, because the invitation does not cover the amount for the transfer and stay in croatia.
At this moment I am in a phase of effervescence, my work takes shape and generates a visual voice from the local to the universal, the work generates readings and feelings that depends on the viewer, so then their degree of relevance varies, however I am a witness Of this situation therefore I affirm without hesitation that the creative contents that as an artist produce must be circulated in spaces and contexts to generate and be contributing in the dynamics of knowledge and aesthetics for the world.
This is an important step in my career, an amazing opportunity to show my work and my vision of the world.  
I hope that with the support of the people and institutions a can make things happen. Who i am?

story:
Who we are...what we want to do....

We are the Weal Family: Dave, Linda and Paula Weal.

We own Gallery 3040, and art gallery and gift shop in Old Forge, NY.

We love art.  We think art is for everyone, and we want everyone to have access to great art.  

There is a wall on the outside of the gallery...right now a pretty boring wall...we think this wall is a great opportunity to bring some art to the community of Old Forge.

We have asked our friend, a great artist, Cindy Panella, if she would be interested in helping us make some art public by adding a mural to the side of our building.  We thought of Cindy first because of her attitude toward art and because her work has heart.

Cindy is primarily known for her work in ceramics, but what sets here apart in all media is her imagination.

By contributing to our campaign, you will help us to realize our dream of bringing a large-scale public art project to a small community in the Adirondacks.  Not only will it make a statement about art being everywhere, and in unexpected places, but it will bring joy to the thousands who see it.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $4800 to cover the cost of painting supplies and equipment. And to pay Cindy for her time and talent.  This will also help to offset the cost of printing the poster we are using as an incentive.

We are offering two main levels of support.  At the $25 level we are offering a beautiful poster depicting one of Cindy's paintings, "Berries of Blue".

At the $100 level we are offering 4 copies of the poster (one for you and three to share with your friends) as well as your name painted on an inside wall of Gallery 3040 thanking you for supporting our project.

  • The painting supplies alone cost $1800.  All additional proceeds will go toward paying the artist.  
  • Should we raise more money than needed additional funds will go to support additional public art projects in this community.

 

Art Inspires...

Art enhances our lives and it beautifies our communities.  It inspires people to think and to try and to grow and to wonder.  We think this mural will demonstrate to visitors and residents alike that this is a community that appreciates the arts and all the benefits art brings.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please let your friends about other art lovers know about our project.  We are not very techy ourselves so if you use twitter or Instagram or other platforms, please help us to get the word out.  #AdirondackMural

Also, stop by and check out the progress and cheer Cindy along!  Stop in the Gallery and ask questions.

And when it's done, please stop by and take pictures!  Pose with your friends, and have fun.  Art is fun!!!

story:
I'm a local Artist and grew up in Southend-on-Sea in the 1970s & ‘80s. I've always been inspired by living by the sea and painted many local iconic buildings and structures over the years so I’ve designed a hand drawn "toile" style Southend-on-Sea themed Wallpaper to celebrate our town. 

The design contains familiar landmarks such as the Kursaal, the Bowling Alley on the Pier, the Palace Hotel, the Golden Hind, the Crooked House, Southchurch Hall, the Cliff Lift, Rossi's Ice Cream Cabin in the High Street alongside Cockles, Mussels, Winkles and Seafood. A closer look reveals a giant Container Ship, the Mulberry Harbour, the recently demolished Grain Chimney, Kiteboarders, Seagulls, Bathers and an Easyjet coming in to land. 

The Wallpaper has a repeat pattern and is rendered in stylish Charcoal with a light Grey background. The detailed design lends itself to Entrance Hallways, Small Rooms and Feature Walls. It is digitally printed onto Coated Non-Woven paper (which doesn't expand during hanging) and is manufactured by Anstey Wallpaper Company.

Each roll comes in a Standard 52cm x 10 metre length. (Expect 3-4 drops per roll.)

I am offering this original Southend-on-Sea Wallpaper for £80 per roll (+ delivery charge) which is 20% off the agreed £100 RRP.  

I am looking for advance orders to raise the target of £3000 to place an initial order with the manufacturer. After the 60 day crowdfunding campaign ends (on 12 March) I will place the order with Anstey Wallpaper Co. The manufacturing and delivery will take between 4-7 weeks.

I hope to produce a matching fabric and other colour variations of the original Southend-on-Sea design in the future, as well as new Bespoke Wallpaper designs and appreciate any feedback or thoughts.

Thanks

Grant.

story:
Who Are We and What Do We Want?

We are a group of highly skilled individuals, also known as "SuperStars"! We are merging together this year to create a unified vision of excellence and community building. With the joint forces of 2016 projects such as The Octopussy art car, Radically Adequate sound and theme camp (Apo), Camp Lackadaisical (Apo) and the Colorado Guild of Mile Higher Knowledge (BM), we are honored to now bring you; Event Horizon Colorado! 

Some of the people on our team, and what they plan to contribute to our village, Event Horizon:

Guthrey and Kitty - Octopussy Mutant Vehicle


The Octopussy is a mutant vehicle that explores the depths of space and time.  As an octopus/cat hybrid creature, she has ears and nose like a cat, eyes and tentacles like an octopus; all perched atop a Geo.  The Octopussy is able to change color on the fly thanks to being radically illuminated with 6000 sound reactive LEDs.  The Geo is decorated to appear as a rock in the interstellar ocean and the interior is a plush underwater lounge where Apogaeans can rest their weary fins.  

At Apogaea 2016, basking in the glow of the Octopussy during her inaugural festival celebration, Guthrey proposed to Kitty. This night we were overwhelmed with joy to see how much Apogaeans loved the Octopussy. This project was just a dream before we started dating and through the literal blood, sweat, and tears, we found that there is nothing that could ever separate us or stifle our drive to bring the Octopussy to life. Sharing this art piece with people brings us so much satisfaction, we want to continue to bring this interactive art piece to the Apogaea community.  

In order to realize the dreams of sharing this art, we a small amount of funding.  This will go towards upgrading the visual appearance of this project in multiple ways, including the addition of fiber optic whiskers, as well as improving the interactivity of this art piece.  For Apogaea 2017, we plan on hosting stationary/imaginary driving tests and issuing Octopussy driver's licenses.  We also plan on crafting little tentacle babies to give away to lucky Apogaeans!  

Learn more about the Octopussy at https://www.facebook.com/tentaclesforall 

In addition to building the Octopussy, Kitty has worked with 3 different production companies over the past 7 years.  Through this she has hosted an uncountable number of shows and helped fundraise for many different causes.  In addition, she has created 3 different community groups including: Cooking for a Cause (which brings healthy, nutritious food to people in recovery), Crunk Cookbook Club, and the Denver Art Car Collective.  Kitty has a passion for organizing and orchestrating and brings all of that energy and focus to her work with the Octopussy and Event Horizon!

Jay Wood (Dubwood) – Warp Drive Beacon

Last year, confusion plagued the wandering spirits of Apogaea. Where are the event boundaries? Where are camps located? How do I get back to center camp? What did I step in? Our camp is located in a remote area. The problem was that you had travel down a dark road that looked like it was off limits, or led to a seedy van marked “free candy”.  We want to solve this problem by erecting a bright ass beacon that can be seen from nearly every vantage point, especially from center camp.  

The beacon will be a free-standing structure with an arrangement of the LED’s at the top in the fashion of a Supercluster. This representation of multiple galaxies within galaxies, is in sync with our camp theme, and the purpose of having a navigational tool up in the sky for the community to utilize.  This project serves one purpose; to establish a point of reference. Apogaea is located on such a vast piece property, and much like the burn, people get lost.  Kick ass. Help us get this warp drive beacon off the ground (pun intended), and contribute to our Indiegogo campaign.

Jay Wood (Dubwood) – Sound Engineer and Fabricator of OVRSOUND

Several years ago, OVRSOUND was created. OVRSOUND’s goal was to create a medium sized, high powered, 5 way sound system that excelled in a festival type environment. The man behind this lofty project is Jay Wood (Dubwood).  With other sound companies like Funktion 1, and Void, the demand for high performing touring and club audio rigs has raised the bar for audio quality. Not only prime sound companies like these have raised the bar, but the music produced today covers such a wide spectrum of frequencies that a finely tuned sound rig is essential.

Run of the mill sound rigs you buy from a retail outlet don’t cut it anymore. Sure you can buy something that is adequate, but who want’s that. You really need a rig that can be tuned on the fly, cover the most desired frequencies, designed to perform a certain way at a certain power level, and each cabinet has a particular function, and digitally processed to achieve crystal clear sound within those desired frequencies, all the while consuming minimal power.

Enter OVRSOUND.

Jay Wood (Dubwood) strives to not only build a highly functional, crystal clear, transportable sound rig, but also construct a work of art. With a striking red and black design, and a very custom look, this amazing rig not only gets rave reviews on the sound quality, but also gets compliments on the visual impact.  Using the best construction techniques, latest enclosure designs, latest technology, and the correct drivers paired with proper enclosure, OVRSOUND is accomplishing a tremendous amount of sound with relatively little power. This is engineering a system that is highly efficient. This is ideal.

As OVRSOUND strives to accomplish pure audio perfection, the second version of the rig is under development (OVRSOUND 2.0). Striving to achieve even greater efficiency, adding more cabinets, and the introduction of LIVE audio tuning through Digital Sound Processing, OVRSOUND needs donations to evolve and keep blowing minds at our events.  OVRSOUND is reserved for Event Horizon events. OVRSOUND is not a PA rental company. The rig is not for hire, sale, or structured as a “for profit” business. We bust out this bad boy for you to enjoy at our events and at Apogaea. A custom, high fidelity sound rig that keeps people coming back time and time again to experience.

Help us get achieve audio perfection. Donate today!

Mary Hall aka Malia

Mary has been building theme camps since her first year on the playa! After buying her Burning Man tickets on a whim back in 2011, she jumped in full force and organized a 32 person theme camp in 7 weeks. Since then she has built more than a handful of theme camps at both Apogaea and Burning Man, as well as participating at a high level in several community projects & events over the last years including being on the board of directors for Colorado's regionally sanctioned decompression in 2012. In 2016 Mary attended the Burning Man Global Leadership  Conference which helped further her knowledge and skills within the Burning Man community. Mary owns a production company and has been building her reputation as a top notch event producer in Denver. Her strengths are in people management, organization, finance and overall event production. Malia is her "artist/DJ"  alias. Please check out some of her work on Soundcloud! https://soundcloud.com/maliawhomp

Brandon DeRosa - Phoenix Cluster Shade Structure

Brandon is excited to be apart of this project because he feels it's a huge stepping stone for making our little village stand out and become more comfortable. He also feel that the "Phoenix Cluster" is a perfect place to house future entertainment projects and also become a key gathering spot for the village.

What We Need & What You Get

Our Hopeful Budget
Our overall village budget is $8,750, while our IndieGoGo goal is only $2500. We've raised, and plan to raise the rest of our budget with local events and further fund raising!! While each of our main projects did apply for Apogaea art grants, none of them received funding during the first round. We are hopeful that some funding will be granted during round two, however the maximum that we may receive is <$599 per project. Due to our lack of funding we had to reduce our original budget of $16,000 to ensure we could cover the most pertinent items while still offering an all encompassing community experience! Our village will include a custom built stage, large sound rig, quality lighting scheme, shaded dance floor and chill area, interactive art projects & the Octopussy art car! We will offer community gatherings & workshops along with will hosting daily/nightly events that highlight the wide scope of talented performers in our group! The vision is to create a place in spacetime that once you pass through, you will not be able (or want) to escape! 

There are additional expenses required to build a village such as transportation, consumables, equipment rentals, tools, fuel, waste disposal,  general outdoor supplies & space/storage fees.

  • $8750 Breakdown
    • ​Equipment Rental - $1500
    • Sound/Lights- $1,000
    • Stage - $300
    • Shaded Structure - $1400
    • Transportation/fuel - $500
    • Operations (LNT, signs, warmth, safety 1st!) - $550
    • Gifts/Swag/Perks - $500
    • (Reduced) Art projects - $1000
    • Consumables - $1500 
    • ​Incidentals (because 90% of luck is preparation) - $500 

What We Have To Offer!
We're very excited to present a large variety of perks, ALL of which are something created by a member of Event Horizon and/or our local community. Check out all the cool stuff we've got!

Stickers - $5
Everyone loves stickers!! These stickers will feature the out-of-this-world Event Horizon logo designed by one of our very own Event Horizon members, and Colorado local, Jay Wood.

Post Cards - $7
Signed by the aliens, astronauts, and artists of Event Horizon, we'll actually ship this post card to you from Outer Space!

Well... we'll at least sign it together at our Event Horizon village at the end of the Universe (Apogaea), and send it to you afterwards.

Pendants - $10

This pendant was cut by alien laser beams...
Or maybe it was cut in one of our very own artist's workshop. But hey, we're all aliens anyways!

Hand Woven Rainbow Scarf - $25

Knitted by the talented Nici Elizabeth! Includes a sticker & pendant! 

Autographed Musician Package -$30

Own a signed, unreleased mix from each of our village DJ's! Our music masters of the Universe include, but are not limited to:

DubWood - https://soundcloud.com/dubwood

Malia - https://soundcloud.com/maliawhomp

Messenger of Secrets - https://soundcloud.com/messengerofsecrets

B Funky - https://soundcloud.com/b-funky-1

Just B - https://www.facebook.com/just.b.humble/

+++???+++ TBA!!!

T-Shirts - $35


Join the Event Horizon Crew and sport our official Space shirt.
These shirts are extremely limited edition! After this campaign, the opportunity of own one is in the black hole.

Bundle Pack - $50
Looking for *all* the swag? Here is it, The Big Bang! This is the best swag pack in the Universe.

You'll get our sweet Event Horizon crew T-shirt, a E.H. Pendant to wear around your neck, a signed post card sent from the edge of the Universe, and a dope sticker to put where ever you want.

Professional Music/Production lessons - $50 - $100 

$50 - 1 hour "you pick" session with Ben Easley, Messenger of Secrets - guitar, bass, music, recording, arranging, mixing, live sound, producing lessons.

$75 - 2 hours

$100 - 4 x 1 hour lessons or equivalent

Rare Pressed Record - $85 ($150 value!!)

Autographed Rare Press record with the production work of our village sound engineer, Jay Wood/DubWood. 

Custom Fur Coat w/ LEDs- $500

A Rachdiculous burn coat is a one of a kind work of art, crafted with function in mind and made just for you! This perk is not just a coat, but an experience! We will begin with a fitting and design consultation to assess your needs and add your style! Custom piece includes lifetime repairs and will be done in time for Apo if purchased by April 30!

Custom Warp Drive Sculpture - $500
This 1/16th scale Warp Drive is inspired by the Event Horizon movie itself.
A great piece to add to any Earthing's personal collection, you won't find another one of these puppies anywhere in the Universe.
It features custom metal work by one of our Event Horizon Crew Members, Vince Kenny.

Custom Lowrider Bike - $500
Riding off into space? Need a custom ride? Complete with a leather seat?

This is a custom made Lowrider bike welded by an artist right here in Denver, Colorado.
With it's easily removable front end, this bike can easily be transported in a car. Perfect for Burning Man or just cruising around Denver!

The Impact!

  • We are a collective of artists, musicians, performers, builders, organizers, event producers, healers, and teachers. We create spaces for people to thrive! We offer a welcoming home base for people new to the artist/burner community, while helping them channel their passions and expand their knowledge! We have a team of seasoned burners who wish for nothing more than to share our experience & know-how to achieve one grand vision of unity and radical collaboration. We value the 10 principals and upholding the Burning Man culture. Anyone involved in our project will be encouraged to push beyond their comfort zones and explore what they are truly capable of. With the help from professionals in various trades, we offer a stage for others to reach their highest potential!
  • Our group of lovers, thinkers, builders, creators, and do-ers have also participated in many successful community projects including camps Radically Adequate (Apo 2016), the Octopussy (Apo 2016), Attachment Unavailable (non-Apo 2015), Geological Point of Interest (GPOI) (Apo 2014), Panopolis (Apo 2013), Atom and Eden (Apo 2012), the Dubmarine (Apo 2012), as well as the Temple Build at Apo 2014 in honor of Jenny Kush. 
  • We seek to partner with our wide spread artist community and create a culture of radical inclusion, participation & radical support by offering our time, talents and knowledge both monetarily and energetically to other camps and projects! We believe in abundance and that when we work together, we can further extend our reach to other like-minded artists and visionaries!

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Being our first year as a collective and having a name unknown to the community at large, we are working diligently as a group to get the word out about our vision. Our first fundraiser was a HUGE success due to the hard work of everyone on our team! However, we have many challenges to face due to the lack of funding received from Apogaea and the short amount of turn around time we have to first get funded and then physically build our projects. We have a large vision but not a lot of wo/man power to make it come alive! 
  • Through individual conversations within our friends, family and community members, we hope to inspire others to join our grand vision. You know what they say, "It takes a village" :-)
  • We will be having 1-2 additional fundraisers to help raise money & spread awareness. We also value participating in other camps and projects so that we can show our support on behalf of the bigger picture, the Apogaea Regional Burn. With our community outreach and dedicated crew, we hope to share common ground and find ways to work towards a united vision. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word by posting this on social media! 
  • "Like" & follow us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/EventHorizonColorado/
  • Join us for one of our upcoming community events (Details will be on our facebook page)
  • Consider helping our village expand by camping or partnering with us! There are small camp dues with great benefits included! If you already have a camp, that's ok too! We still would like to talk and hear your thoughts on how we can all help each other reach our goals!

In order to realize the dreams of sharing this art, we a small amount of funding.  This will go towards upgrading the visual appearance of this project in multiple ways, including the addition of fiber optic whiskers, as well as improving the interactivity of this art piece.  For Apogaea 2017, we plan on hosting stationary/imaginary driving tests and issuing Octopussy driver's licenses.  We also plan on crafting little tentacle babies to give away to lucky Apogaeans!  
Learn more about the Octopussy at https://www.facebook.com/tentaclesforall 
In addition to building the Octopussy, Kitty has worked with 3 different production companies over the past 7 years.  Through this she has hosted an uncountable number of shows and helped fundraise for many different causes.  In addition, she has created 3 different community groups including: Cooking for a Cause (which brings healthy, nutritious food to people in recovery), Crunk Cookbook Club, and the Denver Art Car Collective.  Kitty has a passion for organizing and orchestrating and brings all of that energy and focus to her work with the Octopussy and Event Horizon!
Jay Wood (Dubwood) – Warp Drive Beacon
Last year, confusion plagued the wandering spirits of Apogaea. Where are the event boundaries? Where are camps located? How do I get back to center camp? What did I step in? Our camp is located in a remote area. The problem was that you had travel down a dark road that looked like it was off limits, or led to a seedy van marked “free candy”.  We want to solve this problem by erecting a bright ass beacon that can be seen from nearly every vantage point, especially from center camp.  
The beacon will be a free-standing structure with an arrangement of the LED’s at the top in the fashion of a Supercluster. This representation of multiple galaxies within galaxies, is in sync with our camp theme, and the purpose of having a navigational tool up in the sky for the community to utilize.  This project serves one purpose; to establish a point of reference. Apogaea is located on such a vast piece property, and much like the burn, people get lost.  Kick ass. Help us get this warp drive beacon off the ground (pun intended), and contribute to our Indiegogo campaign.
Jay Wood (Dubwood) – Sound Engineer and Fabricator of OVRSOUND

Several years ago, OVRSOUND was created. OVRSOUND’s goal was to create a medium sized, high powered, 5 way sound system that excelled in a festival type environment. The man behind this lofty project is Jay Wood (Dubwood).  With other sound companies like Funktion 1, and Void, the demand for high performing touring and club audio rigs has raised the bar for audio quality. Not only prime sound companies like these have raised the bar, but the music produced today covers such a wide spectrum of frequencies that a finely tuned sound rig is essential.
Run of the mill sound rigs you buy from a retail outlet don’t cut it anymore. Sure you can buy something that is adequate, but who want’s that. You really need a rig that can be tuned on the fly, cover the most desired frequencies, designed to perform a certain way at a certain power level, and each cabinet has a particular function, and digitally processed to achieve crystal clear sound within those desired frequencies, all the while consuming minimal power.
Enter OVRSOUND.
Jay Wood (Dubwood) strives to not only build a highly functional, crystal clear, transportable sound rig, but also construct a work of art. With a striking red and black design, and a very custom look, this amazing rig not only gets rave reviews on the sound quality, but also gets compliments on the visual impact.  Using the best construction techniques, latest enclosure designs, latest technology, and the correct drivers paired with proper enclosure, OVRSOUND is accomplishing a tremendous amount of sound with relatively little power. This is engineering a system that is highly efficient. This is ideal.
As OVRSOUND strives to accomplish pure audio perfection, the second version of the rig is under development (OVRSOUND 2.0). Striving to achieve even greater efficiency, adding more cabinets, and the introduction of LIVE audio tuning through Digital Sound Processing, OVRSOUND needs donations to evolve and keep blowing minds at our events.  OVRSOUND is reserved for Event Horizon events. OVRSOUND is not a PA rental company. The rig is not for hire, sale, or structured as a “for profit” business. We bust out this bad boy for you to enjoy at our events and at Apogaea. A custom, high fidelity sound rig that keeps people coming back time and time again to experience.
Help us get achieve audio perfection. Donate today!
Mary Hall aka Malia
Mary has been building theme camps since her first year on the playa! After buying her Burning Man tickets on a whim back in 2011, she jumped in full force and organized a 32 person theme camp in 7 weeks. Since then she has built more than a handful of theme camps at both Apogaea and Burning Man, as well as participating at a high level in several community projects & events over the last years including being on the board of directors for Colorado's regionally sanctioned decompression in 2012. In 2016 Mary attended the Burning Man Global Leadership  Conference which helped further her knowledge and skills within the Burning Man community. Mary owns a production company and has been building her reputation as a top notch event producer in Denver. Her strengths are in people management, organization, finance and overall event production. Malia is her "artist/DJ"  alias. Please check out some of her work on Soundcloud! https://soundcloud.com/maliawhomp
Brandon DeRosa - Phoenix Cluster Shade Structure
Brandon is excited to be apart of this project because he feels it's a huge stepping stone for making our little village stand out and become more comfortable. He also feel that the "Phoenix Cluster" is a perfect place to house future entertainment projects and also become a key gathering spot for the village.

What We Need & What You Get
Our Hopeful BudgetOur overall village budget is $8,750, while our IndieGoGo goal is only $2500. We've raised, and plan to raise the rest of our budget with local events and further fund raising!! While each of our main projects did apply for Apogaea art grants, none of them received funding during the first round. We are hopeful that some funding will be granted during round two, however the maximum that we may receive is <$599 per project. Due to our lack of funding we had to reduce our original budget of $16,000 to ensure we could cover the most pertinent items while still offering an all encompassing community experience! Our village will include a custom built stage, large sound rig, quality lighting scheme, shaded dance floor and chill area, interactive art projects & the Octopussy art car! We will offer community gatherings & workshops along with will hosting daily/nightly events that highlight the wide scope of talented performers in our group! The vision is to create a place in spacetime that once you pass through, you will not be able (or want) to escape! 
There are additional expenses required to build a village such as transportation, consumables, equipment rentals, tools, fuel, waste disposal,  general outdoor supplies & space/storage fees.

$8750 Breakdown
​Equipment Rental - $1500

Sound/Lights- $1,000
Stage - $300
Shaded Structure - $1400
Transportation/fuel - $500
Operations (LNT, signs, warmth, safety 1st!) - $550
Gifts/Swag/Perks - $500
(Reduced) Art projects - $1000
Consumables - $1500 
​Incidentals (because 90% of luck is preparation) - $500 


What We Have To Offer!We're very excited to present a large variety of perks, ALL of which are something created by a member of Event Horizon and/or our local community. Check out all the cool stuff we've got!
Stickers - $5Everyone loves stickers!! These stickers will feature the out-of-this-world Event Horizon logo designed by one of our very own Event Horizon members, and Colorado local, Jay Wood.
Post Cards - $7Signed by the aliens, astronauts, and artists of Event Horizon, we'll actually ship this post card to you from Outer Space!
Well... we'll at least sign it together at our Event Horizon village at the end of the Universe (Apogaea), and send it to you afterwards.
Pendants - $10

This pendant was cut by alien laser beams...Or maybe it was cut in one of our very own artist's workshop. But hey, we're all aliens anyways!
Hand Woven Rainbow Scarf - $25
Knitted by the talented Nici Elizabeth! Includes a sticker & pendant! 
Autographed Musician Package -$30
Own a signed, unreleased mix from each of our village DJ's! Our music masters of the Universe include, but are not limited to:
DubWood - https://soundcloud.com/dubwood
Malia - https://soundcloud.com/maliawhomp
Messenger of Secrets - https://soundcloud.com/messengerofsecrets
B Funky - https://soundcloud.com/b-funky-1
Just B - https://www.facebook.com/just.b.humble/
+++???+++ TBA!!!
T-Shirts - $35
Join the Event Horizon Crew and sport our official Space shirt.These shirts are extremely limited edition! After this campaign, the opportunity of own one is in the black hole.
Bundle Pack - $50Looking for *all* the swag? Here is it, The Big Bang! This is the best swag pack in the Universe.
You'll get our sweet Event Horizon crew T-shirt, a E.H. Pendant to wear around your neck, a signed post card sent from the edge of the Universe, and a dope sticker to put where ever you want.
Professional Music/Production lessons - $50 - $100 
$50 - 1 hour "you pick" session with Ben Easley, Messenger of Secrets - guitar, bass, music, recording, arranging, mixing, live sound, producing lessons.
$75 - 2 hours
$100 - 4 x 1 hour lessons or equivalent
Rare Pressed Record - $85 ($150 value!!) 
Autographed Rare Press record with the production work of our village sound engineer, Jay Wood/DubWood. 
Custom Fur Coat w/ LEDs- $500
A Rachdiculous burn coat is a one of a kind work of art, crafted with function in mind and made just for you! This perk is not just a coat, but an experience! We will begin with a fitting and design consultation to assess your needs and add your style! Custom piece includes lifetime repairs and will be done in time for Apo if purchased by April 30!
Custom Warp Drive Sculpture - $500This 1/16th scale Warp Drive is inspired by the Event Horizon movie itself.A great piece to add to any Earthing's personal collection, you won't find another one of these puppies anywhere in the Universe.It features custom metal work by one of our Event Horizon Crew Members, Vince Kenny.
Custom Lowrider Bike - $500Riding off into space? Need a custom ride? Complete with a leather seat?
This is a custom made Lowrider bike welded by an artist right here in Denver, Colorado.With it's easily removable front end, this bike can easily be transported in a car. Perfect for Burning Man or just cruising around Denver!

The Impact!

We are a collective of artists, musicians, performers, builders, organizers, event producers, healers, and teachers. We create spaces for people to thrive! We offer a welcoming home base for people new to the artist/burner community, while helping them channel their passions and expand their knowledge! We have a team of seasoned burners who wish for nothing more than to share our experience & know-how to achieve one grand vision of unity and radical collaboration. We value the 10 principals and upholding the Burning Man culture. Anyone involved in our project will be encouraged to push beyond their comfort zones and explore what they are truly capable of. With the help from professionals in various trades, we offer a stage for others to reach their highest potential!
Our group of lovers, thinkers, builders, creators, and do-ers have also participated in many successful community projects including camps Radically Adequate (Apo 2016), the Octopussy (Apo 2016), Attachment Unavailable (non-Apo 2015), Geological Point of Interest (GPOI) (Apo 2014), Panopolis (Apo 2013), Atom and Eden (Apo 2012), the Dubmarine (Apo 2012), as well as the Temple Build at Apo 2014 in honor of Jenny Kush. 
We seek to partner with our wide spread artist community and create a culture of radical inclusion, participation & radical support by offering our time, talents and knowledge both monetarily and energetically to other camps and projects! We believe in abundance and that when we work together, we can further extend our reach to other like-minded artists and visionaries!

Risks & Challenges
People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

Being our first year as a collective and having a name unknown to the community at large, we are working diligently as a group to get the word out about our vision. Our first fundraiser was a HUGE success due to the hard work of everyone on our team! However, we have many challenges to face due to the lack of funding received from Apogaea and the short amount of turn around time we have to first get funded and then physically build our projects. We have a large vision but not a lot of wo/man power to make it come alive! 
Through individual conversations within our friends, family and community members, we hope to inspire others to join our grand vision. You know what they say, "It takes a village" :-)
We will be having 1-2 additional fundraisers to help raise money & spread awareness. We also value participating in other camps and projects so that we can show our support on behalf of the bigger picture, the Apogaea Regional Burn. With our community outreach and dedicated crew, we hope to share common ground and find ways to work towards a united vision. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word by posting this on social media! 
"Like" & follow us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/EventHorizonColorado/

Join us for one of our upcoming community events (Details will be on our facebook page)
Consider helping our village expand by camping or partnering with us! There are small camp dues with great benefits included! If you already have a camp, that's ok too! We still would like to talk and hear your thoughts on how we can all help each other reach our goals!

story:
The Project

We are a team of dreamers and builders who love having fun. I spent several months drafting art installation ideas and chose 1up as the one that would best fit our vision. I am an avid gamer and an artist, so the concept behind 1up is very personal to me.

The art at Burning Man has always been one of my favorite parts of the event and finally in 2018 I took the leap at building a small scale placed installation. I had such an amazing time with the process that I knew I wanted to go bigger and  better for 2019, so I'm extremely excited and passionate about this project. The 8bit style graphics we're using is one of the most recognized of all vintage gaming and one that will easily invoke smiles in all ages.  

1up will be made of wood and will glow at night with retro 80's style lighting. The piranha plant center piece will be the largest element, reaching a height of around 16'. Other smaller pieces will be waist high, giving you the real feel of being Mario-sized. 

Being a small artist with big dreams means we need your help. No matter how great or small your contribution is, every dollar helps and goes directly to this project. We won't be able to make this happen without You!

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking to raise $6,000 to bring 1up to Black Rock City. Our funding will be split between material costs for items such as wood, electronics, paint, batteries, solar panels, and tools. It will also cover transporting the art to and from the event. If we exceed our initial goal, we will post a stretch goal so we can get a more kick ass sparkly LED lighting setup!

We are thankful for any amount you are willing to donate to us, and every little bit helps. We have created perks as offerings for our supporters at different levels, and if you are interested in redeeming a perk, please click on the "claim this perk" button underneath it to donate at that level. You can also choose to donate any amount without claiming a perk. Thank you for your support! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word if you think our project rocks! Even if you can't donate, helping us promote our campaign can allow us to get to our goal. We'll be posting updates on the project via Facebook and email, so sign up to stay tuned!

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/1upBurningMan

 

Thank you for your support! We hope to see you on the playa!

story:
The Project:

Hi, I am Valerie Wilson, an artist about to sojourn over to Sofia, Bulgaria for a three month artist -in-residency program: the World of Co. Residency. My time in Sofia will be spent creating experimental & experiential wedding veils using embroidery, lacework, printmaking techniques. Wedding veils are in dire need of an aesthetic & symbolic makeover, and I'm here to spearhead that. For more examples of my work please visit valeriums.net!

 

What I Need & What You Get:

What I Need: $5,500

Costs:

The Program: $2346- The program itself costs $650 euros/months (which is $782 USD). The monthly cost covers my living space, workspace, art & language classes, and utility bills. I am staying at this program for 3 months, so $782 x 3= $2346.

Airfare: $1100- Flights to/from SFO to Sofia, Bulgaria range from $450-$650 each way.

Living Expenses: $1554- Living expenses will cover the cost of food, transportation, healthcare, and fun.

Art Supplies: $500- I am responsible for sourcing my own materials for this residency. Although I do already have some supplies, there are still many remaining items I need to buy/procure (namely tulle fabric, renting printmaking equipment/presses, paper, etc.) before I leave and for when I get there.

Perks!: All donors who contribute $5 or more will be entered into a raffle, where you can win one of three of my most unique relief prints.

  • $5 donation- a raffle entry to win one of my three most prized relief prints, as well as a high five, a big thanks, and an oversaturated over-filtered instagram shout-out post.
  • $25 donation- Hand-embroidered handkerchief with monogrammed initials of your choice or a hand-printed cloth bookmark with monogrammed initials
  • $50 donation- Hand-printed cotton drawstring backpack, choice of three original print designs.
  • $100 donation- Hand-printed & hand-embroidered cotton drawstring backpack
  • $500 donation- A custom pet or people pastel portrait.
  • $1000 donation- A handmade veil.

The Impact: You know that saying- “Today is the first day of the rest of your life”? It’s usually on an inspirational cat poster. Well, that cat is me. I’m finally (& officially) coming out of the proverbial art closet and setting out to find my niche in the fine art & wedding world. Any level of support, whether it be monetary, emotional, or tangible will be exponentially helpful and encouraging to me as I turn my life upside down to move across the world to the obscure & beautiful Bulgaria. But for the sake of this campaign, a monetary contribution would be most helpful (even if it’s just $3, $5 or $10!).

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • Please share this campaign on your social media!
  • Tell your friends! Tell your family! TELL EVERYONE

story:
BE A PART OF

               AN AMERICAN ARTIST'S

                    EMPOWERING FORCE!!

 

      My story is about a massive LOSS recently happened to me in Las Vegas.  

      I choose to tell this story with a positive attitude

because I want to shape it to an uplifting comeback story.

    

I am a New York-based American conceptual artist for the past 2 decades. 

My name is Phong Phong.

 

On a steaming summer day last year, I landed in Las Vegas

because I wanted to expand the scope of my creative landscape.

I went to Las Vegas to do a huge installation, titled "The Almost Zen Garden

in Las Vegas Casinos."

 

My experiences in Las Vegas were nothing like Alice's in her Wonderland.

My misadventure turned into a massive disaster.

 

I was robbed by evil people  in Las Vegas.  They took away all my artwork accumulated from the past 2 decades.  They took away all my photos from birth up to 2017.  They took away all my crucial paperwork, including my 2 diplomas of Master degrees. ...among a lot more.

 

Those cruel men also robbed me of all my precious, valuable, essential

belongings that defined me as a person.

 

The most traumatic injury of that incomprehensible robbery is that my core identity

as an artist is destroyed.  Because I don't have any artwork to show the world  any longer.

 

After 4 months of struggling with this massive existential crisis, I finally

dug myself out of the Zombie's cave.  I decide to create

another body of work.  A bigger, better and much more inspiring body 

of artwork.

 

I intend to rise like that mythical Bird in my beloved hometown, here in 

New York City.

 

A Phoenix + the Big Apple = A Splendid Rebirth of a Wounded Artist

 

The urgent need of an artist's re-birth is the reason why I'm on Indiegogo, making connection with you--the passionate & generous version of you.

 

I'm raising fund for equipment, studio time, video professionals 

as well as coffee, cookies and donuts.

 

I appreciate your noble participation.  For this special occasion, 

I have created a series of unique and original gifts just for you.

 

My gifts are experience-oriented.  These rare  and genuine experiences can 

serve you as an introduction to understand the essence of performance art--

the most relevant art form in the 21st century.

 

Do take advantage of this opportunity to experience the visceral power of

performance art.   The "odd" experiences can widen your consciousness

and enrich your perspective.  They make you a more joyful human being. 

 

Please check the perk section to pick the gift that feels right to you.

 

Looking forward to doing the performance with you--Soon!

 

                                             BE A PART OF 

                                AN AMERICAN ARTIST'S 

                                EMPOWERING FORCE

                                        BECAUSE

                            IT IS  A FUN FUN WAY

                                           TO

                 ENRICH THIS BEAUTIFUL PLANET!

story:
** CLICK HERE to check out our ORIGINAL-ARTWORK perks! **


New Mexico is known for sunshine, chiles and the Wild, Wild, West. Now, it will also be known for ArtWorks New Mexico.  ArtWorks will give the region even more to offer with puppetry, painting, photography and pioneer pottery. It will serve the Las Cruces area through professional art instruction and opportunities in a range of media, while providing a creative space for artists.  It will also build art appreciation and understanding across the area. As a non-profit organization, we will work with government partners, other non-profits organizations and schools to offer free classes to those who need it most. 

Why here, why now?

1. Because Art Works!

2.   Distinct audiences are in need of art opportunities. Students are looking for continuing education and advanced credit hours from our professional artists. The public needs more art related opportunities for whole-family activities. Las Cruces has a large number of underserved youth, yet extra-curricular art opportunities for them are few and far between. Southern New Mexico attracts military veterans who often suffer from some degree of a post-traumatic stress disorder and the arts have proven to be beneficial to them. 

3. Las Cruces is a great place for the arts! The majority of art opportunities in New Mexico are concentrated in the north – Taos and Santa Fe. But, Las Cruces is the second largest city and attracts people from Texas and Arizona, not to mention all across the country due to the warm sun and low cost of living.

4. There is a need for a collective setting to nurture professional artists to work, exhibit and teach.

5.  Southern New Mexico is a unique region from cuisine to culture to architecture.  Red or Green? That is the question on every menu for your choice of chiles. The diverse cities of Las Cruces, El Paso and Juarez set the stage for the culture that has endured the moving border of the last 200 years. Navajos, Pueblos and Apache have settled in the region as they moved out of their original lands.

6.  The newly proclaimed Organ Mountains-Desert Peaks National Monument provides hiking opportunities, nature photography and pure wilderness. White Sands, the Three Rivers Petroglyphs and The Lincoln National Forest are stunning natural environments you will not find anywhere else. The light reflects off the mountains and desert to illuminate the sky with dramatic colors.


            ** CLICK HERE to check out our ORIGINAL-ARTWORK perks! **


Our mission is to serve the Las Cruces area through professional art instruction and opportunities in a range of media, while providing a creative space for artists from around the world.

A Glimpse into the Future:  We envision hosting a residency program where artists come from all over the world to be inspired by the unique natural beauty and culture of New Mexico. At the same time, they will give our community a glimpse of another culture from across the globe!

People We Serve

·  Students of all ages, backgrounds and capabilities

·  Families seeking art activities and experiences

·  Professional artists in search of specialized teaching opportunities

5 Elements of ArtWorks New Mexico

1.  Studio Spaces: Ideally, we will have a Ceramics and Painting Studio.

2.  Classes: General Public Classes, Continuing Education, Therapeutic arts, Veterans, Whole-family experiences, Youth: from home schooled to at risk kids.

3.  Community classroom: Space available to the public who wish to promote and hold their own classes. 

4.  Gallery: Showcase regional and curated exhibits.

5. Core Mediums: Ceramics, Painting, Puppetry, Photography, Fiber Arts.


** CLICK HERE to check out our ORIGINAL-ARTWORK perks! **


About Us

ArtWorks started as a conversation about much-needed opportunities for artists among Joy Miller, Andrianna Natsoulas are Eric Brown. We continue propelling this effort forward and we have continually increasing support of community members and artists. We could not do it without them (or you)!

Development advisor Joy Miller is a long-time resident of Las Cruces. The sunshine and blue skies brought her here nearly twenty years ago. Joy received her Master’s of Fine Art from Kent State University and has worked as a curator at university and city museums ever since. She is also an active community member and has been on the board of directors for the Las Cruces Downtown Revitalization organization, the Las Cruces Spay & Neuter Action Program, the Las Cruces Friends of Chamber Music, and the American Adoption Congress. 

Andrianna Natsoulas recently moved to the area from Southeast Alaska – to a desert from a rainforest. After graduating with a Master’s of Science in Ecosystems Analysis and Governance from the University of Warwick in Coventry, England, she landed a job in Washington, DC. Stayed there for ten years, working for non-profit organizations, including Greenpeace, Public Citizen and Food & Water Watch. She has also helped start or re-launch non-profit groups across the country. In 2009, she took a break to write a book (Food Voices) and now consults for various organizations locally, nationally and internationally. 

Eric Brown has been working in clay for 30 years.  He creates hand built and wheel thrown sculptural and functional pieces and his work has been featured in galleries and museums across the country.  Eric earned a bachelor’s of fine arts from Syracuse University and a master’s of fine arts from New Mexico State University. Eric currently teaches at New Mexico State University at Alamogordo and maintains a studio in Las Cruces, New Mexico. Eric will be overseeing our ceramics program, as well as providing ceramics classes.

The others that have been tremendous include, Tauna Cole-Dorn, Sherry Doil-Carter, George Griffen, Cassandra Lockwood, Kate Mott, Olga Pedroza, John Pleasant and Dave Reiff.


** CLICK HERE to check out our ORIGINAL-ARTWORK perks! **


What We Need and Why

We need to get ArtWorks New Mexico off the ground and this campaign contributes to our seed money! In all, we are looking for about $60,000 for the first months. That will go towards organizational development, programs, and rent for the physical space. We aim to raise $10,000 here on IndieGogo, $15,000 through local business support and $20,000 from generous individual donations and the remainder through start-up grants. Even if we don’t reach 100%, every cent will go to the initial start-up expenses.

One of our top goals is to secure a physical space for two studios, the classroom, gallery and office. Specifically, we need rent money for our location and costs to develop the first programs. We also have several initial costs, such as the equipment, website, promotional materials and various fees and licenses. The break-down looks like this:

$3,000/4 months on Rent & Utilities (Total: 12,000)

$10,000/4 months for Organizational and Program Development (Total: 40,000)

$5,000 on Equipment, Promotion, Fees & Licensing


             ** CLICK HERE to check out our ORIGINAL-ARTWORK perks! **


Without your help, we cannot do this!

So, what do you get? You get to support the arts – which is a great cause! But, of course, we want to give you something more to show our great appreciation and offer you a glimpse of what ArtWorks has to offer.

You get original artwork – not a “standard” of funding campaigns – available due to the generosity of New Mexico artists who are passionate about the ArtWorks vision. And, You get to share in the pride that comes to individuals and communities via the ARTS!

How You Can Help

·  Donate here and now.

·  Share the campaign online. Post to Facebook.

·  Tell somebody about it. Tell everybody about it. The bigger the network, the more likely we are to reach our goal.

·  Get co-workers or friends together to go in on a big perk... have a great private party!

·  Write an article about the project.

·  Get excited for our grand opening this summer!  

·  Send good vibes our way!

story:
About Stephen

I grew up in Austin, Texas until I moved to Berlin, Germany just before my 21st birthday. My whole life, I've been surrounded by all kinds of artists and their work. Perhaps through osmosis I've gained an appreciation and love of art as well, and have been working towards this goal for several years. I’ve spent the last month working on a collection of prints made with black India ink and water. Essentially, it's black and white watercolor. I call the style in particular macabre-pop.

This campaign is only the beginning of a vast experience I hope to create for the world. My ultimate goal is to use my art to make people feel things that maybe they have never felt before, while appealing to individual perspectives at the same time. I want to create an experience worth remembering...an experience that will inspire others to create as well and in turn make the world that much more beautiful. With your donation, you become part of that experience.

My ultimate dream is to venture into all facets of art and beyond - two-dimensional and three-dimensional work, film, photography, music, performance, etc. Accomplishing this project will be the first step into achieving that dream by allowing me to get my little store off the ground and to financially support myself while I work to create more art. By donating, you will be helping an aspiring artist move past simply dreaming and onto actually creating.

What We Need

My financial goal for this campaign will be $2000. 

In order of importance, here is a breakdown of where this money will go:

  • $600 to produce merchandise upon which my art will be printed. (I will sell this merchandise at local markets around Berlin. The money I make selling this merchandise will help to support myself while I work to get my new series accepted and shown in art galleries.)
  • $500 for art supplies
  • $200 for the license to sell my products at local markets in Berlin. 
  • $400 for a used computer to edit my images and manage my online stores 
  • $100 for a scanner to scan my art into said computer 
  • $200 for insurance so that I can legally stay here in Berlin! 

If I don't reach my ultimate goal by the end of my campaign, the funds will be put towards each need by order of importance. 


What You Get

At this point you're probably asking yourself, "What's in it for me?" Well, this is what you'll get in return for a your donation;

If you claim a perk, you can email me at meadows.s23@gmail.com to specify which image you'd prefer.

  • $10 for a small print of your choice
  • $20 for a tote bag of your choice
  • $40 for a large-scale print of your choice
  • $100 for all three items, each with the image of your choice (large print will also be signed!)


As excited as I am for this new chapter of life, I understand any doubts one might have. But with years of study, practice and training in this field and with so many people expressing their interest in what I have to offer, I feel that I can do so much wIth this project. 

This campaign would serve as the launchpad for an entire lifetime of artistic endeavors, calling upon any and all artistic mediums.
