story:
Short Summary

We are both artists and healers, and met each other in Filmschool in Ireland where we were living for some years. Now we have been travelling in Denmark, Germany and Poland, where we have given Tantric Workshops. These workshops in Intimacy help people to explore the power of Intimacy in a Sacred Context. Opening up the possibilities and exploring new ways of Being. Now we are taking the Next Steps of our Journey.
Our artwork includes Mandalas, Stone paintings, Visionary Symbolic Art. Making music together we span a wide spectrum from psychedelic pop to more meditative instrumental. 
https://artatart.net/ela-mandalista/?view=artworks
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Yantra-Portals/670813483032132?ref=hl
https://artatart.net/john-stokes/?view=artworks
http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/nettlefieldritual
We are Travellers. As we go we make Music and Art, in many different and beautiful ways. Its a great Life in many ways and we enjoy a great deal of Freedom, though it is often not easy. We would like to clear the the way and move on to the next phase. On the way to creating a Centre we would like to buy a school bus, convert it into a magical living space and travel slowly, maybe you will join us on a leg of the journey. We are creating community as we go! You can help us on our Journey through supporting our Artwork and Music and we have set out some links above. Please get on board even if its only for one stop! We appreciate! Please spread the word....

As we go we will keep you up to date with our Journey and how it is unfolding.
This campaign is to empower our work. The funds will help us reach more people and be more effective. We have a vision to buy an old school bus and work from it as a travelling health centre, offering energy work and vital information on health. We are on the road from mid April and these funds will support our basic needs as we travel. We are offering our Artwork in service and the funds will keep that energy flowing. We are out of the grid and learning to engage with Life without the constraints of the World. Your support in whatever way you can give will make a big difference to our Journey.



What We Need & What You Get

All we need is a flow of cash to help us expand our work. We need funds for Art materials, for travel, for recording, for publishing and for millet! We are offering our Artwork, Music, Writing, Astrology/Numerology readings or you can go for Ela's special recipe for a Cosmic Millet Pancake. 

Nettlefield Ritual's first Album will be made available as a Zip file you can download from GoogleDrive. 

You can commission a Personal Mandala/Yantra that will bring in new energy into your Life.  We will send you a Mantra to use in meditation with your Yantra. An extremely effective tool for change.

John's Paintings made with acrylic ink, using a technique that he developed himself are available.

With your date and time of birth we can offer a Soul Reading that will help you find direction and clarity.

John's Story, just finished: 'Autobiography of a Tantric' will be available as a pdf download.

We can come and visit you and paint a Mandala Mural in your home.

We can cater a very special party for you. Ela's amazing cooking and John playing soulful piano: we will create a beautiful atmosphere for you and your guests.

The beautiful series of Cosmic Nudes are available as high res files for printing.

The Impact

Our Vision for a Centre starts with an old school bus! working as a mobile health centre. We want to buy an old bus and travel to people bringing them knowledge about simple natural health regimes and offering energy work. We can reach a lot of people this way and provide very effective help for the toxic overload that is coming at them.

This is an experiment that is very relevant to Artists everywhere. We need to live our Creative Gift fully and not be shackled by the World. This goes for everyone. It is time to claim our Sovereignty. By empowering each other in this we empower ourselves.
We can create new models of navigating finances and needs. Community funding is a great start to bring us closer. Lets find new ways!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spreading the word of our Campaign means you are a big part of it. Network of communication is vital!

If you know of a Space where we can live for a while please let us know. We are open to all kinds of suggestions. Any other ideas will be greatly appreciated.

We can give workshops. Invite us. Accommodate

us and we can work with groups it doesn't matter how big or small. We are here to serve through our work. It is fun for us. We just need the means to keep going. Join us!

us and we can work with groups it doesn't matter how big or small. We are here to serve through our work. It is fun for us. We just need the means to keep going. Join us!

story:
We are Love Projections Printing & Publishing for the Professional Artist, also known as LoveProjections.com! We are an independent group of artists working towards spreading a message of love, positivity, and artistic value consisting of husband and wife, Zen and Denise, with two children, Rosslyn & Jakobi. Our work's purpose is to raise funds towards global causes through artistic expression. "All the Missing Socks Misplaced," is our first of many upcoming children's books. Where do all our missing socks go? Find out in our imaginative tale teaching that mis-matching socks, much like intercultural friendships and integration, are more colorful and make for a brighter and peaceful future!


What We Need & What You Get

With racism still alive today, we hope to raise enough funds to print and donate our first 100 copies around the world to libraries and schools! Help us spread love to our children! Receive an autographed, first edition copy of the book. Donate more, and receive more, from other Love Projections products like Wanderful Wands and Bandanimals (uniquely, handcrafted, stuffed animals) both introduced in the story. Also shirts and signed, original illustrations from the book! All funds raised will produce more books whether we raise our goal or not.

  If you are unable to purchase a copy yourself, you can still help by finding someone who may benefit from purchasing a children's book. Teachers, parents, educators, and leaders of all will enjoy and appreciate this independent collection of visual art and story-telling by Love Projection's founder, Zen Jackson.

What We Need & What You Get
 With racism still alive today, we hope to raise enough funds to print and donate our first 100 copies around the world to libraries and schools! Help us spread love to our children! Receive an autographed, first edition copy of the book. Donate more, and receive more, from other Love Projections products like Wanderful Wands and Bandanimals (uniquely, handcrafted, stuffed animals) both introduced in the story. Also shirts and signed, original illustrations from the book! All funds raised will produce more books whether we raise our goal or not.  If you are unable to purchase a copy yourself, you can still help by finding someone who may benefit from purchasing a children's book. Teachers, parents, educators, and leaders of all will enjoy and appreciate this independent collection of visual art and story-telling by Love Projection's founder, Zen Jackson.

story:
The Idea
The idea for Sabbath came from the busyness and stress I experienced from graduating art school, having my first child and starting my working career all within three months.  As an artist and woodworker i responded by making a chair that served as a sanctuary during my day to recharge and take 10-15 minutes to gather my thoughts and center my mind on what really mattered. That chair has evolved into what I now call Sabbath.
Studies Show-the stats are in
  • In the U.S, 85.8 percent of males and 66.5 percent of females work more than 40 hours per week   
  • Americans work 260 more hours per year than British workers. 
  • According to the New York Times Americans left an average of 9.2 vacation days unused in 2012 
  • Working in 90-minute intervals turns out to be a prescription for maximizing productivity

Sabbath is For?
  • Mothers and fathers who wake up at 3 am to crying babies.
  • CEO's who work 80 hour weeks and need to set new work habits for themselves and their entire company
  • The general contractor who feels the need to answer emails after 5pm
  • The hard working auto mechanic
  •  Executive assistants who find themselves sleeping under their desk
  • Anyone seeking to balance work and home life
  • That friend of yours who needs to be told, "you deserve a break"
  • Your local coffee shop
  • Your office
About the Perks
My perks exclusively feature the Sabbath collection itself.  All the perks are priced at a level significantly lower than what Sabbath will retail for once it enters full production.  Now is your chance not only to be among the first Sabbath owners, but also get your Sabbath collection at a crazy discount.

Details about the Sabbath collection
Chair

The Sabbath prototypes are made from ash and feature 2" wide blue cotton webbing.  The chair is the flag ship, so to speak, of the sabbath collection.  I used steam to bend the backrest, arms, and legs into their curved shape.  The process, called steam bending, involves using a steaming chamber and several bending molds to achieve the strong arches that make for a elegant and sturdy design.  Every joint in the furniture uses mortise and floating tenons to create quality joints like they did it in the old days, but with modern tech that makes the process efficient.

Table

The end table's primary function is to provide a place to stash away your tech device.  Smart phones and the like are essential tools to get the job done, but they can also be a huge distraction when trying to meditate and disconnect for 20 minutes during your work day.  Put your iphone to bed in the end table's leather lined drawer.  The legs like the chair are steam bent and the top features a sliding dovetail on either end, a mark of quality.
Privacy Screen

The privacy screen is intended for folks with large offices or open concept homes.  It allows you the versatility to cut out a little niche in your space.  The arc from the chair and table legs is repeated here and creates a negative space unique to the privacy screen and reminiscent of a pastoral setting.  Escape from the work day, get refreshed and get back to work.  
Wall Hanging "A Break in Time"

The wall hanging is a beautifully simple work of art I call a "break in time".  It's made on the wood lathe where it is turned into a disc.  It is a simple exhibition of wood grain grown over the course of many years and serves as a simple reminder for you to take regular breaks to recharge.
Custom Coaster

There are no two custom coasters alike.  Unlike the rest of the collection the coasters are made from a variety of found wood species.  Each one is inspired by the material itself.  I use my creativity to make a special place for you to have a little "me" time with your personal coaster to set your coffee on.
Candle Holder

The candleholder, like a "break in time" is made on the wood lathe. There are no two exactly alike.  It features the natural edge of the log bringing a touch of rustic beauty to your meditation space.
Production Coaster

The production coaster is made on a limited scale and features a crack through the growth rings of the wood reminding you to take a break.  I make each one by hand.

About Me, Grant Kaihoi

  • Graduated with a BFA in Art and Design concentrating in woodworking from Northern Michigan University in 2012
  • Currently lives in central Minnesota with his wife and 3 sons
  • Love working hard and resting well
  • Passionate about creating beautiful objects with worthy intent and great utility.  Hence Sabbath
  • Sabbath is my debut work and is the first of many creative projects
The statistics I mentioned can be found at these web addresses
http://20somethingfinance.com/american-hours-worked-productivity-vacation/
http://www.nytimes.com/2013/02/10/opinion/sunda...

story:
Who We Are

The Española Valley Fiber Arts Center (EVFAC) is a hub for all types of Fiber Arts activity in New Mexico since 1997. We are a nonprofit Member-driven organization that supports our region’s active fiber community through education, programs and economic development. 

Our now 18 year old interior light fixtures have to be replaced! New more efficient lighting will make our creative space more welcoming, our atmosphere more inspiring for all Fiber Artists, and will lower electricity bills and reduced our carbon footprint. Support our effort to brighten EVFAC and offer Fiber Artists the optimal environment where they can remain creative and inspired.

What We Need

Our 7,700 sq ft creative space needs new lighting. The replacement cost is set at over $10,966 and we have already been successful in raising close to 55% of the funds. We still need $4,966 to bring this project to fruition. This cost includes the purchase of:

  • 39 four-foot ballast fixtures
  • 26 eight-foot ballast fixtures
  • 24 hours of installation team labor
  • 13 boxes of thirty light bulbs
  • 1 set of installation materials
  • 1 back door outside light
What You Get

  1. Your contribution of $15 will help us replace four T8 fluorescent 32-watt bulbs. In return we will thank you for your generous donation in our monthly Newsletter with an ever-increasing circulation of 1,600.
  2. Your contribution of $35 will help us replace eight T8 fluorescent 32-watt bulbs. In return we will send you a 1.5” EVFAC button and thank you for your generous donation in our monthly Newsletter with an ever-increasing circulation of 1,600.
  3. Your contribution of $69 will help us replace an entire four-foot ballast with four T8 fluorescent 32-watt bulbs. In return you will receive a canvas tote with the EVFAC logo and thank you for your generous donation in our monthly Newsletter with an ever-increasing circulation of 1,600. 
  4. Your contribution of $142 will help us replace an entire eight-foot ballast with eight T8 fluorescent 32-watt bulbs. In return you will receive a four pack of handcrafted fiber inspired notecards and thank you for your generous donation in our monthly Newsletter with an ever-increasing circulation of 1,600. 
  5. Your contribution of $340 will fund two hours of the installation team’s 24 hour estimate. In return you will receive a 1.5” EVFAC button, a four pack of handcrafted fiber Inspired notecards, a canvas tote with the EVFAC logo and thank you for your generous donation in our monthly Newsletter with an ever-increasing circulation of 1,600.

The Impact

New Mexico has a rich history in the Fiber Arts and our objective is to keep the heritage growing. This building upgrade will not only reduce our carbon footprint, and lower electricity bills, but also make the building more welcoming offering well-lit education space, an attractive shopping and work environment on the historic Main Street of Española.

Supporters

We have been partially funded by Los Alamos National Laboritories Major Subcontractors Consortium, who consistently values our efforts to bring impact within the Fiber Arts community.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Use the Indiegogo tools to share this campaign on Facebook
  • Sign up for our informative Newsletter that reaches an ever-growing distribution, presently at 1600+
  • Volunteer at EVFAC - www.evfac.org/volunteer-opportunities


Testimonials

"My time spent at EVFAC was one of the most memorable parts of my visit to New Mexico last fall. Everyone I met was warm and welcoming - not only the staff but members and the community at large. The dedication and hard work of every person who is involved in the daily ins-and-outs of this organization is clear, even as an outsider. Inclusive and welcoming arts societies are an integral backbone of retaining cultural heritage and EVFAC is a shining example of doing it right."

Rebecca Werkmeister Rochester, New York


"I’m very impressed with the dedication, vision and hard work of the EVFAC staff and the programs that the Center offers. It provides a sense of community among fiber artists over a large geographic area and pulls us all together to learn from each other, build our craft businesses together and find opportunities that we would not have on our own."

Annie MacHale, Weaver Edgewood, New Mexico​


"EVFAC's assistance in basic business development, combined with a consignment sales gallery and access to peer review and critiques, gave me confidence as well as venues to experiment with color and yarn combinations for various target markets. I showed my creations to yarn stores in Taos, Santa Fe, and Silver City and was met with positive responses in every case."

Glenna Dean, Fiber Artist Abiquiu, New Mexico​


"Why do I like to teach at EVFAC?  Every student I have had has been so nice and willing to learn.  Long before I moved to New Mexico, I became a member to support the Center because it is such a great place and I had hoped to volunteer one day if I ever lived in New Mexico. I don't want weaving to be a dying art."​
Inger Seitz, Weaver Santa Fe, New Mexico

"...Weaving my tapestries at EVFAC alongside other fiber enthusiasts stimulates my creativity."
Gloria Padilla, Weaver New Mexico

story:
Short Summary


My name is Spencer Wawak.  My business partner, David Gallo, and I are two undergraduate students studying drama at NYU Tisch and Columbia College respectively, looking to give young millennials the opportunity to practice the art of theater.  In order to put our vision for artistic direction into practice, we are looking for patrons like you to help cover rental space and copyright costs.  

We are proud to announce the creation of stART Theatre.  This company is an opportunity for dozens of aspiring young artists to collaborate, explore their academic and creative capacities, and ultimately craft a long lasting structure for the creation process.  It is our start as a new outlet for the art of drama, it is the start for new artistic faces, and it is the start for local audiences to enjoy well crafted dramatic productions.  

Our first two productions are scheduled for July, 2015!

I have been envisioning the success of this company for over a year now, and with your help, that vision will become a reality.  It is through the generosity of our supporters and lovers of live drama that we will launch our first season.  I hope you will advocate for the mission of stART Theater through what you are able to give.

story:
I have always been inspired by dreams. Mixing dreams with reality… I often drift into the place in between. One of my passions is to create ways to take others into this place. To open a part of the psyche and create a dream like psychedelic experience which connects everyone using minimal elements. To feel as close to what a dream would feel like in the waking life. 

Persona Somnia in latin means Dream Persona... This project is so close to my heart as it is my way of living life. Let me take you to this place in between. 

PERSONA SOMNIA

A visceral, sensory exploration into the kaleidoscopic, fragmented self as it merges into a whole. Told through a multi-sensory, full scale exhibition as conceived by artist and designer Jenni Hensler.

For over ten years I’ve been creating visual stories - from designing costumes and wearable sculpture pieces for musicians and editorial to building sets and video collages. This is my passion, and my way of connecting with others. I am grateful to make a living doing what I love and to be able to collaborate with so many wonderful and talented people along the way. Each project I work on inspires me more and new ideas continue to emerge. They all seem to have a common language and I feel that now is the perfect time to bring all of these ideas together.

The Project:

Persona Somnia will be a public exhibition showcasing facets of my work that I’ve been refining over the course of my career as an artist, from the metamorphosis of designing costumes and wearable sculpture pieces to set design and video art. I’ve developed an interest in synthesizing the totality of sensory input. Through a unique combination of sight, scent, taste, sound and touch, I intend to create a higher aesthetic experience evocative of dreams.

In my very first exhibit, I would like to invite the spectator to enter a space of my own design: a visual, sonic and tactile exploration. of a kaleidoscopic, fragmented self as it merges into a whole. I will be drawing from my own experiences, but the desired effect is that this intimate personal exploration will mirror experiences the viewer has had. I believe that this pursuit of a clearer lens into the self is innately human, and a shared journey. I hope to engage people’s senses and challenge their perceptions in a collective reflection. 

Six different archetypes of the “self” will be on display throughout the exhibit, exposing what lies hidden in the human collective psyche. They will be brought to life through a multi-medium sensory display of sculptural costumes, singular scents, and ambient soundscapes.

In collaboration with six different musical artists, scent artist Olya Bar, and inspired by my intimate connection to dream states and anomalous phenomena, Persona Somnia will come to life.

Musicians include:                                                                                                                         

Zola Jesus 

Chelsea Wolfe

Jonnine Standish (HTRK)

Belong

Azar Swan

Drew McDowall of Coil

MayA

I have experienced many ups and downs in the past year, and have recently found solace and inspiration from within. With Persona Somnia, I want to create a tableaux vivant that one can physically step into, as if they were entering into the chaos and beauty of a dream. 

I appreciate your support as I endeavor to bring this project to life. This will be my most cathartic work to date. It is through people like you who support me that my work has a voice.

BIO:
Jenni Hensler is a creative director and visual narrator whose work explores the relationships of time and space, nature and science, and the meaning human consciousness attaches to unexplained phenomena. The spirit of magic realism runs through her work.
She creates narratives through the manipulation of space and form. It is primal, and transcends language. It’s the most immediate form of communication.
Her work has been featured in national advertisements, fashion editorials, music videos, live performances, television and film. Her costumes have been showcased at national art museums and galleries, including the Guggenheim Museum, Museum of Modern Art in New York, The Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles and Location One gallery in New York. For more information please visit: www.jennihensler.com.

Jenni Hensler  is  a master  of bending sensory experience.  She

 brings dream shapes  into the physical world by  mining the

 collective psyche  and making abstractions tangible.  By

 harnessing  the beauty that  lies in the space  between polarities

 like  instinct  and  cognition,  the natural world  and  synthetic,  

 archaic  and  modern

 with a distinct synesthetic approach

 sound  form  vision  

 bleed together.  This strange  shape shifting  creates a hypnagogic

 universe  that engulfs  the senses and blurs any  semblance  of

 reality  that surrounds them.

 ―Zohra Atash of Azar Swan

Why I need your help:

The cost for putting together a show are high. All the funds received will be put entirely toward the cost of materials (supplies for making all of the costumes and set), production (sound system, lights/projector, space rental, printing, etc), perks for my backers (the supplies needed to make the gifts), and compensation to the people who will be a part of the show. 

The perks that I am offering here are items that I have never reproduced and are only available here. There are links with photos of each item within the descriptions for each perk. Here are some examples: http://jennihensler.tumblr.com/post/11597178710...

For potential backers who do not live in New York, I will also be putting out a video of my exhibit and a limited edition photo book.

The exhibition will take place November, 2015 in an abandoned space in NYC which will be demolished soon after.


'I take pleasure in my transformations. I look quiet and consistent, but few know how many women there are in me' ― Anais Nin

‘Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes’ ― Carl Jung

For more information please visit: www.jennihensler.com.






Jenni Hensler  is  a master  of bending sensory experience.  She
 brings dream shapes  into the physical world by  mining the
 collective psyche  and making abstractions tangible.  By
 harnessing  the beauty that  lies in the space  between polarities
 like  instinct  and  cognition,  the natural world  and  synthetic,  
 archaic  and  modern
 with a distinct synesthetic approach
 sound  form  vision  
 bleed together.  This strange  shape shifting  creates a hypnagogic
 universe  that engulfs  the senses and blurs any  semblance  of
 reality  that surrounds them.
 ―Zohra Atash of Azar Swan




Why I need your help:
The cost for putting together a show are high. All the funds received will be put entirely toward the cost of materials (supplies for making all of the costumes and set), production (sound system, lights/projector, space rental, printing, etc), perks for my backers (the supplies needed to make the gifts), and compensation to the people who will be a part of the show. 
The perks that I am offering here are items that I have never reproduced and are only available here. There are links with photos of each item within the descriptions for each perk. Here are some examples: http://jennihensler.tumblr.com/post/11597178710...
For potential backers who do not live in New York, I will also be putting out a video of my exhibit and a limited edition photo book.
The exhibition will take place November, 2015 in an abandoned space in NYC which will be demolished soon after.





'I take pleasure in my transformations. I look quiet and consistent, but few know how many women there are in me' ― Anais Nin
‘Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes’ ― Carl Jung

story:
ARTOOGLi is perhaps the only company in the world today that offers absolutely everything a visual artist needs to become successful through do-it-yourself education, direct personal career coaching, and help managing any area in your art business that you simply do not wish to handle yourself.
      
With ARTOOGLi.com at your side, you can stay in your studio and do what you love best: create your art!

  • You will never feel alone in growing your art career again!

  • A wide range of one-on-one personal coaching is available.

  • Selling your art will become a life-altering, exciting adventure!

  • We will help you master unstoppable confidence as an artist.

  • We will be there every step of the way to help your art career grow.


Learn what they haven't taught you...

They did teach you how to use your creativity and talent to produce unique, wild, and beautiful things. The problem is that we were never exactly taught how to sell our work to the public. We are dedicated to helping you with these elements of the business end, which is the stuff that most artists dread. Properly planned and executed, marketing and branding can be exciting and fun. Knowing how to brand and market your name will direct you down the path that leads us as artists to that comfort zone that allows us enough time and money to do what we love the best...creating art.

At ARTOOGLi.com, one statement says it all: WE LOVE HELPING ARTISTS SUCCEED. It is paramount that everyone on our team understands our mission, believes in it totally, and employs it daily. Assisting you in finding the art career that you desire is our main goal.


And now, after twenty years of designing, employing, and proving our methods...the time is now!

After more than two decades of art marketing experience and over three years of planning our school, we are now ready to polish, finalize, and launch the first phase of an educational system that will significantly help any artist who wishes to join our community.

There are two ways that you can help us through this campaign:

1.  As a Financial Angel and art lover, your generous support will aid in our first year of life as a school. You have the ability to help us build hope for thousands of artists struggling to find their way in their chosen career.

or

2.  We welcome you as a student (an OOGL), no matter what level your career is at today. Your membership/tuition is available through Indiegogo for a mere $97. By joining now, today's price is protected for the first 2 years of membership. As an added incentive: although you get all of the regular membership benefits available (effective immediately), the meter on your tuition term will not kick in until our formal launch later this fall.

ARTOOGLi brings you a future filled with hope!

The art markets of the world have shifted drastically in the past few years and as always, the available educational sources of finding out exactly what you need to become a professional artist are outdated, unreliable, and generally impossible to track down.

That is exactly why the ARTOOGLi community has been created. We are here as an ever-improving art marketing education, coaching and management venue for your betterment. As a registered member of our community–an "OOGL"–it is our honor to help you achieve success in every aspect of the art marketing, talent branding, artistic refinement, and business education you need.

Whether you're an aspiring artist or a highly accomplished veteran of the industry already, we will endeavor to help you meet your goals and live your dreams.

What will your aid in funding allow us to do?

After three years of planning and designing our school and systems, we have now begun to gather highly qualified worldwide experts who will produce or offer hundreds of exclusive ARTOOGLi.com courses and tutorials. Many of these have already been designated to our curriculum. Here are just a few of many categories you will be able to access and employ at your own chosen pace:

  • MARKETING & SELLING YOUR ART
  • BRANDING & DEVELOPING YOUR UNIQUE PERSONA
  • ARTISTIC CONFIDENCE DEVELOPMENT
  • ONE-ON-ONE ART CAREER CONSULTING
  • FIRSTHAND MANAGEMENT IN ANY BUSINESS AREA YOU CHOOSE
  • HUNDREDS OF PROMO & EVENT IDEAS
  • BUILDING A POWERFUL PORTFOLIO
  • EFFECTIVE LETTER-WRITING & EASY-TO-USE TEMPLATES
  • BUSINESS AND ADMINISTRATION PLANNING & SIMPLIFIED TEMPLATES
  • INFORMATIVE REAL-LIFE CASE STUDIES
  • LEGAL, COPYRIGHT PROTECTION & COMMISSION CONTRACTS

These categories will set the direction for the huge inventory of exciting learning tools you'll have within your grasp to use while building your career.  Each category will be comprised of easy study courses, tutorials, and services that will meet any artist's career needs.


What if we don't meet our goal?

Don't worry! If we don't reach our entire goal, it will only temporarily hinder the speed at which we are able to add more expert advisers, courses, tutorials, and teachers. ARTOOGLi's foundation has been already built, and it's a solid one. In the end, nothing will stop us from moving forward to aid those artists in need!

What you get just for helping us.

  • Our goal in this campaign is to raise $90,000, which will allow us to form a professional tutorial team. This team will produce 100 of the first and most important art marketing and branding courses in our curriculum. These courses in turn are offered for free to any artist who joins on as a student of our school.
  • Check out our cool perks, and please keep in mind that you can purchase student memberships for your favorite artists. Just think: you can help a family member or friend find their future and fulfill their dream of becoming a professional artist!
  • Membership gifts are wonderful because the effect is two-fold: they simultaneously help someone you know personally and our school!


What makes us so unique?

Our founding group of artists and art marketers have worked together for over two decades as a team. Over the years, we have found that there is absolutely no single source learning institution that focuses on what an artist needs after they have learned their trade.

We know through the hundreds of artists who have approached us over many years that the act of 'doing business' is probably the most intimidating position that they can be put in.

That is why we at ARTOOGLi.com, we are 100% committed to producing a school that takes care of these very needs. Even more importantly, we wish to create a community where any artist can find everything they need to gain the confidence necessary for success. We also want to directly extend the help that will enable them to form a career and life-plan that will help them accomplish their goals.

With your help, we will be on our way to the second step in a much bigger goal of helping 10,000 artists gain the knowledge that they are not offered anywhere else in a single location: how to be successful in their chosen field.

Risks and challenges.

Aiding ARTOOGLi.com in our quest comes at a very low risk because our school is already in existence and our team is in order. If it should happen that we only reach a portion of our goal we will simply adjust the amount of courses we complete over the next few months. We know our service is in high demand, and we have a tremendous inventory of knowledge and wisdom at our command. We simply want to get it out there just as quickly as we can!

Other ways you can help.

We realize some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean we couldn't use your help! So, if you like what we are doing you can help in other ways:

  • Help us by getting the word out. Tell all of your artist friends or any people you know who have artists in their circles about this Indiegogo campaign and our school, ARTOOGLi.com.
  • If you have had successes as an artist and wish to share your inspirational story with the world, contact us at info@artoogli.com. Tell us your story and how you wish to help. This is truly a great artist community, so join the team today...let's get inspired together!
  • Don't forget to pass our story along using the Indiegogo share tools!

A warm thank you in advance for your support!

Jump on board the learning curve to find the success you deserve and live your dreams!

Feel free to contact our founder, Ronald Suchiu, direct for more information at
suchiu@suchiu.com or call 1-519-776-5767. He will be happy to answer your questions.

story:
Short Summary

Need

The Arc is blessed to have an art teacher with a Master of Arts from Berkeley and sixteen years of practice nurturing artists with disabilities. Several full classes meet each week in donated space. The artists, who experience intellectual and developmental disabilities, need paint, canvases, clay and other materials to supply their creative endeavors.

About The Arc Benton

The Arc of Benton County was founded in 1958 by family members and concerned citizens to advocate for more typical lives for children experiencing intellectual and developmental disabilities.  We are a member-based not-for-profit. Through the creation of education, employment, housing and social/recreation opportunities, The Arc of Benton County helps those with I/DD to achieve their life goals.

About The Art Class

The art classes have remained popular for over 10 years, because in them participants learn valuable skills, grow friendships, and build self-esteem, all while having fun. Artists’ work is displayed in our InSight Gallery and, occasionally, in businesses around the community. A few times a year, we host a formal art show opening where the community can enjoy the art, meet the artists, and strike up a conversation about the creative process. These shows provide a reverse-inclusive opportunity for the community to learn what their neighbors with I/DD are accomplishing. Compassion and respect are extended. Highlighting the artists’ abilities is tremendously encouraging, and artists leave inspired to create more.



What is Needed

Our Artists Need Art Supplies

  • $1290 will give us paint for a full year of weekly classes.

  • $200 will buy basic clay tools for the 500 pounds of clay that was just donated. The tools will last for many years.

  • $2300 will pay for a specially-trained support staff for a year of classes, allowing three more artists to join the classes safely.


If we don’t reach our target amount of funds, we will purchase as much paint as we can with the amount we receive and provide classes with ongoing creative activities.  


If we receive more money, we will be able to hire support staff for more individuals with I/DD to participate in art classes.



The Impact

More Than Just Fun

In addition to being fun, all of the programs of The Arc are designed to:

  • Maximize independence and socialization

  • Foster community access

  • Support personal development

  • Increase awareness of time and tools

  • Strengthen concentration skills

  • Enhance self-esteem and self-identity

  • Inspire others

The intelligence of creativity rises in our clients as they challenge themselves at making original, fascinating and inspiring paintings. Gently informed by our staff, the artists have complete control over their artistic choices and results. This unusually high level of autonomy is enjoyed. It builds confidence that promotes social interaction. Isolation and depression, common plagues among people with disabilities, are diminished by shared productivity and pride in one’s accomplishments.

An understanding of the way colors interact and the development of a mature, personal art style has been achieved by many of the veteran artists. The work of two artists was validated by the sale of two pieces to Portland State University for their permanent collection. They are now on display in the Health Sciences entry and in the Board room.


Testimonials:

“The Arc fulfills a crucial need in our community to support those with intellectual and developmental disabilities, and they do it with compassion.  I applaud their accomplishments.”

        - Dr. Mark Rampton

Thank you [The] Arc

        - Kevin

I love The Arc’s Art Class

        - Paula

I am an artist.

        - Leah



Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone has the means to contribute monetarily.  While every dollar helps there are other ways you can help.  Please spread the word by telling your friends and family, post a link to this campaign on facebook and use the Indiegogo share tools.  The more people that hear about this, the better!


Mission

The Arc of Benton County provides advocacy and services, as needed, to enhance the lives of individuals with Intellectual and Developmental Disabilities and their families.

Achieve with us.

story:
The Problem

6 out of 10 young adults, that have been born and raised in church, are guaranteed to drop out of church in their 20's.

The unchurched population of millenials (young adults) has increased from 44% to 52%.

The unchurched population of Americans has increased from 28% in 2010 to 47% in 2013.

Don't fret, we have THE SOLUTION.... BOOM! 

BURN CONFERENCE YOUNG ADULT EDITION 2015

Our first Young Adult Conference, will be held in Orlando, FL on April 16- 18, 2015. Thursday, April 16th we are hosting the hottest party, our Black and White Mixer, full of fun, refreshments, and a funky good time! The morning of Friday, April 17th we are off to New Smyrna Beach for a day full of old school games:  tug-of-War, volleyball, frisbees, and a spades tournament! Friday night is the NO SLEEP ZONE!! Lock-In includes classes, worship, and a catered breakfast served at 5 a.m. The night of Saturday, April 18th, we will set it off with the Burn Concert! We invite some of the hottest gospel artists in the industry! It is FREE to the public.

The $2500 monies raised will be used in the following way:

a) Pay for the fees for the building and fees for the Black and White Mixer

b) Pay for the pavilion fees for New Smyrna Beach

c) Pay for the breakfast and snacks and fees for the building for the Lock In

d) Monies will be paid for marketing and adverting for this event.

The costs listed above are what we desire for our first Burn Conference: Young Adult Edition, but we are very flexible!  Our mission is to establish this conference in EXCELLENCE as we reach "all walks of life" and deliver A++ service to participants. The Burn Conference: Young Adult Edition will make HISTORY!

If you have any questions or feedback, please feel free to email us at burnconference@gmail.com. We look forward to creating a long lasting relationship with all of our supporters and sponsors. We want to send updates as we progress to the date of the conference. Just a courtesy to keep you in the loop!!

Thank you in advance for your generosity!!! God will definitely bless you for blessing us!

story:
Who We Are

We of BangAQUA and MXR scanlation groups of BL doujinshi and manga are going to organize their first art book project called “Fantasia” where anime characters come alive in the world of fantasy. We would like to make this to accumulate funds for our respective groups as well as introducing wonderful artists throughout the globe.

What We Need & What You Get

We need about $2000 for the printing of the books as well as to help pay art commissions and the prints and so on. 

As for the rewards for every dollar you pledge, here are the details:

  • For every dollar you pledge, you shall be added to our private communities where we keep our exclusive releases for VIP; we will need your G+ email account if you have one for MXR and livejournal account for BangAQUA.
  • You will get a customized key-chain or button pin drawn and hand-made by XRYUCHAN27 if you pledge for $15 or more.
  • A sample of the book will be given away to those who will pledge $30 or more.
  • A customized L-sized black T-shirt with MXR and BA mascot print of your choice will be given away to those who will pledge $50 or more.
  • You will get all the rewards if you pledged $100 or more.

The Impact

...YAOI WORLD DOMINATION! ('nuff said)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute however, it is absolutely okay! You can do other ways to contribute to the project like advertising this to your friends! Please do help us advertise this by using Indiegogo sharing tools! Thank you!

You will get a customized key-chain or button pin drawn and hand-made by XRYUCHAN27 if you pledge for $15 or more.
A sample of the book will be given away to those who will pledge $30 or more.
A customized L-sized black T-shirt with MXR and BA mascot print of your choice will be given away to those who will pledge $50 or more.
You will get all the rewards if you pledged $100 or more.
   The Impact ...YAOI WORLD DOMINATION! ('nuff said)



    Other Ways You Can Help If you cannot contribute however, it is absolutely okay! You can do other ways to contribute to the project like advertising this to your friends! Please do help us advertise this by using Indiegogo sharing tools! Thank you!

story:
Tickets - Billetterie

Pour sa 2ème édition, du 2 au 5 avril 2015, le festival Sophia Digital Art, organisé par les associations SLV et Routes productions, aura lieu à la salle du Pré des Arts de Valbonne, avec une capacité d'un millier de personnes.

Le festival SDA tend à promouvoir diverses créations d'arts numériques grâce à l'émergence des nouvelles technologies:
Installations, vidéo art, performances audiovisuelles, net-art.

Situé sur la plus grande technopole Européenne, ce concept au regard avant gardiste propose une exposition à travers les nouveaux médias.

Pouvant accueillir des artistes utilisant des technologies interactives de réalité augmentée (avec des Kinect), de réalité virtuelle (avec Oculus rift), des objets connectés, des impressions 3d réalisées dans un fablab ou sur place, le tout dans une ambiance festive animée par des DJ réputés entourés par des VJ effectuant des projections et mapping vidéo sur un écran de 12m de large et plusieurs écrans répartis dans la salle.

Facebook event: https://www.facebook.com/events/1516747281937724/

Programme:

2 Avril - Cinéma "Les Visiteurs Du Soir" - Valbonne:

Présentation du festival - Ciné-concert: Merakhaazan​: "Nosferatu" de F.W. Murnau (live) - Cédric Stevens (live)

3 Avril - Pré des Arts - Valbonne:

Installations et ateliers - mapping (FLxER Team) - Mariskao (live A/V performance) - Kamikaze Jane (performance) / TimVis (VJ) - Batchass​ (live) / Artcraft​ (VJ) - Split (DJ set) / PPLC​ (VJ) - Nekra Damage​ vs. Stikytox(live) / Good Morning OC(VJ) - K21​ (live) / Goofy Goober Project​ (VJ)

4 Avril - Pré des Arts - Valbonne:

Installations et ateliers - mapping (Artcraft) - Seed (DJ set) / Ctrlaltlab​ (VJ) - Gunston​ (DJ set) / Reymenta visuals​ (VJ) - JHИϟMF​ (DJ set)/ PPLC (VJ) - Alex Augier (oqpo_oooo) (live A/V performance) - Opposite (A/V performance) - Plaid​ (live A/V) - D'Arcangelo​ (live) - Acid Kirk​ (live) / Artcraft (VJ)

5 Avril - CyberKiosc - Valbonne:

Ateliers - présentation de projets AVNode et LPM - Artist jam (VJ / MIDI / OSC)

Vidéos par Cyriak​

Installations (vendredi et samedi):

- FrancoGrid​

- Marionette Zoo

- Beautiful Chaos (Nathan Selikoff)

- La Linea (Goofy Goober Project)

- Mapping gaming (FLxER Team)

- Light painting (Chanette Manso)

- Kinect games (Artcraft & Reymenta)

Ateliers payants (vendredi, samedi et dimanche):

- COge (Kamikaze Jane)

- Découverte du VJing (Artcraft)

- Ableton Live + Max4Live

Ateliers gratuits (vendredi, samedi et dimanche):

- Kinect with Mac OS (pplc)

Accès au SoFAB, le Fablab de Sophia Antipolis

Expo photo (jeudi à dimanche): Caz In The Machine, Ars Fractalis by JeF


For its 2nd edition, Sophia Digital Art will take place in the "Pré des Arts" venue in Valbonne from april 2 to 5 ,2015: installations, AV performances, workshops! Please contribute! 

Line-up:

PLAID (Warp records) Live, UK

D'ARCANGELO (Rephlex) Live, Italy

ACID KIRK (Re-Load / Discrepant) Live, Belgium

OQPO_OOOO (AV performance), France

BATCHASS + ARTCRAFT (Live + VJ), France

GUNSTON + REYMENTA (DJ set + VJ), France

MERAKHAAZAN + NOSFERATU (Live doublebass + movie), France

MARISKAO (AV perfformance), UK

OPPOSITE (AV performance), France

TROIS FOIS CINQ (KAMIKAZE JANE + TIMVIS), Germany

LA LINEA (Installation), Italy

MARIONETTE ZOO (Installation), Hungary

BEAUTIFUL CHAOS (Installation), USA

KRIS SPLIT (DJ set), France

K21 (Live), France

NEKRA DAMAGE + STIKYTOX (Live), France

AVNODE (Project presentation), Italy

LPM  (Project presentation), Italy

MAPPING GAMING (Installation), Italy

CYRIAK (Video), UK

PROCESSING (Workshop), USA

COGE (Workshop), Germany

ABLETON LIVE (Workshop), France

KAZ IN THE MACHINE (Photo exposition), France

ARS FRACTALIS (Photo exposition), France

story:
Rain Ahead...


Hey there! I'm Liz, you may also know me as Mostly, or not at all. I'm a previously fully functioning adult trying to pick up the pieces after one hell of a storm.

That's why I need your help to buy up some of those clouds and help clear away the storm so the rebuild can commence. I've already started, but it's hard to get walls up in the rain.

What Do You Get?




Well you got some adorable slightly weird cloudy love to adorn your hallways or dimly lit entry! Or a rad gift for the slightly obnoxious acquaintance in your life! Maybe you enjoy inflicting dark cartoon art on your unsuspecting conservative aunt? There's just so many options! 


For the smaller contributions, I've got professional prints on Glossy Fuji Chrystal archive paper! Both the square and stretch clouds in either regular or crackle, as well as prints of some of my past work.
But the main attraction is getting your very own "original" piece of art! Choose the color scheme as specific (blues and grays) or vague (something warm) as you want, or leave it up to chance. Pick a square cloud, or stretch! textured, or crackle! Each cloud will be painted just for you. 

If we're able to reach the stretch goals, I'll make special add-ons available for the clouds (stuff like silver linings!) as well as a few other goodies.


What I Need 
There is quite a bit debt, a broken car, and some seriously late bills I need to get on top of. Because it's such a substantial chunk I'm aiming to at least knock out the later two, with a stretch goal to cover the first. I wouldn't be a true American without a little debt.

  • $900 Car Repairs
    First and foremost I have to replace the radiator and fans in my beloved Trooper. It also badly needs a tune up, some new CV joints, and the timing chain replaced. To save on cash, I'll be doing everything aside from the timing chain myself.
  • $1500 Late Bills
    Utilities have been stacking up a long while, my phone is shut off aside from using wifi calling while home, and I owe my roommates for helping me out on rent several months ago.
Total of $2,400


Stretch Goals!
  • $5,000
    I can pay off all my medical debt from the past four years!
  • $7,500
    I can pay back personal loans!
  • $10,000
    I can get myself into the black completely after paying off the rest of the bills in collections and back owed taxes!


Other Ways You Can Help

I know money can be tight, but you can always talk about this! Share my silly video with your friends and family! Tell people about the kind of sad chick literally selling the storms of her life to get back in the black.

story:
About the Art Project:

There is a potential in art to lift people’s spirits and connect them to themselves. Help me spread messages of joy, freedom, and expression through inspiring people with art internationally! 

  • I am an artist based in Los Angeles.  I create cityscape and coastal paintings inspired by the way people’s lives intersect.

    There is a natural collaboration between people that I pay attention to in my work that may on the surface look like a depiction of a place.  

    Yet the energy and layers of hidden stories and possibilities in any setting remind us that we all contribute to a bigger picture through every action we take and thought we make. 

  • After years of painting and sharing my work in Southern California, I am so honored and grateful to be recognized by Alfio Borghese, a prominent art critic/curator and artistic director of galleries throughout Italy. He has selected my work for a solo exhibition to include 20 or more of my paintings at the Villa Comunale di Frosinone. I will go to Italy from May-September 2015 to create and exhibit paintings inspired by Los Angeles and US scenes to share with Italian audiences.  My exhibit, An Eclectic Perspective or in Italian Una Prospettiva Eclettica from August 24-September 6, 2015 is part of The Festival of Visual Contemporary Arts in Frosinone near Rome. 

  • (above photo: with Alfio Borghese upon meeting at the Oceanside Museum (OMA) opening reception in December 2014 for the touring international exhibit, California Dreaming: An International Portrait of Southern California juried by LA art critic/curator Peter Frank, and museum directors Daniel Foster & Drew Oberjuerge.  My painting is one of the 54 artworks that traveled to Italy in October of 2014 and has returned to exhibit at OMA and the Riverside Museum of Art)
  •   
  • As navigating the logistics of constructing and creating this many paintings in unique dimensions in another culture away from my studio is such a HUGE undertaking...It would mean so much to me to have your support with additional expenses so that I can focus energy towards painting and representing LA and the US well.

Who Has Helped?

This project already has some amazing sponsors and support! The Los Angeles Downtown Arts District Space (LADADSpace) which is a 501(c)(3) non profit has taken this project on as a sponsor which makes any of your contributions tax deductible!

Already Obtained Support & Contributions: $14,550

-I have a place to stay and paint while I am in Italy (estimated value $5000+). 
-some meals will be provided!
-Gamblin Artist Colors, Jerry’s Artarama, & Modern Masters have graciously made donations towards my art supply list ($675 total).
-Round-trip airfare from LA to Rome- ($1050)- I already purchased.
-I have spent $125 on sunscreen & electrolyte tablets for outdoor painting
-I purchased a small Laptop computer(edit images, marketing & communication)-$600 with gratitude to Chris Schiller for helping me set the computer up
-I will be spending $7000 to cover the cost of my studio and necessary expenses in LA while away 


Where Your Funds Count!

Remaining costs to cover with the help of IndieGoGo: $14,150 
Total Project Cost: $28,375 

Remaining Supplies-$2650 ( acrylic, ink & oil paint: $1000-450=$550 canvas: $800, easel: $300, wood: $500, misc tools: staple gun, needle nose pliers, saw, drop clothes, wire & hardware such as screws, brads, staples, extension cords: $500)

Services (shipment of some supplies, labor/construction, truck rentals, delivery/transportation)- $3700

Exhibition Invitations & Promotional Poster- $400

Catalogue of Paintings for Exhibit- $400

Reception Refreshments- $400

Stipend for 4 Months- (food, bus/train, italian phone plan, translation & hotels for additional travel to promote the paintings) $6600


About the Perks?
I have had so much fun coming up with perks to share with you! Photos below to illustrate some of the offers in the perks! Thanks to The Los Angeles Downtown Art District Space (LADADSpace) all contributions are tax deductible!


Get Good Vibes:

By helping spread the positive energy that art creates in the world-- good energy returns to you naturally...(photo above from The Happiness Sprinkling Project in LA)


Get my Art as Computer Wallpaper:

Receive a download of a painting created by me in Italy to use as wallpaper on your computer, laptop, tablet or mobile device! Let this be a reminder of places you wish to go and dreams you helped come true!...Email address required.

Get a Wish in the World Famous Trevi Fountain!

This fountain collects nearly 3000 Euros a day in coins thrown by people making wishes! The funds go to feeding people in need. I got really excited about making wishes for you and then discovered the fountain may be closed for construction while I am in Italy… No Matter! I will recruit another artist or fabulous people I meet during my 4 months in Italy to make a wish for your highest good! Oooo the mystery…who will I find to make your wish?

6" x 9" Art Postcard

Receive a postcard of art inspired by my trip to Italy. The below image Heart of the View  isn't actually the correct dimensions or the postcard...the size may vary based on which painting from the exhibit is chosen. 


A Handwritten Postcard from Me in Italy!

Ooo…where will your postcard come from? Somewhere in Italy…I suggest you think of the postcard when it arrives as a sign to indicate where you could go on vacation someday! That’s a fun game, yes? It’s kind of like throwing darts at a map or opening a book to a random page and spontaneously going there--only kinda different. This will be a handwritten postcard AND you get a wish in the Trevi fountain:)

Interpretive Dance Move for You at the Coliseum!

What? You would like to visit Rome and the Coliseum? Can't get away from your desk or have to tend the children? I will hold up your name on a sign in front of the Coliseum AND create an interpretive dance move that might be embarrassing or inspiring—just for you! This will be captured on video and you will be emailed a link. (Note: I may lack the skill of a professional dancer but have the enthusiasm of a hundred children)

4-Pack of Art Greeting Cards:

Get will get a 4 pack of greeting cards depicting paintings from my solo exhibit in Italy.  You will also get a brochure from the exhibit!


Italy Art Combo Fun Pack:

You get good vibes, art for computer wallpaper, a wish in the Trevi Fountain, a handwritten greeting on a postcard from me in Italy, a brochure from the exhibit,  a  6" x 9" postcard depicting a painting created in Italy, AND an 8 pack of greeting cards depicting paintings from the solo exhibit in Italy or paintings made in Italy.


8" x 14" Giclee Art Print on Rolled Canvas:

Get a limited edition Giclee art print on rolled canvas depicting one of the paintings from my solo exhibit in Italy!  Estimated size: 8" x 14" (the dimensions may vary slightly depending on the painting selected for the print). The below image Marées Familiars depicts the ratio of dimensions, although is not in the exhibit in Italy.


Original Sketch Painting from Italy:

Get an original 11" x 14" sketch painting using ink & watercolor on paper painted live in Italy! These are examples of commissions inspired from the photography of Kathi Saari and Erika Williams in the settings of Piren, Slovenia & Vicenza, Italy.

 If you have a location preference...let me know...and if it works to go there I will! No promises...Only buy this one if you are also willing to be surprised! To see examples of works on paper, see "Excursions" on my website.

This is a commission of my college roommate Kelly Galassi in Rome!


Own the Painting that Got me the Exhibit in Italy!

You can have the original  24" x 24" painting "Abbot Kinney 2" which  got me the solo exhibit in Italy! This painting is currently on exhibit at the Oceanside Museum of Art as part of  "California Dreaming: An International Portrait of Southern California" and will then travel to The Riverside Museum of Art til July 2015. 


Art Gift Certificates!

Do you see brightening your home or office with an original painting? Investing in an Art Gift Certificate now gets you a bonus towards your future selection! Art Gift Certificates includes the Art Adventure Combo Fun Pack! You can choose art on-line or if you are in the Los Angeles area arrange a studio visit. This is an exception as most art must be purchased through a gallery, art dealer, retail location or interior designer.

This is valid for available paintings that I have created or intend to create.   Paintings represented by galleries in exhibitions or slated for an exhibition do Not apply while the painting is in the care of a gallery. Certificate  may Not be used towards shipping or sales tax costs.

What will happen with the funds if I don't make the goal on Indiegogo?

  • This project has been announced in the Italian newspaper and I bought my plane ticket…so this project will happen!
    • In whatever amount, your contributions will make this project happen! When the logistics get covered I can focus more creative energy towards making the paintings. When I return to LA without having incurred debt, there will be more time to make paintings to share with the world and your energy will be in those paintings too!
    The below article speaks of  the artists who will be featured in The Festival of Visual Contempory Arts at Villa Comunale di Frosinone. Do you see see my painting?

    How will funds be used if the initial goal is exceeded?

  • Satellite trips in Italy or Europe to promote this exhibit and gain inspiration for NEW paintings to make upon returning to the US (this will include making live sketches & taking photos)
  • Transportation for potential opportunities to exhibit the works further throughout Italy or Europe as my host is the artistic director for several other galleries. If I wish to bring the paintings back to the US, the cost is estimated over $13,000.  As of yet the plan is to leave the paintings from this exhibit in Europe under Alfio's care for further exhibits in Italy. 
  • Editing together images and video footage or stills of the painting adventure in Italy 
  • Creating a coffee table book of my paintings upon returning with a special section featuring the paintings created in the Italian exhibit

Whose lives does art touch?

As my studio in LA is outdoors next to a street, I meet people on a daily basis who stop to tell me about their lives while I am painting or let me know through a car window that seeing me painting inspires them. Beyond all of the reasons that I paint for myself, it is exciting to know that the work I do lifts other people’s spirits and makes them curious about expressing themselves or brightens their day. Receiving this feedback only fuels me to paint more. There is a lot of junk going on in the world that most of us can’t fix or change alone and it’s sad …yet we can each be the best version of ourselves and let that rub off on others.  I get to stand in the sunshine with organic dog treats nearby for the neighbor dogs and make paintings from my heart and soul. 

(above: Jamie and the late Margaret who visited my studio daily...)

Not only is this an amazing project for me, it has opened up opportunities for artists and those in the art community around me. This exhibit has become part of a several exchanges between Italian and American artists. Alfio is passionate about cross cultural education through sharing art and has several projects in the works to bring Italian artists to exhibit in galleries in Los Angeles and to bring more American artists to Italy.  

What are the Risks & Challenges?

I have agreed to make a lot of paintings that fit together in a cohesive exhibit in a relatively short amount of time in a country where I don’t speak the language...yet

  • I have had a weekly Italian tutor since January who has been teaching me to read and speak. We are working on phrases specific to art and the logistics necessary to prepare for the exhibition and reception.

In LA, I cut and build all of the wooden frames that I stretch canvas around and this takes time and strength.

  • I will plan all of the paintings before leaving LA with dimensions in metric so that it will be easier to communicate with whoever helps me build the frames to stretch the canvas when I arrive.

Since I work in a series of layers, the time it takes to create a painting varies from days to months (not including the planning/inspiration stages).  What takes the longest amount of time is for the thick textured oil paint to dry between layers. I often go through several 150-200ml tubes of oil paint on the larger paintings. It is difficult to see the thickness of the texture in a photo. Here is a close up:

It is crucial that the paintings which need more layers and dry time get started and finished first as the paintings will need to dry before being transported to the gallery.  As Italy is more humid than LA, this could affect the dry time. 

  • In the event that I have any difficulty with help, I have the skills to build everything myself. It is preferable to have help so that most energy goes towards painting. I will have a plan of what tools will get shipped, borrowed or obtained when I arrive. My dad got me a portable light weight drill for my birthday to take with! Woot woo!!! Look how cute the little drill is! 

    I also like to wear an empty tool belt...

    The tool belt is too heavy with the tools in it...but it amuses me to wear the tool belt. I feel like such a tough worker... debating whether to take an empty tool belt to Italy...it is part of my process.
  • This is the first project I have taken on of this scale overseas…although I have completed hundreds of works and promoted many art exhibits in a variety of settings. I have a good deal of experience living and working overseas in other capacities.

  • In 2012, I went to Dongguan, China for a commission of one painting, which taught me that making art in another culture requires being patient, resourceful and equipped with a spirit of enthusiasm & adventure…which I have! There is also a mental attitude of flexibility that is needed because it is not possible to go through the day in one’s normal routine…There is so much to learn along the way. 

(above: I had a following of security guards who visited me each day to check the progress of the painting.  I met probably a hundred people a day as I was situated next to a busy intersection.) 

  • In college and right after I had the opportunity to live and work with children on U.S. Military bases in Okinawa, Japan, Vicenza, Italy (luckily, I got to enjoy the pizza & gelato before I had food sensitivities) and Wiesbaden, Germany.  I also participated in various theatre projects in Gdansk, Poland and worked for U.S. Embassies in Tokyo, Japan & Bejing, China. I welcome reconnecting with the part of myself that thrives in another culture. 

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you who don’t see yourself in a place to contribute- Attention spreads awareness and good cheer regardless of a financial contributions!

  • I SO appreciate when you pass this on to friends via email, word of mouth, frequent phone calls with long messages, or on social media (facebook, twitter, instagram or wherever else you stamp your cyber footprint)—Use the Indiegogo share tools to make your life easier!
  • I also appreciate prayers, good thoughts, smiles, encouragement, and random interpretive dances in public places just because you can…
  • And If you don’t make art and would like to, remember that being an artist is in how you see the world…look for beauty...notice the details and wah-lah…you transform and the world around you does too!


Wall of Fame: (My Gratitudes/Oscar Speech)

A special thanks to Ben Godar for inspiring me to create this campaign, for helping me focus, and for putting together the video for this project! Thank you to Kevin Lynn of KLL Video Productions for contributing footage.

Thank you to Alfio Borghese for his artistic vision, recognition and generosity.

The Saari-Williams family for huge generosity, support and encouragement

Thank you to Jonathan Jerald and at The Los Angeles Downtown Arts District Space for being an angel in many ways and to Tim Keating for supporting this project!

Thank you to Kay Colvin and  the Oceanside Museum of Art & jurors Peter Frank, Daniel Foster & Drew Oberjuerge who selected my paintings in 2014 as one of the 54 artworks in California Dreaming: An International Portrait of Southern California  which toured in October 2014 to the Palazzo della Provincia di Frosinone in Frosinone, Italy, which lead to this solo exhibit. 

Thank you to Silvana Tei Kenney for tutoring me in Italian and to Julienne Johnson for helping this project expand to include opportunities for more artists in LA.

Thank you to my many supporters and followers who are cheerleaders on a daily basis.

Especially thank you to my collectors whose investments support the creation of more art! AND Thank you to the galleries and art dealers who represent and promote my work!

Thank you to Gamblin Artist Materials, Jerry's Artarama, Modern Masters and Jack Richeson & Co. Inc. for generous donations of supplies.

Thank you to Chris Schiller for helping me set my computer up!
