story_txt:
About the Art Project:
There is a potential in
art to lift people’s spirits and connect them to themselves. Help me spread
messages of joy, freedom, and expression through inspiring people with art
internationally! 
I am an artist based
     in Los Angeles.  I create cityscape and coastal paintings
     inspired by the way people’s lives intersect. There is a natural collaboration
     between people that I pay attention to in my work that may on the surface
     look like a depiction of a place.  Yet the energy and layers of hidden
     stories and possibilities in any setting remind us that we all contribute
     to a bigger picture through every action we take and thought we make. 

After years of
     painting and sharing my work in Southern California, I am so honored and
     grateful to be recognized by Alfio Borghese, a prominent art
     critic/curator and artistic director of galleries throughout Italy. He
     has selected my work for a solo exhibition to include 20 or more of my
     paintings at the Villa Comunale di Frosinone. I will go to Italy from May-September 2015 to create and
     exhibit paintings inspired by Los
       Angeles and US scenes to share with Italian
     audiences.  My exhibit, An Eclectic Perspective or in
     Italian Una Prospettiva Eclettica from
     August 24-September 6, 2015 is part of The Festival of Visual Contemporary
     Arts in Frosinone near Rome. 
(above photo: with Alfio Borghese upon meeting at the Oceanside Museum (OMA) opening reception in December 2014 for the touring international exhibit, California Dreaming: An International Portrait of Southern California juried by LA art critic/curator Peter Frank, and museum directors Daniel Foster & Drew
Oberjuerge.  My painting is one of the 54 artworks that traveled to Italy in October of 2014 and has returned to exhibit at OMA and the Riverside Museum of Art)
  
As navigating the
     logistics of constructing and creating this many paintings in unique
     dimensions in another culture away from my studio is such a HUGE undertaking...It
     would mean so much to me to have your support with additional expenses so
     that I can focus energy towards painting and representing LA and the US well.





Who Has Helped?
This
project already has some amazing sponsors and support! The Los Angeles Downtown
Arts District Space (LADADSpace) which is a 501(c)(3) non profit has taken this
project on as a sponsor which makes any of your contributions tax deductible!Already Obtained Support & Contributions: $14,550-I have a place to stay and paint while I am in Italy (estimated value $5000+). -some meals will be provided!-Gamblin Artist Colors, Jerry’s
Artarama, & Modern Masters have graciously made donations towards my art supply list ($675 total).-Round-trip airfare from LA to Rome- ($1050)- I already purchased.-I have spent $125 on sunscreen & electrolyte tablets for outdoor painting-I purchased a small Laptop computer(edit images, marketing & communication)-$600 with gratitude to Chris Schiller for helping me set the computer up-I will be spending $7000 to cover the cost of my studio and necessary expenses in LA while away 
Where Your Funds Count!Remaining costs to cover with the help of IndieGoGo: $14,150 Total Project Cost: $28,375 

Remaining
Supplies-$2650 ( acrylic,
ink & oil paint: $1000-450=$550 canvas: $800, easel: $300,
wood: $500, misc tools: staple gun, needle nose pliers, saw, drop clothes, wire
& hardware such as screws, brads, staples, extension cords: $500)

Services (shipment of some supplies, labor/construction, truck rentals, delivery/transportation)- $3700
Exhibition Invitations
& Promotional Poster- $400
Catalogue of Paintings
for Exhibit- $400
Reception
Refreshments- $400
Stipend for 4 Months- (food, bus/train, italian phone plan,
translation & hotels for additional travel to promote the paintings) $6600
About the Perks?I have had so much
     fun coming up with perks to share with you! Photos below to illustrate some of the offers in the perks! Thanks to The Los Angeles Downtown Art District Space (LADADSpace) all contributions are tax deductible!
Get Good Vibes:


By helping spread the positive energy that art creates in the world-- good energy returns to you naturally...(photo above from The Happiness Sprinkling Project in LA)
Get my Art as Computer Wallpaper:Receive a download of a painting created by me in Italy to use as wallpaper on your computer, laptop, tablet or mobile device! Let this be a reminder of places you wish to go and dreams you helped come true!...Email address required.Get a Wish in the World Famous Trevi Fountain!
This fountain collects nearly 3000 Euros a day in coins thrown by people making wishes! The funds go to feeding people in need. I got really excited about making wishes for you and then discovered the fountain may be closed for construction while I am in Italy… No Matter! I will recruit another artist or fabulous people I meet during my 4 months in Italy to make a wish for your highest good! Oooo the mystery…who will I find to make your wish?6" x 9" Art Postcard
Receive a postcard of art inspired by my trip to Italy. The below image Heart of the View  isn't actually the correct dimensions or the postcard...the size may vary based on which painting from the exhibit is chosen. 

A Handwritten Postcard from Me in Italy!Ooo…where will your postcard come from? Somewhere in Italy…I suggest you think of the postcard when it arrives as a sign to indicate where you could go on vacation someday! That’s a fun game, yes? It’s kind of like throwing darts at a map or opening a book to a random page and spontaneously going there--only kinda different. This will be a handwritten postcard AND you get a wish in the Trevi fountain:)Interpretive Dance Move for You at the Coliseum!
What? You would like to visit Rome and the Coliseum? Can't get away from your desk or have to tend the children? I will hold up your name on a sign in front of the Coliseum AND create an interpretive dance move that might be embarrassing or inspiring—just for you! This will be captured on video and you will be emailed a link. (Note: I may lack the skill of a professional dancer but have the enthusiasm of a hundred children)4-Pack of Art Greeting Cards:
Get will get a 4 pack of greeting cards depicting paintings from my solo exhibit in Italy.  You will also get a brochure from the exhibit!

Italy Art Combo Fun Pack:

You get good vibes, art for computer wallpaper, a wish in the Trevi Fountain, a handwritten greeting on a postcard from me in Italy, a brochure from the exhibit,  a  6" x 9" postcard depicting a painting created in Italy, AND an 8 pack of greeting cards depicting paintings from the solo exhibit in Italy or paintings made in Italy.









8" x 14" Giclee Art Print on Rolled Canvas:
Get a limited edition Giclee art print on rolled canvas depicting one of the paintings from my solo exhibit in Italy!  Estimated size: 8" x 14" (the dimensions may vary slightly depending on the painting selected for the print). The below image Marées Familiars depicts the ratio of dimensions, although is not in the exhibit in Italy.



Original Sketch Painting from Italy:Get an original 11" x 14" sketch painting using ink & watercolor on paper painted live in Italy! These are examples of commissions inspired from the photography of Kathi Saari and Erika Williams in the settings of Piren, Slovenia & Vicenza, Italy.

 If you have a location preference...let me know...and if it works to go there I will! No promises...Only buy this one if you are also willing to be surprised! To see examples of works on paper, see "Excursions" on my website.This is a commission of my college roommate Kelly Galassi in Rome!
Own the Painting that Got me the Exhibit in Italy!
You can have the original  24" x 24" painting "Abbot Kinney 2" which  got me the solo exhibit in Italy! This painting is currently on exhibit at the Oceanside Museum of Art as part of  "California Dreaming: An International Portrait of Southern California" and will then travel to The Riverside Museum of Art til July 2015. 



Art Gift Certificates!

Do you see brightening your home or office with an original painting? Investing in an Art Gift Certificate now gets you a bonus towards your future selection! Art Gift Certificates includes the Art Adventure Combo Fun Pack! You can choose art on-line or if you are in the Los Angeles area arrange a studio visit. This is an exception as most art must be purchased through a gallery, art dealer, retail location or interior designer.

This is valid for available paintings that I have created or intend to create.   Paintings represented by galleries in exhibitions or slated for an exhibition do Not apply while the painting is in the care of a gallery. Certificate  may Not be used towards shipping or sales tax costs.What will happen with the funds if I don't make the goal on Indiegogo?
This project has been announced in the Italian newspaper and I
     bought my plane ticket…so this project will happen! 
In whatever amount, your contributions will make this project happen! When the logistics get covered I can focus more creative energy towards making the paintings. When I return to LA without having incurred debt, there will be more time to make paintings to share with the world and your energy will be in those paintings too!The below article speaks of  the artists who will be featured in The Festival of Visual Contempory Arts at Villa Comunale di Frosinone. Do you see see my painting?
How will funds be used if the initial goal is exceeded?


Satellite trips in Italy or Europe to promote this exhibit and gain inspiration for NEW paintings to make upon returning to the US (this will include making live sketches & taking photos)


Transportation for potential opportunities to exhibit the works
     further throughout Italy or Europe as my host is the artistic director for several other galleries. If I wish to bring the paintings back to the US, the cost is estimated over $13,000.  As of yet the plan is to leave the paintings from this exhibit in Europe under Alfio's care for further exhibits in Italy. 

Editing together images and video footage or stills of the painting adventure in Italy 


Creating a coffee table book of my paintings upon returning with a special section featuring the paintings created in the Italian exhibit





Whose
lives does art touch?
As
my studio in LA is outdoors next to a street, I meet people on a daily basis
who stop to tell me about their lives while I am painting or let me know
through a car window that seeing me painting inspires them. Beyond all of the
reasons that I paint for myself, it is exciting to know that the work I do
lifts other people’s spirits and makes them curious about expressing themselves
or brightens their day. Receiving this feedback only fuels me to paint more. There
is a lot of junk going on in the world that most of us can’t fix or change alone and it’s sad …yet we can each be the best
version of ourselves and let that rub off on others.  I get to stand in the sunshine with organic dog treats nearby for the neighbor dogs and make paintings from my
heart and soul. (above: Jamie and the late Margaret who visited my studio daily...)Not
only is this an amazing project for me, it has opened up opportunities for artists and those in the art community around me. This exhibit has become part of a several exchanges between Italian
and American artists. Alfio is passionate about cross cultural education
through sharing art and has several projects in the works to bring Italian
artists to exhibit in galleries in Los Angeles
and to bring more American artists to Italy.  
What
are the Risks & Challenges?
I have agreed to
make a lot of paintings that fit together in a cohesive exhibit in a relatively
short amount of time in a country where I don’t
speak the language...yet

I have had a weekly
     Italian tutor since January who has been teaching me to read and speak. We
     are working on phrases specific to art and the logistics
     necessary to prepare for the exhibition and reception. 

In
LA, I cut and build all of the wooden frames that I stretch canvas around and
this takes time and strength. 

I will plan all of
     the paintings before leaving LA with dimensions in metric so that it will
     be easier to communicate with whoever helps me build the
     frames to stretch the canvas when I arrive.


Since
I work in a series of layers, the time it takes to create a painting varies
from days to months (not including
the planning/inspiration stages).  What
takes the longest amount of time is for the thick textured oil paint to dry
between layers. I often go through several 150-200ml tubes of oil paint on the larger paintings. It is difficult to see the thickness of the texture in a photo. Here is a close up: It is crucial that the paintings which need more layers and dry
time get started and finished first as the paintings will need to dry before
being transported to the gallery.  As Italy is more
humid than LA, this could affect the dry time. 
In the event that I
     have any difficulty with help, I have the skills to build everything
     myself. It is preferable to have help so that most energy goes towards
     painting. I will have a plan of what tools will get shipped, borrowed or
     obtained when I arrive. My dad got me a portable light weight drill for my birthday to
     take with! Woot woo!!! Look how cute the little drill is! 
I also like to wear an empty tool belt...
The tool belt is too heavy with the tools in it...but it amuses me to wear the tool belt. I feel like such a tough worker... debating whether to take an empty tool belt to Italy...it is part of my process.


This is the first project I have taken on of this scale
overseas…although I have completed hundreds of works and promoted many art
exhibits in a variety of settings. I have a good deal of experience living and
working overseas in other capacities.

In 2012, I went to Dongguan, China for a commission of one painting, which taught me that making art in another culture requires being patient, resourceful and equipped with a spirit of enthusiasm & adventure…which I have! There is also a mental attitude of flexibility that is needed because it is not possible to go through the day in one’s normal routine…There is so much to learn along the way. (above: I had a following of security guards who visited me each day to check the progress of the painting.  I met probably a hundred people a day as I was situated next to a busy intersection.) 
In college and right after I had the opportunity to live and work with children on U.S.
     Military bases in Okinawa, Japan, Vicenza,
     Italy (luckily, I got to enjoy the pizza & gelato before I had food sensitivities) and Wiesbaden, Germany.  I also participated in various theatre
     projects in Gdansk, Poland and worked for U.S. Embassies in Tokyo, Japan
     & Bejing, China.
     I welcome reconnecting with the part of myself that thrives in another
     culture. 


Other
Ways You Can Help
For
those of you who don’t see yourself in a place to contribute- Attention spreads
awareness and good cheer regardless of a financial contributions!


I SO appreciate
     when you pass this on to friends via email, word of mouth, frequent phone
     calls with long messages, or on social media (facebook, twitter,
     instagram or wherever else you stamp your cyber footprint)—Use the Indiegogo
     share tools to make your life easier!

I also appreciate
     prayers, good thoughts, smiles, encouragement, and random interpretive
     dances in public places just because you can… 
And
     If you don’t make art and would
     like to, remember that being an artist is in how you see the world…look
     for beauty...notice the details and wah-lah…you transform and the world
     around you does too!





Wall of Fame: (My Gratitudes/Oscar Speech)
A special thanks to Ben Godar for
inspiring me to create this campaign, for helping me focus, and for putting
together the video for this project! Thank you to Kevin Lynn of KLL Video
Productions for contributing footage.
Thank you to Alfio Borghese for his
artistic vision, recognition and generosity.
The Saari-Williams family for huge generosity, support and encouragement
Thank you to Jonathan Jerald and at The Los
Angeles Downtown Arts District Space for being an angel in many ways and to Tim Keating for supporting this project!
Thank you to Kay Colvin and  the Oceanside Museum of Art & jurors Peter
Frank, Daniel Foster & Drew Oberjuerge who selected my paintings
in 2014 as one of the 54 artworks in California Dreaming: An
International Portrait of Southern California  which toured in October
2014 to the Palazzo della Provincia di Frosinone in Frosinone, Italy, which lead
to this solo exhibit. 


Thank you to Silvana Tei Kenney for
tutoring me in Italian and to Julienne Johnson for helping this project expand
to include opportunities for more artists in LA. 
Thank you to my many supporters and
followers who are cheerleaders on a daily basis. 
Especially thank you to my collectors
whose investments support the creation of more art! AND Thank you to the galleries and art dealers who represent and promote my work!

Thank you to Gamblin Artist Materials, Jerry's Artarama, Modern Masters and Jack Richeson & Co. Inc. for generous
donations of supplies.Thank you to Chris Schiller for helping me set my computer up!
Thank you to my amazing family, friends
& supporters who already contributed to my project before this campaign

story:
Hey there guys, my name is 84 pages and I'm a Colorado-based artist. Cartoons, monsters, street art and music fuel the fire of my passion to create but this isn't just a hobby, it's a way of life. I need your help to embark on the next journey: Denver Comic Con. With the help of your donations, I  will be able to bring my art to thousands of people in hopes of gaining the new exposure I desperately need in order to survive as an artist.

I'm looking to raise $2,000 so I don't show up empty-handed. 

$1,400 of that will go to runs of six different limited edition art prints, a total of 180 prints.

$400 will go to stickers and a logo tee that will be used for both the rewards and a table items, also a banner and business cards. 

The remaining $200 will cover Indiegogo fees. 

Awesome rewards for every donation made!

This is a massive step forward in pursuing a career in art. For me it's not about becoming rich or famous but instead about striving to survive with my passion to create. There are no guarantees in the art world and the struggle of an artist is real, but we do it for the love of it. I sincerely thank anyone who read this far, even if you can't help with funds sharing this campaign on the social media outlets with your friends or anyone you think might have an interest could make all the difference in helping to reach this goal.

story:
Help Sans Borders- Orphanages , Displaced Communities, Schools, Emergency Aid

Our focus is locating remote village schools and orphanages here for both Refugees and the locals to help support them in areas of education, quality of living, meals and medical needs. 
About Us:
There are 2 of us in this team. We try to help them by telling their stories and journey through photos and through social media to the public so that people can share our experience in this and reach out to help if they wish to. Any extra cash we get we walk and mingle with the people here and buy meals or toys for the children we meet on the streets to share some joy and give them hope and smiles.
We appreciate all the help we can get from the public here and overseas. We see this opportunity to help people help one another globally sans borders, religion and race.

~Andrew Day & Liz Mys
#500Hope

story:
What's this?

A zine  is most commonly a small circulation self-published work of original or appropriated texts and images usually reproduced via photocopier.

Hey, dude! My name is Gustavs Bērziņš and i love cool and cultural stuff. i haven't got any great talents, but i know lots of people, who do lots of cool stuff and i figured out, that, if i can't be an artist, why not work with them and help them anyhow? So i decided to make this zine. 

I have already printed the first issue, which you can buy here! People loved it and 22 artists took part in it, but i have no money to print out the second one. 500 people liked (not)art facebook page, which currently is mostly in Latvian, but will change and become more international right after this campaign.

(not)art is an Art zine(how ironic, eh?), that allows everyone to join in. Based on open-calls and has this specific style. The original style is that everything submitted has to be technically easy enough, so an untalanted kid could have made it too. Easy doesn't mean not aesthetically appealing. Everything submitted also has to look cool. Technically easy and aesthetically looking good ain't an easy combination. You can submit anything, that you can print on paper. We might print Art issues also. Who knows, right?

(not)art is about being true and speaking freely in a casual language.

What I Need & What You Get

Unfortunately, i need 500 eur. I need 500 euros to print out the second issue, print out the stickers, get the (not)art homepage up, not just a facebook page, print out posters, buy some cheap ad spaces, so people would know, that we do exist and keep the rest of the money in the (not)art piggy bank for darker days of this zine. The main goal is to print as many issues as possible, so i can get these zines to as many people as possible.

BUT you get something in exchange too!

  • if you fund 5 eur of this project, you get: 
    A PDF version of the first and second issue and a thank you letter straight to your e-mail.
  • if you fund 10 eur of this project, you get:
    All of the perks above AND real physical version of the second issue of (not)art straight to your mail.
  • if you fund 15 eur of this project, you get:
    All of the perks above AND your portrait drawn by one of (not)artist pioneers.
  • if you fund 30 eur of this project, you get:
    All of the perks above AND your name at "special thanks to" list at the end of the second issue.
  • if you fund 50 eur of this project you get: 
    All of the perks above AND your own printable material published in next zine.
  • if you fund 150 eur of this project you get:
    All of the perks above AND your own zine published and sold at the quantity of 100 copies  by (not)art. 
If i don't reach the entire goal, i will try and figure out some place else, to gather money for (not)art zine. This has to happen, dude.
The Impact

(not)art zine is valuable, because there are too less magazines and zines, that cover art with  free/cool/not sophisticated speech and techniques. I strongly feel like this is needed for lots of people. For some this is needed, because by reading (not)art they might start to understand culture.

I have successfully printed and sold the first issue, which was sold for a too small price to print out the second issue. I have gathered a small (not)art Latvian community with 500+ people at facebook. 

View the gallery to see some of the previous (not)art submissions.

This will work, bud! 

Risks & Challenges

There are some risks. I'm only a guy and i might not find a way to fight my way in international markets and this might stay as Latvian zine only, which would be ok too.

Other Ways You Can Help

Like my facebook page!

TELL OTHERS ABOUT THIS!

(not)art is an Art zine(how ironic, eh?), that allows everyone to join in. Based on open-calls and has this specific style. The original style is that everything submitted has to be technically easy enough, so an untalanted kid could have made it too. Easy doesn't mean not aesthetically appealing. Everything submitted also has to look cool. Technically easy and aesthetically looking good ain't an easy combination. You can submit anything, that you can print on paper. We might print Art issues also. Who knows, right?
(not)art is about being true and speaking freely in a casual language.
   What I Need & What You Get Unfortunately, i need 500 eur. I need 500 euros to print out the second issue, print out the stickers, get the (not)art homepage up, not just a facebook page, print out posters, buy some cheap ad spaces, so people would know, that we do exist and keep the rest of the money in the (not)art piggy bank for darker days of this zine. The main goal is to print as many issues as possible, so i can get these zines to as many people as possible.
BUT you get something in exchange too!


if you fund 5 eur of this project, you get: A PDF version of the first and second issue and a thank you letter straight to your e-mail.


if you fund 10 eur of this project, you get:All of the perks above AND real physical version of the second issue of (not)art straight to your mail.
if you fund 15 eur of this project, you get:All of the perks above AND your portrait drawn by one of (not)artist pioneers.

if you fund 30 eur of this project, you get:All of the perks above AND your name at "special thanks to" list at the end of the second issue.
if you fund 50 eur of this project you get: All of the perks above AND your own printable material published in next zine.


if you fund 150 eur of this project you get:All of the perks above AND your own zine published and sold at the quantity of 100 copies  by (not)art. 
If i don't reach the entire goal, i will try and figure out some place else, to gather money for (not)art zine. This has to happen, dude.

The Impact
 (not)art zine is valuable, because there are too less magazines and zines, that cover art with  free/cool/not sophisticated speech and techniques. I strongly feel like this is needed for lots of people. For some this is needed, because by reading (not)art they might start to understand culture.
I have successfully printed and sold the first issue, which was sold for a too small price to print out the second issue. I have gathered a small (not)art Latvian community with 500+ people at facebook. 
View the gallery to see some of the previous (not)art submissions.
This will work, bud!    Risks & Challenges There are some risks. I'm only a guy and i might not find a way to fight my way in international markets and this might stay as Latvian zine only, which would be ok too.
    Other Ways You Can Help 
Like my facebook page!TELL OTHERS ABOUT THIS!

story:
What does a MILLION look like?

or to be more precise what does

 ONE MILLION people look like?


FibonARTcci will answer that question.
The overall aim of the project is to take a portrait photograph of ONE MILLION people. 

How?

It would be almost impossible to just go out in the world and take this photo, so we are going to use a staged approach to help use reach our target and build the world's largest art project along the way.
We are taking a series of 31 gigapixel photographs, the number of people in each photo increases in size following the first 31 numbers the Fibonacci sequence - from 1 person, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13, 21... until we reach the first number over one million people! 1,346,269 people.  
In total, with the completion of the 31st image, 3.5 million people from around the world would have helped make The FibonARTcci Spiral. 

     


FibonARTcci will connect people from different sporting events and festivals across the world by involving the audience in a completely new concept of entertainment. 

As well as having a great time with family and friends, these people will share in the technology and innovation of Gigapixel portrait photographs. 

FibonARTcci aims to  travel the world to take these photographs as we want to include as many people as possible from Europe to Africa, from the Americas to Asia, New Zealand and Australia. 

                              

The viewing platform for the photos will be web based. This will allow the viewer to ZOOM into the photos to see individual faces, as if you are still standing right next to them!  That is the  power of Giga Pixel Technology! When the final photo has been taken, we will exhibit the whole FibonARTcci Spiral on a massive digital wall, with interactive consoles, that will allow the viewer to enter a name or number linked to a geo-tag and zoom straight into that person.

Each FibonARTcci photograph will be added and stitched around the very first photo to form a spiral image that will ultimately form ‘The FibonARTcci Spiral’. 




Each person will become part of a unique community of over 3.5 million people from around the world. The people in the FibonARTcci photos will belong to an exclusive club of World Record Breaking Photography.

The Plan

We have just received the news that FibonARTcci has been accepted into the Bristol International Balloon Fiesta 2015, 6 - 9 August. An estimated 500,000 are expected to attend over the 4 days of the festival. This is a massive boost to the project and we are very confident in achieving our goals.

Click her to find out all about the Bristol International Balloon Fiesta

                  


                  


Our Goals

We are  planning to take the next Five Gigapixel portrait photographs from 89 to 610 people at the Bristol International Balloon Fiesta. These photographs will help us complete 15 of the 31 FibonARTcci photographs.

       


FibonARTcci is the Largest 

Art Project in the World!

FibonARTcci is all about people, it's all about you! Innovation is also key to this ambitious project:

This style of photography has never been tried before, although Gigapixel photography has been around for a while and large panoramic photos of crowds have been seen before. FibonARTcci is different: we are taking aerial portrait photographs on a global scale.

We have teamed up with one of the best Gigapixel photographs in the world, Tom Mills. Tom already has world record breaking Gigapixel photos under his belt and was part of the team that took the record-breaking 320 Gigapixel interactive picture of London. 



Our Achievements

I self funded the first 10 photos at the launch event in Cardiff. The event was an amazing success and I can honestly say that everyone who took part had an awesome time.

      

I would like to take this opportunity to thank everybody again for helping me create FibonARTcci Cardiff and I hope you can join us at our next event, FibonARTcci Bristol. 

How you can Help

We need your help to raise £17,000 to complete the next 5 FibonARTcci photos. These photos cannot happen without your support both in attendance and financially.

To kick-start the next phase of the project, the money raised from this campaign will go towards four vital pieces of the puzzle:

1. The entrance fee to the Bristol International Ballon Fiesta 2015.

2. The services of a world class Gigapixel photographer who will take the FibonARTcci portrait photographs.

2. An aerial platform (cherry picker/crane) (3 days hire) from where the photographs will be taken.

3. 1500 coloured T-Shirts with printed FibonARTcci logo.  

Every picture is colour coordinated and to guarantee the success of the photos, everyone has to be wearing the same coloured top, however any variation of the base colour for that particular photo is fine.

Perks

Our Perks are a big part of FibonARTcci and we would like to share them with you on our FibonARTcci YouTube Channel. 
Any money raised above the total for this event will be used to help the next photos. 

Risks

There are some associated risks for this type of photography, the main risk is cost. The amount we need to raise is for a 2-day photo shoot, which means hire rates for 3-days, this includes setting up the crane and the cameras on the Friday. If for some reason we do not reach the £17,000 target and we only attended the festival for one day, we would still be able to able to take some photos, just not all of them. The important thing to remember is, we will take as many photos as possible.

The second risk is the Great British Weather. Rain will not stop play, but thunder and lightning most definitely will, as well as high winds. Our photographer will be in a crane 30 - 40 metres above the crowd, so stability is very important. If for some reason the weather turns bad, we will still use the money raised to take the photos, but it will be at another event during the summer.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just cannot contribute financially, but that does not mean they cannot help:

We are looking for FibonARTcci Ambassadors and Event Volunteers.

  • We are constantly looking for enthusiastic people to join us! if you have skills in graphic design, art or web design and would like to get involved, we could definitely use your help, just look at our website www.FibonARTcci.com!
  • We would like you to help spread the word about FibonARTcci. It is the ultimate social art project- it's all about people, it's about networking, it's about connecting, it's about you!
  • We would also like you to take part in the photos, if you are available and are attending the Bristol International Balloon Fiesta, we would love to say hello and include you in the photos.
That's all Folks! See you at the next FibonARTcci photo event!

story:
Kitschyfresh Artworks, a start-up art business founded by folk artist fred velvet, is in need of a printer to continue to grow the business.
With an upcoming zine festival, we need to boost our inventory considerably.
We are campaigning to raise funds for a HP Officejet-Pro Printer, extra ink, and paper to produce zines and other business ephemera. 

The Break Down:

:KFA’s Crowd’funding Goals:

Total: __$351*__

*If you notice, the actual goal and the indiegogo goal are different. That is because the lowest amount to start a campaign is $500. 

------------------------------------------------------------------

The following are zines completed or near, and with your help will soon hit bookshelves...

Kitschyfresh artworks' how'to Be a Braid zine is ready to go! 
A handy-dandy how-to from everyone's favorite braid'lien is the perfect gift for anyone looking to spice up their style and flaunt some yarn.
This zine includes advice, how'to, original artwork, and some funny braid parody songs.


Human Created Evidence #2 is ready to go!
Super limited printing of a mere 60 copies; each featuring a Random FREE(box) CD salvaged, for you, with love from kitschyfresh artworks! 
This one was inspired by a giant box full of burnt cds and thus has been dubbed the 'music issue.' Featuring works by fRed Velvet and shane eide. Reviewing Big Dipper, bigfoot literature, Hopsin, and Leslie Hall.
Expand your mind and music collection with this neon combo!

Mordechai's blog, the zine, written by none other than Mordechai, the cat- that fuzzy lovable and grumpy companion of fRed's for going on Eleven years!
This zine features highlights from his' infamous blog, an interview with a zesty street-cat, suggested herbs, safe houseplant list, and so much more!
And the cool part is All Profits go to the "Fight PetDebt Fund!"
'But, what,' you ask, 'it that?'
Every year, one pet will be chosen to receive the money raised from fundraising efforts. This year, Mordechai was winner and the first fundraising effort is the zine.

Horde Zero, an illustrated chapbook collaboration between author Leroy Benes and folk artist fRed Velvet.
It started out as a bizarre murder case in a small town. Half of the Pallance family was eaten; their bones cleaned of flesh and left on the bloody kitchen floor. The other half of the family went missing…

We are also working on a collaboration with artist & poet Maria Fastcloud and a sci-fi & fantasy short story collection by author Sheldon Burnett.

story:
It has been a dream of mine to attend Penland School of Craft. I inherited my grandmother's loom years ago, preparing for my chance to use it in my recycled clothing business. I only went to college for one semester and have been yearning for a new creative learning experience. Every day at Rhetorical Factory I explore, hone and use my creative skills learning so much. I have the feeling that dedicating myself to a new skill for a few weeks will bring my current work to a whole new level- and do my soul a lot of good. This funding includes my tuition, meals and a dorm as well as an extra full time helper at the store.
UPDATE:

I've brought the original budget down with the help of friends volunteering their time at the shop and waiting to sign up for classes on Local Standby
Saving a total of $1464

NEW GOAL $1974

2 Weeks full time employee WAS 1448  NOW $444

Penland Tuition WAS 1020 NOW $610

Room and Meals  870

Supplies 100 NOW $50

story:
About the Derby

When: Sun, Aug 16, 2015 (the entries roll at 1pm)
Where: Lower Broadway and West Strand, Kingston, NY
More Info at: www.kingstonartistsoapboxderby.com

The Kingston Artist Soapbox Derby, now celebrating 20 years, is a parade of non-motorized kinetic sculptures capable of rolling down lower Broadway in Kingston, NY. It is an event that brings professional artists, the creatively inclined, families and friends together to show off their wild, wacky, and original soapbox creations. Early in the day participants park their creations along Broadway making final preparations, while thousands of spectators come to watch each car roll down the hill, one-by-one. Vendors and live performances add to a day of fun that concludes with a wacky and entertaining awards ceremony in Gallow Park, where participants receive prizes and one-of-kind artist designed trophies and spectators have the opportunity to get last looks at their favorite soapbox cars, lined up post-parade on West Strand Street.

What We Need & What You Get

Every year, while artistic entries roll smoothly down the hill, the Derby crawls by financially, never having quite enough speed!  

Every year we need some money to:

  • Give winners cool prizes
  • Pay for insurance and city support services
  • Hire entertainers to keep the spirit lively
  • Order gravity control T-shirts for the volunteers
  • Pay for promotional materials for the event
  • Host helpful and inspiring workshops

But we could do even more, like:

  • Give winners even cooler prizes
  • Do some online marketing and print advertising
  • Print a program with information on all the participating artists
  • Offer scholarships for participants
  • Offer more comprehensive workshops
  • Go into schools and summer camps with Derby Art programming
You can make these things happen! And we've worked up some cool perks too so you get more than just a fuzzy warm feeling when you support this amazing event!

The Impact

The Kingston Artist Soapbox Derby is a truly unique, family friendly event that promotes the arts and draws participants and spectators alike from far and wide. For thousands of people the Derby has become an annual institution. Derby organizers are hard at work promoting event participation to artists and creators across the United States, workshops are being held to help people who need assistance with constructing kinetic sculptures, and local community organizations and companies are being encouraged to join in the fun and build a soapbox car as a team! The Kingston Artist Soapbox Derby is also a real boon to local businesses. By bringing new and returning faces to the area, businesses and nonprofits get an opportunity to support the event while promoting their brand in unique and memorable ways! 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge this year is that we have a brand new committee and we got off to a late start! This Derby will go on no matter what, but we can't restore it to a regional arts event without some immediate support!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're a really broke artist or supporter of the arts, you can still help! 

  • Donate $1 (so we know you care)
  • Spread the word!
  • Invite people to the event on Facebook and like the Derby page while you are at it
  • Volunteer for Gravity Control on the day of the Derby (Aug. 16th) by filling out this form and clicking the "volunteer" check box: Click link for the form http://eepurl.com/bhzu3D

History of the Derby

For nearly two decades, the Derby has been a labor of love for its founder, Donskoj & Company, Each year, George Donskoj and Nancy Schneider Donskoj organized an army of art volunteers to deliver the festival with little budget beyond the cost of prizes. Since 2014, the Derby has a new home, Historic Kingston Waterfront (HKW), a “museum without walls” chartered by NYS Department of Education that seeks to help Kingston’s arts and cultural heritage destinations build capacity. Spearheading this years organization are Felix and Sarah Olivieri, owners of Olivieri’s Arts, Crafts, & Coffee, located on the derby parade route at 63 Broadway (www.olivieriart.com). The Olivieri’s are joined by a fabulous group of volunteers who are committed to returning the event to it’s former glory with a goal of attracting 10,000 spectators and 20-30 entries!

story:
About us and our region

Bor is a town in Eastern Serbia mainly associated with its big mining industry that once used to thrive and fuel the whole country's economy. The economic  and political turmoil left after the fall of Yugoslavia had left the mining complex waiting for new investments. Less is known about our regions great natural gems such as Mountain Stol ( 18km), Lazar's Canyon and its surrounding caves ( 16km ), Lake Bor ( 18km ) and hot springs in Brestovacka Banja where our festival is located.  


http://www.borizvazduha.rs/


In a  town without an established annual event a group of like minded friends had recognized a great  potential for tourism and made a brave decision to organize a festival in 2016.
As a location the organizers have chosen the abandoned swimming pools that where in use for only 3 years. Without a function, the pools had slowly, over four decades turned into ruin and became covered in litter. The name  for the event came naturally from the idea of converting this area.

 

 

After two successful events in 2016 and 2017, the swimming pools have been transformed in to an open air art gallery that welcomes guests all year round. This year along with the amazing music program and the mural art we are putting a strong focus on raising awareness about environmental protection. We are organising  lectures and a play for kids with a goal to educate the youth about the importance of protecting our environment. With our team of volunteers we will be conducting the removal of the litter from the surrounding areas. Our vision is to further develop this area and become a cultural hub with many events organised throughout the year.

How you can help us and what we offer

Our two main priorities this year are safety for all our visitors and environmental protection. Most of the funds collected this year will be invested in those two priorities. Since this year the greatest number of visitors of all ages is expected, maximizing the safety and security is very important. The swimming  pools are up to 3m deep and without water they must be fenced off. Some of the collected funds will be invested in renting a fence that is necessary to provide safe access to 1st festival. According to the assessment, we will need 600m of fence at a 5 $ per m price which leads to a calculation of $ 3000. In addition to entertainment, our second priority offers educational activities. Lectures about environmental protection will be held by some eminent Serbian instructors and conducting Eco - activities will educate young people about very important matter nowadays. Required sum of money for the overall implementation of the ecological part of the project is $ 2000.

    We made a lot of presents for our donors with festival’s logo. We have perks of 10, 25, 50, 100, 485 and 900$, and every of them is hiding surprise. We will find the best way to thank you, and we will do that maybe even personal! Support us because every support is priceless.

     If the funds, received through this campaign, overcome our goal it will go towards renting the fence, hiring extra staff and adequately compensating performers and artists. 

    Our goals

    The key to the festival’s success has been the development of a strong brand identity, and unique large-scale commissions that have driven word-of-mouth with a focus on quality and experience. Importantly, the choice and shape of the program is designed to have elements that will appeal and reach out to different audience demographics – from ‘culture vultures’ to people who would not usually attend arts events.

    We are slowly building a strong reputation  and every year we are receiving larger grants and more generous sponsorships. Our goal for Lost & Found festival is to become a recognisable brand with a big community where we can present all the potentials our region have to offer.  

     

     

    Risk and challenges

    In our first two years, one of the biggest challenges meant listening to two impulses: our own dreams for what the festival might become, and the desires of our audiences and artists. Sometimes those two ideals conflict. Most of the time they’re hard to deliver and it’s always chasing that perfection.  Accepting you’ll never get there is what keeps you getting better and accepting “The Long Game” (alternative title: You’ll Never Get Rich Doing This) means not adopting smash and grab policies, not treating people as income streams, and always honouring the intention. We are constantly reminding ourselves why are we doing this and that is what keep us going toward perfection.


    We are on a good path to achieve our goal however we need your help. Please share our idea with your friends, everyone who donates can expect an authentic gift as a thank you for your support.
story_txt: About us and our regionBor is a town in Eastern Serbia mainly associated with its big mining industry that once used to thrive and fuel the whole country's economy. The economic  and political turmoil left after the fall of Yugoslavia had left the mining complex waiting for new investments. Less is known about our regions great natural gems such as Mountain Stol ( 18km), Lazar's Canyon and its surrounding caves ( 16km ), Lake Bor ( 18km ) and hot springs in Brestovacka Banja where our festival is located.  http://www.borizvazduha.rs/In a  town without an established annual event a group of like minded friends had recognized a great  potential for tourism and made a brave decision to organize a festival in 2016.As a location the organizers have chosen the abandoned swimming pools that where in use for only 3 years. story:
Hey there! My name is Jennifer and I'm the founder of DIYvinci.com . You can learn more about me on my website pennyjarrstudio.com or on my LinkedIn profile.

What is DIYvinci?

DIYvinci curates boxes of DIY projects, providing everything you need to get started on your masterpiece. We partner with suppliers across the globe to pack quality items into your boxes.

What is DIYvinci Studio?

DIYvinci Studio is an online social learning platform for arts and crafts and is currently in the early development phase. Coming soon at: studio.diyvinci.com

Why do you need my help?

Our goal with DIYvinci Studio is to make it not just our companies project, but a community project where users can interact with each other, learn, and grow their own art-related endeavors. 

We are a startup and would love to launch this platform with minimal debt so we can focus on brining our community the best resources.  

What would my donation go towards?

Your donation would go towards building the online platform and paying the instructors who are already diligently beginning to create content for our future students. 

What is your vision for the future of DIYvinci Studio?

Overall, the purpose of DIYvinci and DIYvinci Studio is to help people learn that it isn't difficult and that it is also fun to create art and crafts. It is my hope that through DIYvinci Studio, people will discover a new passion or learn something new about themselves that would inspire them to start a new hobby or business.

story:
Summary

Andrea Tsang Jackson is an award-winning quilter, textile artist and designer; Meaghan Smith is an award-winning songwriter and musician. Together we've created Our Song, Your Reflection to celebrate community through music and craft. The project gets to the core of what makes us tick as creatives — connecting people and connecting with people through our art. The campaign invites contributors to be a part of the "Your Reflection" music video, to increase offerings associated with the release of the song and the quilt pattern, and to celebrate the "us" in our communities.

What We Need & What You Get

The campaign goal is $20,000 CAD to cover the project costs. These include the music, video, and photography production; quilt design, sample making, pattern development and testing, sourcing 34 different fabrics to make fabric kits; marketing photography and extra campaign perks. We want to ensure that every person that is a part of the process is compensated for their efforts.

Through the campaign, you can get the song and pre-order the pattern and/or fabric kit. Other special campaign perks include a limited-edition enamel pin, a lyric art print, coffee dates with Andrea and quilting retreat instruction. These offerings will not be available to the public after the campaign ends.

Why?

When Andrea entered the quilting world in 2016, she found a community of supportive and generous people who find joy in their work and through connecting with other quilters. She wanted to draw that out and highlight what that means to her to find a place where you belong. Through this collaboration with Meaghan, she is able to celebrate it in a unique way — with words, music and a design that expresses exactly the sentiment that many people feel. The unique aspect of the project is the way that people can share images of their own community through the music video. We want to hear your stories about how being part of a community has impacted you — your quilting guild, your sewing friends, your hockey team, your running club, your family, whoever your people are.

Ways You Can Help

Gift the song or another perk to your friend, your quilty aunt, your crafty BFF, your people. Share the campaign with people outside the quilting world. We know that they have similar feelings about their communities and would love to hear their stories, too.

Finding a place where you belong is not an everyday thing. Let's celebrate the "us" in our lives.

  • More about Andrea: www.3rdstoryworkshop.com; Instagram: @3rdstoryworkshop
  • More about Meaghan: www.meaghansmith.com

Photos by Deborah Wong, Emma Poliquin

story:
Hello Everyone,

We are Philip Levine and Andreia Costa and are the curators of The Smallest Gallery in Soho, 62 Dean Street, London.

 

We are working with artists Helen Pearce and Dan Sansome to produce an exciting new art installation called New Progress which will be displayed during February and March 2018.

 

Soho in London has been a creative and diverse community for centuries, but it's rapidly changing. Alongside major redevelopment, the area has been taken over by offices, restaurants and shops, with very little creativity left. 

 

We aim to buck that trend by showing public art which engages, inspires and challenges the people who pass by.

And this is where we would love your support.

 

Titled New Progress, the work is intended to highlight the physical impacts on the landscape of the products we consume every day. Over 3 million hectares of forest are destroyed each year to produce cash crops such as coffee. 

 

The interior of the gallery will be completely lined in charred, blackened timber, with a pile of golden coffee beans in the centre. The work seeks to draw attention to the things we value as a society and the destruction this can cause. As a shop front in the heart of one of the world's commercial capitals, Dean Street is the ideal location for this project.

 

We need £4000 to make this project happen and we have wonderful perks to offer you for your support. The material from the installation will be reused to create smaller artworks, which you can receive in return for a donation to this campaign. Take a look on the right hand side to see these and other perks which you can receive for contributions from £5 to £300.

 

All funds will go towards the production of the artwork and promotion of the gallery in the local community.

Any contribution would be greatly appreciated, and please help us to share this campaign as widely as possible

 

Thank you for your support.

story:
There is no play like this on Broadway. Imagine being backstage with the King before he performed on the Ed Sullivan Show. Maybe you'd like to be in Germany when he met Priscilla for the first time? If you love Ann Margret, wouldn't it be great to be on the MGM lot as the King and Ann Margret met for the first time? All of these moments are captured in this play.

The story brings history alive and allows everyone to hear conversations the King likely had with himself and those closest to him. This is an artistic interpretation of the King’s internal conflicts he faced throughout his life and in love.

Like many Americans, I’ve been a fan of the King since my childhood. I can play his songs on the piano and sing his lyrics by heart. I’ve read biographies on him since my childhood. None of those books brought the King alive, like this play will do.

I’m a former Executive Producer with NBC and Senior Producer with CBS in New York, and author of a business book. I’ve been nominated for five Emmys and won an Emmy in the News & Public Affairs category. Story telling is my craft.

I believe this play will take viewers back in time, and allow them to relive the most monumental moments of the King’s life.

Bring the King to Broadway

Your donations will help bring this theatrical play to a New York stage. The typical Broadway production is financed by hedge funds and large investors. As a result, ticket prices are out-of-reach for the average American family.

We believe everyone should enjoy the theater. It heightens our mind and ignites new ideas, while bringing us together as a community. By crowdfunding, we are able to make this play affordable to everyone.

Your donation – small or large – will go directly to financing this off Broadway production. That includes paying for the theater, actors, rehearsals, legal fees, set design, music rights and marketing of the play so the seats are filled. A successful run on the small stage will ignite more interest from Broadway's biggest theaters.

What We Need & What You Get

We have many creative perks for your donation. They include:

  • Walk on role in the play – This is your chance to be on stage in an Off Broadway production.
  • Front row seats to the premiere – Tissues are included for those who experience any actor’s spit.
  • Co-producer credit – That’s right, you get your name on our website and if we win a Tony, you get credit in the award.
  • Tickets to the show – Let’s sell out this show with your help.
  • Tickets to a rehearsal – Listen to the director guide the actors behind closed doors.
  • T-Shirts – Limited edition vintage print of the preview show.
  • Tickets to the cast party - Bring some of your friends and meet other artsy, creative and fun people.
  • Autographed copy of the script – The playwright will sign a copy of the script.
  • Creative brainstorming session with the playwright – You and a friend have drinks with the playwright and discuss creativity and business.
  • A private show for 10 people – Create a special moment for your family and friends. Watch the show in the privacy
  • Advertisement space in the program – Introduce your business to theater goers.

If you love the King and want to relive his story, donate any amount. It will help bring his spirit alive. Like us Facebook and Instagram to follow our journey.

*Unfortunately, we aren't able to take donations from Tennessee. We will need to return any donations from that state if they are made. This theatrical play is not affiliated with  Elvis Presley Enterprises.

story:
About 'Arte Divina' book

Our artist's life commitment and dedication to art are immense. It resonates passion, beauty and intensity beyond words. Centred around the concept of creation and the act of creating. Like in religious tradition the one that creates is divine and of divine intention. Strictly focusing on inspiration, symbolism, philosophy, creativity and imagination. 

The double crosses symbolise the void or the abyss.
"If you look long enough into the abyss, the abyss begins to look back through you."
- Friedrich Nietzsche

The abyss is a kind of monster, the monster of complete cynicism and true nihilism - the empty man that post-modernism seems to favour. Pursuing an utter lack of beauty, life values and aesthetics leaves one empty, and perhaps incapable of recovering one's artistic nature. 'Arte Divina' greatly values beauty as an essential virtue of art. The double cross is a symbol that rebels against the apathy and the defeatist culture and post-modernism gave birth to this trend. When I was at University studying art and design we were taught how to deconstruct and to break down values, leaving no room for aesthetics or emotions with no appreciation for beauty.

"In an age of ugliness, a work of beauty is an act of defiance. At any time between 1750 and 1930, if you asked educated people to describe the aim of poetry, art or music, they would have replied “beauty.” And if you had asked for the point of that you would have learned that beauty is a value, as important as truth and goodness. Then in the 20th-century beauty stopped being important. Art increasingly aimed to disturb and to break moral taboos. It was not beauty but originality however achieved and at whatever moral cost that won the prizes. Not only has art made a cult of ugliness. Our language, our music and our manners are increasingly raucous, self-centred and offensive as though beauty and good taste have no real place in our lives."
- Sir Roger Scruton

Arte Divina book more to be announced

DAN HILLIER
TOMASZ ALEN KOPERA
DARIA ENDRESEN
ELIRAN KANTOR
ARTHUR BERZINSH
CRISTINA FRANCOV
NIKLAS SUNDIN
KIKYZ FERRER
SAM SHEARON
COSTIN CHIOREANU
ALEXANDRA V. BACH
HEIDI TAILLEFER
DUSTY PETERSON
CATRIN WELZ-STEIN
NATHALIA SUELLEN
VILLE LOPPONEN
KIM SOLVE
KIERAN WAKEMAN
JEROME OUDOT TREZ
IVICA STEVANOVIC

'Arte Divina' In approximate numbers
5 artists per week will be revealed
35% of the book profit will be split between all participating artists
40 total artists
200 pages
500 high-quality art images
500 we aim to reach this many prints, of course, the more the better

Book Specs
Hardback gloss finish
150gsm Silk Coated
260mm deep x 210mm wide
Hand numbered and embossed

About the magazine

Heavy Music Artwork 6th installation: Fire & Fantasy is centred around the concept of fantasy, imagination and escapism. No other genre of music explicitly displays such enthusiasm and passion for the fantastical. Both sombre and bright visions adorn album covers. And it goes without saying that bands share the same commitment to their music and lyrics. But we also ask, in the end, what makes metal real? We have taken the following artist into the rabbit hole: Arch Enemy, The Black Dahlia Murder, Thy Art Is Murder, Cradle of Filth, Cannibal Corpse, Wintersun, Belphegor, Accept, Enslaved, GWAR, Dan Goldsworthy, Peter Sallai, Gogo Melone, Claudio Bergamin, Peter Mohrbacher, Kris Verwimp, Andrei, Jean-Pascal Fournier, Alex Reisfar. 

Magazine Specs

  • Ethically sourced and FSC approved and using vegetable-based inks
  • Limited edition of 666 units hand numbered and stamp embossed
  • Perfect PUR binding on 250gsm (cover) Offset Paper
  • 100 pages
  • 2000 Total units printed 

What We Need
Your contribution will help us release the 'Arte Divina' book and launch the 6th issue of Heavy Music Magazine magazine and secure future releases, and is also a way to pre-sell before it hits the stores around the world. We are looking to raise a base of £5,000. This will help us with the release of both the magazine and the book and of course help with the running costs of having a project this complex materialize.

This is an estimate of our costs and where the funds will go towards

  • 35% of the book profit will be split between all participating artists
  • 30% Production costs
  • 20% Marketing
  • 18% Overheads
  • 25% Printing costs
  • 7% Campaign fees

Our awesome perks
Our perks are simple and include something for everyone, please see side panel. Perks images are also displayed in the gallery.

Vision & Mission

  • End post-modernism
  • Promote graphic artists, music artists
  • Entice people to explore and experience life within the arts
  • Examine through music, art, and literature all aspects of the human condition

The Impact

  • Your impact will not only benefit us as a publisher but the artists and the metal community as whole
  • We are dedicated to placing the magazine in places where you wouldn't normally see a metal magazine like art galleries and museums
  • Our work has helped young artists getting the attention they deserve as well as getting paid jobs from bands

About Us
Heavy metal is one of the most relevant and influential art forms and it must be celebrated as such, Heavy Music Artwork is the first to make this statement. Since our launch www.heavymusicartwork.com great popularity, reaching nearly 1 million page views, and 25,000+ monthly visitors. Promoted via all HMA social networks 80K+ Followers. Newsletter to 12K HMA email subscribers.

Labels and PRs that helped us along the way
Agonia Records, Century Media, Debemur Morti Productions, Earache, Indie Recordings, Lifeforce Records, Lion Music, Mascot Group, Massacre Records, Metal Blade, Napalm Records, Nuclear Blast, Peaceville, Pitch Black Records, Relapse, Season of Mist, Snapper Music, Southern Lord, SPV, Universal, Spinefarm, Warner Music, Svart Records.

Adrenaline PR, Asher Media, Audacious PR, Clawhammer PR, Cosa Nostra, Devil PR, Dewar PR, Domino Media, Duff Press, Earsplit, Factory Music, Fly PR, Future PR, I Like Press, Noble PR, Noise Cartel, Old Empire, Perfect Storm PR, Pioneer Music Press, Publicity PR, Rarely Unable, Red Sand PR, Savage Gringo, Scream Promotion, Silverblack, Stampede Press, Speakeasy PR, Stereo Sanctity, Team All About The Music, Visible Noise, Wilful Publicity and Work Hard PR.

What are the risks?
As with any project, there are risks involved in releasing a publication. We might not be able to deliver the end product on time, or we might run into problems with the printing and shipping. Our team has over 15 years in delivering creative projects of all sizes and shapes. We are already on the 2nd book and 6th magazine release.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: Ask your fellow metal head to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Please share and make the world know that metal is art in all its forms.
story_txt:
About 'Arte Divina' bookOur artist's life commitment and dedication to art are immense. It resonates passion, beauty and intensity beyond words. Centred around the concept of creation and the act of creating. Like in religious tradition the one that creates is divine and of divine intention. Strictly focusing on inspiration, symbolism, philosophy, creativity and imagination. The double crosses symbolise the void or the abyss."If you look long enough into the abyss, the abyss begins to look back through you." - Friedrich NietzscheThe abyss is a kind of monster, the monster of complete cynicism and true nihilism - the empty man that post-modernism seems to favour. Pursuing an utter lack of beauty, life values and aesthetics leaves one empty, and perhaps incapable of recovering one's artistic nature. 'Arte Divina' greatly values beauty as an essential virtue of art. The double cross is a symbol that rebels against the apathy and the defeatist culture and post-modernism gave birth to this trend. When I was at University studying art and design we were taught how to deconstruct and to break down values, leaving no room for aesthetics or emotions with no appreciation for beauty."In an age of ugliness, a work of beauty is an act of defiance. At any time between 1750 and 1930, if you asked educated people to describe the aim of poetry, art or music, they would have replied “beauty.” And if you had asked for the point of that you would have learned that beauty is a value, as important as truth and goodness. Then in the 20th-century beauty stopped being important. Art increasingly aimed to disturb and to break moral taboos. It was not beauty but originality however achieved and at whatever moral cost that won the prizes. Not only has art made a cult of ugliness. Our language, our music and our manners are increasingly raucous, self-centred and offensive as though beauty and good taste have no real place in our lives."- Sir Roger ScrutonArte Divina book more to be announcedDAN HILLIERTOMASZ ALEN KOPERADARIA ENDRESENELIRAN KANTORARTHUR BERZINSHCRISTINA FRANCOVNIKLAS SUNDINKIKYZ FERRERSAM SHEARONCOSTIN CHIOREANUALEXANDRA V. BACHHEIDI TAILLEFERDUSTY PETERSONCATRIN WELZ-STEINNATHALIA SUELLENVILLE LOPPONENKIM SOLVEKIERAN WAKEMANJEROME OUDOT TREZIVICA STEVANOVIC'Arte Divina' In approximate numbers5 artists per week will be revealed35% of the book profit will be split between all participating artists40 total artists200 pages500 high-quality art images500 we aim to reach this many prints, of course, the more the betterBook SpecsHardback gloss finish150gsm Silk Coated260mm deep x 210mm wideHand numbered and embossedAbout the magazineHeavy Music Artwork 6th installation: Fire & Fantasy is centred around the concept of fantasy, imagination and escapism. No other genre of music explicitly displays such enthusiasm and passion for the fantastical. Both sombre and bright visions adorn album covers. And it goes without saying that bands share the same commitment to their music and lyrics. But we also ask, in the end, what makes metal real? We have taken the following artist into the rabbit hole: Arch Enemy, The Black Dahlia Murder, Thy Art Is Murder, Cradle of Filth, Cannibal Corpse, Wintersun, Belphegor, Accept, Enslaved, GWAR, Dan Goldsworthy, Peter Sallai, Gogo Melone, Claudio Bergamin, Peter Mohrbacher, Kris Verwimp, Andrei, Jean-Pascal Fournier, Alex Reisfar. Magazine Specs
Ethically sourced and FSC approved and using vegetable-based inks
Limited edition of 666 units hand numbered and stamp embossed
Perfect PUR binding on 250gsm (cover) Offset Paper
100 pages
2000 Total units printed 
What We NeedYour contribution will help us release the 'Arte Divina' book and launch the 6th issue of Heavy Music Magazine magazine and secure future releases, and is also a way to pre-sell before it hits the stores around the world. We are looking to raise a base of £5,000. This will help us with the release of both the magazine and the book and of course help with the running costs of having a project this complex materialize.This is an estimate of our costs and where the funds will go towards
35% of the book profit will be split between all participating artists
30% Production costs
20% Marketing
18% Overheads
25% Printing costs
7% Campaign fees
Our awesome perksOur perks are simple and include something for everyone, please see side panel. Perks images are also displayed in the gallery.Vision & Mission
End post-modernism
Promote graphic artists, music artists
Entice people to explore and experience life within the arts
Examine through music, art, and literature all aspects of the human condition
The Impact
Your impact will not only benefit us as a publisher but the artists and the metal community as whole
We are dedicated to placing the magazine in places where you wouldn't normally see a metal magazine like art galleries and museums
Our work has helped young artists getting the attention they deserve as well as getting paid jobs from bands
About UsHeavy metal is one of the most relevant and influential art forms and it must be celebrated as such, Heavy Music Artwork is the first to make this statement. Since our launch www.heavymusicartwork.com great popularity, reaching nearly 1 million page views, and 25,000+ monthly visitors. Promoted via all HMA social networks 80K+ Followers. Newsletter to 12K HMA email subscribers.Labels and PRs that helped us along the wayAgonia Records, Century Media, Debemur Morti Productions, Earache, Indie Recordings, Lifeforce Records, Lion Music, Mascot Group, Massacre Records, Metal Blade, Napalm Records, Nuclear Blast, Peaceville, Pitch Black Records, Relapse, Season of Mist, Snapper Music, Southern Lord, SPV, Universal, Spinefarm, Warner Music, Svart Records.Adrenaline PR, Asher Media, Audacious PR, Clawhammer PR, Cosa Nostra, Devil PR, Dewar PR, Domino Media, Duff Press, Earsplit, Factory Music, Fly PR, Future PR, I Like Press, Noble PR, Noise Cartel, Old Empire, Perfect Storm PR, Pioneer Music Press, Publicity PR, Rarely Unable, Red Sand PR, Savage Gringo, Scream Promotion, Silverblack, Stampede Press, Speakeasy PR, Stereo Sanctity, Team All About The Music, Visible Noise, Wilful Publicity and Work Hard PR.What are the risks?As with any project, there are risks involved in releasing a publication. We might not be able to deliver the end product on time, or we might run into problems with the printing and shipping. Our team has over 15 years in delivering creative projects of all sizes and shapes. We are already on the 2nd book and 6th magazine release.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: Ask your fellow metal head to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Please share and make the world know that metal is art in all its forms.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Abbey Hunter and ever since I graduated with a degree in metalsmithing, I've wanted to open a public metals studio for artists. I saw the need for it while in college and wanted to find a way where other artists can continue having a space with not only access to tools but also a great community for support. We had an incubation period at a local community space for a few years but we needed to branch out and get our own building!

The Hot Spot is incredibly important to myself as well as our growing number of metalsmiths here in Grand Rapids, MI. This campaign will help bring our new space to completion now that we have our own brick and mortar location. It will finish our lower level which is currently down to the studs. We can then officially open our doors to the public and maintain business studio hours where folks can rent a bench and have complete access by the hour or monthly memberships. Classes and workshops will be available for those wanting to learn the basics of jewelry making or expand upon more advanced techniques. Finally, this will be a place where we offer gallery space to show off the work of our studio artists and outside metalsmiths as well.

It is my absolute goal to make this the perfect community space for metalsmiths and creatives to gather, network, and learn. This is a space to hone in on the business side of being a professional artist. Access and education to the business side of being an independent artist.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $20,000 to get this space proper and up to code. Our lower level is completely gutted down to the stud frames. A lot needs to be done but we have many helping hands.

This will help us with:

  • Electrical for all walls ($3,000)
  • Plumbing ($2,000)
  • Drywall ($2,000)
  • Flooring ($2,000)
  • Sinks ($500)
  • Counter tops ($1,000)
  • Full bathroom ($7,000)
  • Fire alarm/security system ($1,000)
  • Equipment: metal shears + ring stretcher ($1,200)

 

The AWESOME things you get:

  • Social Media Shout Out- Our love and affection on Facebook and Instagram
  • Forever Immortalization on our website "Friends of the Forge" page
  • A vinyl BOPP (high quality) sticker with our anvil logo
  • Metal lapel pin anvil logo
  • "FORGE ON" t-shirt with logo printed by Citizen Shirt
  • Member Party with 1 month and 3 month membership options
  • Workshops
  • Jewelry, handcrafted and donated by fellow metalsmiths
  • GreenLion Saw frames by BJ Johnson

 

The Impact

I've had my studio growing since 2012. In that time we've grown in members and those interested in learning more about metalsmithing. It's time now for our studio to have an even greater place in the community of arts here in Grand Rapids. This is the first major leap to a start of something better. Making it a success here means that our studio can have the driving force down the road for new avenues of education by having our studio support local initiatives with the youth through the arts. Our studio wants individuals to gain momentum and knowledge for setting their career as an artist. This will involve working with other programs in the community for business education and the arts such as GROW, Avenue for the Arts, The Creative Many, UICA, GRAM, WMCAT, Michigan Small Business Development Center and others.

Risks & Challenges

As an artist and entrepreneur, I've had to take on a lot of roles to maintain and grow my businesses. I've gone through local programs for business education and events put on through the Avenue for the Arts that cater specifically towards artists who want to learn marketing, accounting, and procuring the ideal business plan. It's frightening to always take the next step, especially ones as risky as starting up a brick and mortar business. Luckily, I have great mentors that keep me informed and also a fantastic support team that wants to see myself and this studio succeed. A lot of makers rely on this space and what I offer to make a living and loving career of their own with what they create.

Other Ways You Can Help

The best way to help if you can't donate is by spreading the word! We would love it if everyone could spread the word of our campaign and our studio. This includes email lists, Facebook, Instagram, word of mouth, even Twitter.
