story:
About

 

Decades go by and we are now facing quite an alarming social situation. Each day 1000 people are killed by shooting around the world. The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has recorded 36 252 deaths by firearm in 2015. This number includes 22 000 suicides. What urgent measures must be taken to stop this plague? How can I, can we contribute to reducing the number of firearms thus making the cities more secure? The implication of each citizen around the globe is essential, individual awareness must become a collective movement which will prevail over lobbies and the handful of politicians who ignore repeated requests, often made following a mass shooting and coming from all levels of the population, regardless of their social class, political opinion, and age. Staying a mere spectator not being an option, it is up to me, to you, to us to initiate a citizen disarmament, via a highly symbolical artistic project as this my field of expertise. This project requires a collective force as without you it will not exist. Give life to Color of State! 

 

How to participate in the citizen disarmament?

Stanley Février, the artist behind Color of State, has initiated a reflection for several years now, which led to various installations in public areas and related to violence carried out by firearm owners. One of them entitled “1927” resulted in a controversy. Presented at the 2015 Festival Art Souterrain, at the Complexe Guy-Favreau in Montreal, it created a huge stir amongst the civil servants working in this governmental building. They asked for its removal, considering that the installation was inappropriate and embarrassing due to its subject. On the wall, behind the desk of an administrator, were installed white porcelain guns molded from actual firearms types. The number of these guns equaled the number of the killer’s victims at the Bath Consolidated School, the first of a much too long list of mass shootings in the United States.

 

Color Of State positions itself as a tool to stimulate a real social change through the acquisition of porcelain firearms. The choice of the material symbolizes the fragility of our lives, of those ripped out of the victims. As for the shape, it reduces to nothing the usual function of a firearm. Stanley Février invites you wherever you live, to become players in the global disarmament, leading to peace and to life by acquiring these porcelain guns, unarmed and with no trigger.

 

Stanley Février, 1927, Festival Art Souterrain, Montréal 2015

 

Through this art project, Stanley Février has the ambition of awakening the collective conscience sleeping within each of us so that we become players in our own future. That the “Never again” chanted after his mass killing become reality. The artist wishes that this project become the occasion to take the floor, to create a dialogue, questioning the issue of violence due to firearms, specifically through meetings to be envisioned and initiated within the public space. Source :http://2015.artsouterrain.com/fr/stanley-fevrier/#artist-2193

 

To achieve this, your participation is not only necessary, but it is also essential, the project existing only through a collective social commitment. Color of State is designed to become a global artwork, commemorating the 190 848 victims by firearm that occurred in US between 2012 and 2018. This will take form through the conception and production of porcelain guns with no triggers. But this campaign will serve to produce the first 20 000 porcelains objects.

Our lives should not be dependent on someone who decides to end it. None of us should die at school, at work, in a movie theatre, on the street etc. This movement of citizen disarmament is also a way to reflect on the value of our life and bring us to progressively eliminate firearms from our homes, through awareness so that cities can return to being living spaces where mass shootings are no longer a concern.

Without you this project will remain at the conception stage. Henceforth, it belongs to you to act, you are the main players in the implementation of this COLLABORATIVE PROJECT FOR SOCIAL CHANGE.

Since the beginning of 2018 and in Toronto only, there have been 220 mass shootings with at least 27 deaths. In the United States, during the last 18 years (1999 - 2016) mass shootings are responsible for 572 537 deaths with an average of 31 808 per year. In the United States, on average 7 children are killed per day by bullet.

 

 

History clearly shows us that Canada is not immune to such events. Let us remember the drama at the Polytechnique, Concordia and Dawson College in Montreal. The most recent happened in Toronto this summer while another happened in a mosque in Quebec City in 2017. According to the RCMP, 88  78 firearms are owned in Canada, of which 92 746 in Quebec.  

 

 

The project

Together, lets us launch a global movement of citizen disarmament, in response to mass shootings. An essential social change!

 

This initiative, launched by artist Stanley Février, consists in creating a global movement of citizen disarmament, motivated by the necessity to question the purpose of owning guns at home for personal instead of professional use. It is aimed at making the existence of a peaceful world possible, at guarding against using firearms on innocent people, at fighting against the violation of human rights. This project also wants to appoint all citizens as active players in the restriction of owning firearms. It is essential to collectively embark on this project to considerably reduce the number of mass shootings and armed domestic violence.  

With firearms sales revenue of 401 billion dollars each year, it is difficult to hope for a public challenge of gun ownership. Nevertheless, we cannot stay inactive, under the pretence that the sale of firearms is economically profitable, as we are faced with the horrors perpetrated daily and that could affect any one of us at any moment.  

 

Color Of State requires your participation to launch this movement of citizen disarmament. Your donations will help cover the expenses related to the technical and logistical aspects of the production of the unarmed porcelain guns and to the development of the project on a global scale. Your support will help with the broadcasting, the recognition and the globalization of Color of State, instrument of social change.

 

Prototypes of the porcelain guns with no triggers have already been created, we need your financial support to carry out the full production.  

 

In 2017, at the World Design Summit in Montreal, Stanley Février presented an installation mimicking a firearm store, selling white porcelain guns with no triggers and representing the six mass shootings with the greatest number of victims, five of those occurring in schools in the U.S. and one in Quebec: Bath Consolidated School (1927), Virginia Tech University (2007), Sandy Hook (2012), Luby’s (1991), Austin Texas University Walther (1966) et Polytechnique (1989). Each crime was committed with a type of firearm that the artist reproduced by moulding them to create porcelain objects with no triggers.

A firearm being an object of fear and of power, using the immaculate color and the material of white porcelain confronts the symbolic dimension of an object of death that the fragility of the porcelain deconstructs, making it non-functional. Owning a porcelain gun dismantles the purpose of a firearm, giving it a magical side and raising a discussion on the second amendment. It also, by its fragility, reminds gun owners that they hold the power to take someone’s life and how the latter is so fragile.

 

Exhibition view from World Design Summit - Montreal 2017

 

Exhibition view from World Design Summit - Montreal 2017

 

Exhibition view from World Design Summit - Montreal 2017

 

Exhibition view from World Design Summit - Montreal 2017

 

Exhibition view from World Design Summit - Montreal 2017

 

Join the Color of State movement by acquiring a porcelain sculpture with no trigger. Arm yourself with the symbol of the fight against stolen lives. Each one of us can make a difference. Let us bring together and put into action our power as citizens, condemning the harmful impact of gun ownership and requesting the adoption of new laws protecting the life of all citizens in the public and private space.

 

Color of State urges you to:

1-         Write to your Member of Parliament or to your Congressman, asking him or her to introduce legislation in favor of non-ownership of firearms for personal use.

2-         Dispose of your firearms (bringing them to the local police).

3-         Renounce your legal right to bear arms.

4-         Take part in public interventions organized by Color of State.

5-         Acquire a « firearm for peace » in porcelain and with no trigger.

 

Why social financing?

 

A social financing campaign appears to be the best tool in this case, considering the global scope of the project. It is essential that we reach the biggest number of people around the globe. The financial aspect of the project will result in its realization: therefore we need your support to overcome this obstacle and together carry out this collective project. This is precisely at the heart of the project. It all comes full circle; Color of State depends on you.  

We also consider that Indiegogo plays an active role in the development of social oriented projects which encourages individuals to participate while also providing them with a sense of security.

 

With the sale of each sculpture, $2 will be donated to the following charities: Amnistie International, Poly se souvient, Book Alimentaire, Oxfam Québec, CLINIQUE MOBILE MONTRÉAL, Enfant du Globe, Sandy Hook Promise, Anida France and Guns Archives. Also, after the Color of State project, i will create two foundations: one endorsing humanitarian causes and the other to support art and culture; to continue to make changes in the lives of thousands of people, thanks to your gifts and your purchases. I sincerely thank you for your commitment to this movement of citizen disarmament and a world without a trigger.

 

 

Team

 

Ariane-Li Simard-Côté

As a committed artist, Ariane-Li has a strong background as professional actress since over 25 years, on stage, as well as in movies, television series, advertising campaigns, documentary narration and voice acting. As an entrepreneur she brought to life Shoroom°, Erisma and For Better & For Earth, chairing on multiple boards where she created many innovative initiatives like CREATR°, J’M l’Art, Le Lobby and Projet A144.

She owns and manage brands related to international clients, like the Paris Design Summit, through the World Design Agency, collaborating on the World Sustainable Design Framework: Horizon 2030

To her, Color of State, that she produced in the Sincocium: Art & design exhibition at the World Design Summit 2017 via Erisma, is more than an artwork: it is a vital action to raise awareness towards a more peaceful tomorrow, listening to the real needs of citizens, that ought to be educated and disarmed.

 

Cluca

After graduating with a Master’s degree in Sociology, Cluca began her artistic practice in 2004. Her paintings, drawings, photographs or installations discuss the notions of identity, memory, transmissions ... Her recent works reflect the mirror of reality: the exclusion of Others, the failure and the incapacity of the political sphere elected to respond humanely to inhumanity.

Trapped, her characters wrapped themselves into masks of anonymity so that a semblance of freedom remains. The artist specifies that wearing a mask following the footsteps of Greeks tragedians could help us to reconcile with a space of freedom where to be recognized, categorized, classified, etc., would be meaningless and wouldn’t be possible because of the mask we would wear on our face mask.

 

Stanley Février 

Stanley Février questions dramas, sociopolitical and economic issues, reflecting on the value of life in the context of globalization. Through his interventions, he tried to create a space to meet and reflect, where the public can become active players and interfere in completing the artwork, by constructing their personal stories and the universality of human suffering.

In 2018, Stanley Février received a Master degree in Visual and Media Art from the Université du Québec à Montréal (UQAM).  His work has been presented in New York, Cuba and Hong Kong also in France, Germany, China, Bulgaria, Spain, Serbia, Mexico and Canada.

Her recent works reflect the mirror of reality: the exclusion of Others, the failure and the incapacity of the political sphere elected to respond humanely to inhumanity.Trapped, her characters wrapped themselves into masks of anonymity so that a semblance of freedom remains. The artist specifies that wearing a mask following the footsteps of Greeks tragedians could help us to reconcile with a space of freedom where to be recognized, categorized, classified, etc., would be meaningless and wouldn’t be possible because of the mask we would wear on our face mask. Stanley Février Stanley Février questions dramas, sociopolitical and economic issues, reflecting on the value of life in the context of globalization. Through his interventions, he tried to create a space to meet and reflect, where the public can become active players and interfere in completing the artwork, by constructing their personal stories and the universality of human suffering.In 2018, Stanley Février received a Master degree in Visual and Media Art from the Université du Québec à Montréal (UQAM).  His work has been presented in New York, Cuba and Hong Kong also in France, Germany, China, Bulgaria, Spain, Serbia, Mexico and Canada.
